loans.name: María Doris

texts.es:
María es una mujer humilde que trabaja como empleada doméstica, pero hace unos meses empezó a vender mercancía por encargo, para incrementar sus ingresos y cubrir sus gastos familiares. María utilizará el crédito para comprar mercancía al por mayor (blusas, camisas, jeans) y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes otros productos diferentes, con el fin de ser referenciada con otras personas y así generar más oportunidades de progreso para ella y su familia.
El sueño de María es generar empleo para otras personas necesitadas, que puedan salir adelante a través de la compra y venta de mercancías.
texts.en:
Maria is a humble woman who works as a household employee, though a few months ago she began to sell merchandise by order to increase her income and cover her family spending. Maria will use this loan to purchase wholesale merchandise (blouses, shirts, jeans) and to be able to offer her customers other different products. She aims to be referenced by other people and that way generate more opportunities for her and her family to progress. 

Maria's dream is to generate work for other people in need who would be able to get ahead through the purchase and sale of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise (blouses, shirts, jeans).

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana tiene 42años, casada con tres hijos de las edades de 15, 13 y tres  años, ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Ana,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa al por mayor  según la temporada y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Ana enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is 42 years old and married with three children aged 15, 13 and three. She is dedicated to the sale of a variety of clothing, which she sells in different markets in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first sequence in the institution. Señora Ana is going to use this loan for the purchase of wholesale clothing according to the season and therefore supply her business. 

Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her merchandise. She confronts competitive challenges in her business and she is going to use the benefits to continue purchasing merchandise and this way generate more economic income. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity that she is given to grow in her sector, improve her income and thus the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es una mujer muy dedicada a sus estudios, comenta que se esfuerza mucho para poder sobresalir y de esa forma ser una buena profesional.
Está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, la cual termina este año, y que con mucho sacrificio está llegando a término. Quiere ser una profesional útil a las demás personas y a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en los gastos de su tesis, lo cual es muy costoso y quiere poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ana lives in Encarnacion and is a woman very dedicated to her studies.  She says that she works very hard to be able to keep up so that she can become a good professional.

She is studying for a commercial engineering degree that she will earn this year and is doing it with great sacrifice.  She wants to become a helpful professional for others and for society.

She is asking for this loan to pay her thesis expenses, which are very expensive and she wants to be able to cover her expenses.  She is grateful for this opportunity and will continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her thesis.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El señor Rene de 23 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura y vive en Monteagudo, no tiene hijos dependientes y vive en la casa de sus padres, sus principales actividades son la agricultura y la venta de maíz dekal que lo realiza una vez durante el año y también siembra poroto realizando dos cosechas anuales, la siembra la realiza en los terrenos de su padre y también en terrenos alquilados para así tener mejores ingresos. Trabaja arduamente para cubrir sus gastos  de alimentación, ropa, servicios básicos y otros gastos en los que incurre su familia. Ahora requiere un crédito para la refacción de encerrado de terreno perimetral, ya que es muy necesario para que tenga protección y de tal modo una campaña agrícola muy buena, de esa forma lograra cubrir los gastos que tiene durante el proceso de producción y mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Rene is 23 years old, a farmer, and lives in Montenegro.  He doesn’t have any dependent children and lives with his parents.  His main activities are farming and sales of corn, which he does once a year.  He also plants kidney beans and has two harvests a year on rented land so that he can have a better income.  He works arduously so he can feed and clothe his family and provide for the basic services and other family expenses.  Now he needs a loan to repair his perimeter fence because he needs it for protection and to have a good farming campaign.  He will be able to cover his expenses this way and will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his fence.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.ru:
Елена торгует на центральном рынке своего родного города Мелитополя. Она занята в сфере торговли уже 16 лет. Торгует она женской одеждой, место торговли у нее собственное. Елена разведена, у нее есть взрослый сын. 
Елена надеется пополнить свои финансовые резервы за счет помощи от КИВА в размере 5 000 гривен, чтобы закупить сезонную женскую одежду под реализацию, а именно футболки, кофты и халаты.
texts.en:
Yelena is in the sales business at her native Melitopol's main market.  She has been in sales for 16 years.  She sells women's clothing and she owns her sales stall.  Yelena is divorced and she has an adult son.

Yelena is hoping to refill her financial reserves through a Kiva loan of 5,000 hryvnia (UAH), in order to buy seasonal women's clothing, namely t-shirts, jackets, and dressing gowns.

loans.use: to purchase spring women's clothing for sale at the market

loans.name: Lokeru

texts.en:
Lokeru trades in livestock and his business has been profitable. He is 50 years old, married and together with his spouse, has been blessed with seven children. He currently earns a monthly income of 150,000 KES. He will be using this loan to buy livestock for resale. He will use the generated profits to grow his livestock business. 

This is his fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he has paid his previous loans back successfully. In the future, he hopes to be successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: Susy Zulema

texts.es: La señora  Susy tiene 38 años y 2 hijos  de las edades de 13 y 10 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en uno de los mercados en la misma zona por donde ella vive,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de una compresora para el taller de su esposo, él es mecánico y necesita esta herramienta para su trabajo, la señora Susy es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y el deseo que tiene es poder ver a su esposo con un taller más amplio y así poder mejorar sus ingresos de él y de su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Susy is 38 years old and has two children who are 13 and 10 years old. She makes a living selling food in a stall at one of the markets in the same neighborhood that she lives in.

The loan will be used to buy a compressor for her husband's workshop. He is a mechanic and he needs this tool for his work.

Susy is a hardworking person who has worked in her business for several years. She is very grateful to the institution for the support that has been offered to her as it is the only business that supports her family. Her dream is to see her husband with a bigger workshop so that he can improve his income and that of the family.

loans.use: to buy a compressor for her husband's workshop.

loans.name: Tillo

texts.ru: Тилло хотя и необразованная,но мудрая по жизни женщина, проживающая в районе Шахритус. Ей 52 года. У нее четверо взрослых детей. На протяжении 20 лет Тилло обеспечивает свою семью за счет своего торгового бизнеса. Она несмотря на холод или жару каждый день без выходных выходит на рынок, чтобы продавать свой товар. Тилло занимается продажей фруктов и всегда предлагает покупателям свежие и качественные фрукты.  В данный момент Тилло обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить новую партию фруктов. Этот кредит ей нужен для увеличения ассортимента и продажи товара.
texts.en: Although Tillo does not have a formal education, she is a wise woman who graduated from the university of life.  She is 52 years old and lives in the Shahrituz region.  For 20 years, Tillo has provided for her family with her sales business.  Whether hot or cold, every day, seven days a week, she goes to the market to sell her goods.  Tillo sells fruit and always offers for sale fresh and good-quality fruits.   Tillo applied for a loan in order to buy a new shipment of fruits.  She needs the loan in order to expand the varieties of fruits she sells and to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.en: Hurmat is a widowed woman with two adult children. She lives with her children in a house that was built with the great dedication of her husband. Hurmat has her own business growing wheat, watermelon, carrots, maize, etc. She also has a greenhouse where she grows greens and cucumbers. She has been busy with this business for more than 20 years. Hurmat is going to make a new sowing, but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy fuel and to pay for rental workers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fuel and to pay for rental workers.

loans.name: Lemmarie

texts.en: Lemmarie is studying criminology in a university and wants to become successful in the future. Her parents earn money from working as laborers and her mother owns a sari-sari store for a living. She has two siblings, and she wants them to have better careers. Lemmarie was determined to finish her course in order to gain a better job and wants to help her parents when they get old. She had joined GDMPC and borrowed a loan to cover school allowances and miscellaneous expenses. She is thankful enough to GDMPC for being a part of her journey.

loans.use: to cover school allowances and miscellaneous expenses.

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: Dan is a 23-year-old single man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the selling of clothes as his main source of income, alongside a bar business as his side source of income. He started this business to earn a living and have better standards of living. He faces challenges of competition, especially during festive seasons, price changes and seasonal customers. He is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yea

texts.en: Living in the rural area of the Srey Snom District of Siem Reap Province, Yea is 46 years old and married with four children. Yea is a rice farmer. Having been in this business for 26 years, Yea is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. Yea is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is requesting a loan to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Nhor

texts.en:
Nhor is 49 years old and married. She lives in a wooden house located in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has four children. The main sources of family income are raising pigs, selling grocery items, and also selling clothes. Nhor has been in these businesses for 29 years. Her current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

This is the first microloan for Nhor with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Karamatkan

texts.ru: Караматкан 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 8 детей. Семья большая, дружная и оптимистичная. Три дочери замужем, три сына находятся на заработках в Росси, с родителями проживают младший сын и дочь, а также 2 внука, помогают по хозяйству. У Караматкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Караматкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Караматкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 10 дойных коров, 2 быка, 6 бычков, 3 теленка и 1 лошадь. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Караматкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота и для получения дополнительного дохода от молока. Молоко будет сдавать скупщикам, что увеличит доходы семьи и Караматкан со своей семьей сможет завершить строительство недостроенного дома.
texts.en:
Karamatkan is 51 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising eight children.  Theirs is a big, friendly, and optimistic family.  Three of their daughters are married; three sons work in Russia, and the youngest son and daughter live at home, along with two grandchildren, and help with the business.  Karamatkan has a secondary level education and her family's main source of income is the animal husbandry business she started 13 years ago with a purchase of 20,000 som (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Karamatkan has 10 milk cows, two bulls, six bull-calves, three calves, and one horse.  Her monthly income amounts to 20,000 som (KGS).  

With an aim to further developing her business, Karamatkan applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd and for earning additional income from selling their milk.  She will sell the milk to wholesalers and this will increase the family's income and Karamatkan will be able to finish building their house.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a sixty-seven-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He sells cow salts as his main source of income alongside livestock. He started this business to provide for his family. He has personal goals of educating his children and opening up outlets in other parts of Kamwenge.
 
His main hardships are high competition and inadequate capital to meet increasing demand. He hopes to own a wholesale cow salt store. Godfrey intends to use this loan to buy more cow salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cow salt to sell.

loans.name: Neath's Group

texts.en:
Neath, aged 52, lives in a rural village of the Damabe district of Kampong Cham province. She has two children. Neath and her husband have been growing cassava and raising pigs. She earns about 50,000 KHR per day and has engaged in this business for 27 years.
 
Neath has completed three loan cycles and completely paid back her past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Neath, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy piglets and pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Katin

texts.en:
Katin is a divorced woman from Brnakot village of the Syuniq region. She lives with her retired parents and has been running a farm for 16 years. The farm currently includes 4 cows, 14 chickens and some calves. She also cultivates wheat, potatoes and cabbage. Near the house where Katin and her parents live, they also own a beautiful orchard where nut, apple and pear trees are grown. As agribusiness is the only source of income for this family, Katin works hard to produce a good harvest and provide normal living conditions for her parents.

By applying for this loan Katin asks for financial support to be able to purchase 3 calves and livestock forage. This will help her enlarge her farm and she will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for 3 calves and livestock forage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gulkhumor

texts.ru:
Гулхумор начинающий предприниматель из района Хамадони. Она 35-летняя замужняя женщина со своими целями и взглядами на жизнь. Гулхумор имеет двух дочерей и двух сыновей. Ее муж работает счетоводом в цехе по производству коржей. Сама Гулхумор домохозяйка. Все эти годы она следила за воспитанием детей и за порядком в доме. Теперь когда уже ее дети подросли, она решила заняться собственным делом. Гулхумор всегда мечтала иметь свой маленький продуктовый магазин. Теперь уже когда ей ничто не мешает она хочет реализовать свою мечту. Гулхумор уже приобрела удобное помещение для магазина и сейчас она занята оформлением магазина. Однако для купли товара у Гулхумор совсем не осталось сбережений. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит. Гулхумор на сумму кредита планирует полностью закупить продукты питания и заполнив полки наконец-то открыть свой магазин. 
Благодаря кредиту ее долгожданная мечта исполнится и к тому же она обеспечит себя работой.
texts.en:
Gulkhumor is a beginning entrepreneur from the Hamadoni region.  She is 35 years old, married, and she has her own goals and her own outlook on life.  Gulkhumor has two daughter and two sons.  Her husband works as a book-keeper in a cake factory.  Gulkhumor takes care of their home and children.  For all these years, she has looked after their children's upbringing and ensured a clean house.  Now that her children have grown up a bit, she wants to open her own business.  She has long dreamed of owning a grocery store and now she has the time to make her dream come true.  

Gulkhumor has already acquired a good location and now she is getting the store itself ready.  However, she doesn't have enough savings left to buy an inventory.  It is for this that she is requesting a loan.  Gulkhumor plans to use the entire amount of the loan for purchasing grocery items and having filled the shelves, to finally open the store.  Thanks to the loan, her long-awaited dream will come true and besides, she will have a good job.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to open a store

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар жительница одного из гостеприимных районов Шахритуса. Ей 55 лет. Она живет на районе Шахритуз вместе с сыном, дочкой и внуком. Дочь занимается шитьем национальной одежды на заказ. Сама Дилбар на протяжении 7 лет занимается продажей одежды на местном рынке. Дилбар привозит товар из рынка города и перепродает на рынке района. Для Дилбар данная работа является хорошим источником дохода, чтобы прокормить семью. На данный момент у Дилбар имеются финансовые трудности, и она решилась обратиться за кредитом, чтобы привести новый товар и сохранить доходность от деятельности. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку. Поддержите ее.
texts.en: Dilbar is a resident of one of the hospitable regions of Shahrituz.  She is 55 years old.  She lives in the area of Shahrituz with her son, daughter, and grandson.  Her daughter sews traditional clothing to order.  Dilbar has been selling clothes at the local market for 7 years.  Dilbar brings goods from the city market and re-sells it at the regional market.  For Dilbar, this work is a good source of income, allowing her to provide for her family.  Dilbar has fallen on some financial difficulties, and so decided to take out a loan to purchase new goods to maintain the profitability of her business.  She is hoping for your support.  Please support her.

loans.use: To purchase goods and save her business

loans.name: Oysara

texts.en: Oysara was born in 1976. She is married and has 5 children. Her children are non-adults and her mother-in-law and father-in-law live with her family. They are pensioners.  Oysara started her own business 10 years ago growing vegetables. She grows wheat, watermelon, maize, tomatoes, etc. on 2.25 hectares of land. She works hard and tries to produce high quality harvests. Oysara’s sister-in-law helps her manage the business and she is going to sew a new crop. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and fuel. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and fuel

loans.name: Bisaida

texts.ru:
Бисаида 54 летняя женщина,мать 4х детей. Живет со своей семьей и невесткой. У них  очень дружная семья. В молодости Бисаида не смогла учиться и получить образования так как в ее семье были большие трудности с денежными средствами. Но мама Бисаиды научила ее печь вкусные национальные лепешки. На сегодняшний день Биисаида этим делом зарабатывает себе на жизнь.
Бисаида   работает в частном цехе по производству национальных лепешек и хорошо подрабатывает,помогает мужчинам в доме в семейном бюджете. Ей ее работа очень нравиться. Дочки Бисаиды тоже ей помогают в ее деле.  Бисаида скоро  собирается женить последнего сына и накопила немного денег, но так как это большой праздник и к этому мероприятию каждая таджикская семья готовится несколько лет,ей все же пришлось обратится в организацию Арванд  за финансовой поддержкой. Ей предложили её знакомые об услугах  Арванд и она запрашивает   кредит  на подготовку свадьбы. Бисаида планирует купить преданное своему сыну. Она надеется,что в Арванде ей помогут и финансово поддержат.
texts.en:
Bisaida is 54 years old and the mother of four children.  She lives with her family and her daughter in law.  They have a very close-knit family.  As a young woman, Bisaida was not able to go to school and earn an education because her family had many troubles with money.  But her mother taught her to bake delicious traditional flat breads.  She has been in this line of work for all her life.  She works in a private bakery that specializes in traditional flat breads and earns a good income.  She helps the men in her family with the house and with the family budget.  She really enjoys her work.  Bisaida's daughter also helps her bake.  

Bisaida will soon be marrying off her last son and she has saved up a little money.  Since a wedding is an important affair, every Tajik family starts to get ready several years in advance.  Nonetheless, Bisaida still needed to apply to MDO Arvand for a loan for financial support.  She was referred to MDO Arvand by acquaintances and she is requesting the loan to prepare for the wedding.  Bisaida is planning to buy her son's bride token.  She hopes that MDO Arvand will help her with this financial support.

loans.use: to buy a bride token for her son's wedding

loans.name: Sanovbar

texts.ru:
Сановбар замужняя женщина в возрасте 38 лет. Она с семьей живет на районе Дж.Руми. Сановбар хочет открыть свой бизнес. Она намерена получить кредит и начать выращивать мелких скотов.
  Большая часть населения Таджикистана с давних времен занималась сельскохозяйственными деятельностями. Скотоводства и земледелия посей день остается популярным в Таджикистане. Потому что 93% государство занимает горы и предприятия и компании находятся только на равнинах. Основным источником дохода для жителей горных земель посей день остается сельскохозяйственными. 
    Сановбар пользуясь климатом родных мест, хочет начать и продолжить заниматься данной деятельностью. Климат и природа Таджикистана вполне способствует здоровому росту животных и растений. Сановбар надеется, что ей помогут начать деятельность и она сможет помочь мужу обеспечить семью.
texts.en: Sanovbar is a married woman and is 38 years old.  She and her family live in J. Rumy.  Sanovbar wants to open her own business - she intends to take out a loan and to start raising sheep.  A large portion of the population of Tajikistan has, since ancient times, engaged in agricultural activities.  Because 93% of the state is covered in mountains, and because businesses are located only on the plains, animal husbandry and farming continue to be popular in Tajikistan.  To this day, agriculture remains the major source of income for people living in the mountains.  Sanovbar, using the climate of her native land, wants to start and to continue to engage in such pursuits.  The climate and nature of Tajikistan promote the healthy growth of plants and animals.  Sanovbar hopes that, with help, she can begin these activities, and that she can help her husband provide for their family.

loans.use: to start an animal husbandry business and to purchase a lamb

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
Шаходат пожилая жительница района Спитамен, ей 66 лет. Многие годы она работала учительницей в средней школе. В селе все ее уважают за мудрость и справедливость. Она всегда поддержит любого обратившегося к ней за помощью своими мудрыми советами. 
Сейчас Шаходат решила на старости лет обеспечить себя работой. Ее интересует бизнес по откорму и продаже скота. Проблем с кормом у нее не будет, так как ее семья арендует земельный участок, где каждый год сажают зерновые культуры и кукурузу. В качестве начального капитала Шаходат сейчас имеет коровник и корм для скота (сено, солому, кукурузник). Она запрашивает в кредит 2000 долларов США, чтобы приобрести трех голов крупнорогатого скота хорошей породы. Шаходат верит, что ее возраст не будет помехой и ей дадут шанс показать себя в новом деле.
texts.en: Shahodat, at 66 years old, is an elderly resident of Spitamen.  She worked for many years as a middle school teacher.  In her village she is respected by all for her wisdom and prudence.  She always provides anyone who turns to her for assistance with her sage advice.  Now, in her later years, Shahodat has decided to provide for herself by working.  She is interested in raising and selling cattle.  She will not have trouble with feed because her family rents a plot of land, on which they grow grain and corn.  Shahodat already has a barn and feed for cattle (hay, straw, and corn), which will serve as starting capital.  She is asking for a loan of 2000 American dollars in order to purchase three head of cattle of a good breed.  Shahodat believes that her age will not interfere, and that she will be given a chance to prove herself in this new venture.

loans.use: to purchase three head of cattle of a good breed to start a business in animal husbandry

loans.name: Dominique

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Dominique évolue dans le domaine de l’élevage depuis plus de 10 ans. Il achète des bœufs qu’il engraisse pour les revendre après. Dominique possède quelques bœufs et aimerait développer son activité en augmentant le nombre des bêtes et pouvoir vendre périodiquement car c’est sa source de revenu. 
Marié et père de famille, il subvient aux besoins de ses enfants grâce aux revenus de son embouche. Il se complète à l’aide des crédits et peux désormais épargner un peu d’argent dans le but de rénover sa maison.
texts.en:
Dominique has been raising cattle for more than ten years.  He buys beef cattle, fattens them up and then resells them.  He already owns several animals, but would like to increase the number of his livestock so that he can resell them to provide him with a source of income.

Dominique is married and has children.  He is able to provide for the needs of his children thanks to the income from his business.  He uses the system of loans offered by the field partner, and is now able to save some money towards the renovation of his house in the future.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Alcida

texts.es:
La señora  Alcida  de 44  años de edad es casada, tiene 04 hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 20 años  a la venta de ropa usada.
Doña Alcida también  costura de prendas de vestir como vestidos, trajes, pantalones, reparación de las mismas, su actividad la realiza en su casa de habitación y también la venta de ropa la realiza de forma ambulante, es una mujer luchadora con deseos de salir.
Doña Alcida está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, calzonetas, etc. con el apoyo del crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos, su sueño es mejorar mas su casa, ya es un cliente de varios ciclos en Prisma y está contento por el apoyo.


San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Alcida is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 4 dependent children. She lives a community of San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras. She has her own home and has been in business selling used clothing for the past twenty years. Alcida also sews clothing items such as dresses, suits and pants; and does repairs of the same items. She runs her business out of her home, and also sells clothing on foot. 

She is a hardworking woman with a desire to get ahead. Alcida is requesting the loan to purchase skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, swimming trunks, etc. With the support of the loan she aims to improve her earnings. Her dream is to make additional improvements to her home. She has been a Prisma client for a number of loan cycles and is pleased with the support.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  February 2014.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, swimming trunks, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Latgrand

texts.fr:
L’emprunteur s’appelle Latgrand, il est âgé de la soixantaine et évolue dans le secteur de l’embouche et du commerce aussi. Il a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Il n’est pas aussi novice dans le crédit à l’IMCEC car il vient pour la 4ème fois solliciter l’appui de cette dernière pour un montant de 100 000F CFA qui va lui permettre d’acheter une jument et de l’élever. Latgrand est actif de 6h du matin à 19h du soir.
Avec le crédit, il pense pouvoir diversifier les produits et services, épargner et améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille car il est marié et père de six enfants et son plus grand souci est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Latgrand is in his sixties and has been working raising livestock, and also in commerce, for more than ten years.  He has some experience of the field partner, UIMCEC's loan system as this will be his fourth loan with them.

He has requested this loan for 100,000 francs CFA in order to buy a mare to raise.  Latgrand works from six in the morning until seven at night.  With this loan, he will be able to extend the range of products and services that he offers.  This will allow him to save money and improve the standard of food for his family.  

Latgrand is married and has six children, and his biggest concern is to be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy a horse to raise and then resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies and pay laborers who will help maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Sokroen's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Sokroen is 21 and a married woman of one kid. To make a living, Sokroen has been growing tobacco and also working for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR and manage to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.

Sokroen is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy grocery items to resell in order to earn additional income. She hopes to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Salimakhon

texts.ru: Салимахон замужняя женщина в возрасте 38 лет. Она умная, вежливая добрая женщина и верная жена. Салимахон ранее занималась продажей продуктов питания, имела маленький магазинчик. Теперь она хочет начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Салимахон намерена получить кредит и купить несколько телят и выращивать их в коровнике. Данный бизнес принесет доход и поддержит семейный бюджет. Салимахон верит, что с Вашей помощью она приобретет достаточное количество телят и бычков, и начет новую деятельность, что даст ей и ее семьи новые экономические возможности.
texts.en: Salimakhon is a married 38-year-old woman.  She is a smart, polite and kind woman as well as a faithful wife.  She used to sell food products in a small grocery store, and is now hoping to start her own cattle-farming business.  Salimakhon wants to take out a loan to buy a few calves to raise in her cattle pen.  This line of work provides good money and will help solidify her family's finances.  She has faith that, with your help, she'll get the calves she needs to start her new business and provide new economic opportunities for her family.

loans.use: buy calves to raise

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 58-year-old hard working married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Selling produce is his main source of income, though he has other side businesses like farming where he earns extra income. He started this business to support his family and pay school fees for his children. He faces challenges including competition, poor roads and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big modern store of produce in some years to come.

William is requesting a loan to buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more produce like maize to sell.

loans.name: Michel

texts.fr:
Michel possède des terres qu’il exploite depuis plus de 10 ans. Il y fait du maraichage et pour cette fois-ci, veut acheter des semences d’oignons et de l’engrais. Michel adore l’agriculture et peu passer des heures dans son champ, à contempler ses cultures. Il se lève à 6h du matin pour aller au champ et revenir vers les environs de 14h-15h.
Michel est marié et père de 5 enfants. Dès qu’il récolte, il emmène dans les marchés où la marchandise ne tarde pas à être achetée. Il peut alors s’occuper de payer les factures d’eau, d’électricité, de scolarité des enfants et de la nourriture de toute la famille.
Son ambition est de diversifier les cultures et d’élargir la surface cultivée.
texts.en:
Michel has been growing vegetables on his land for more than ten years.  He will use his loan to buy onion seed and fertilizer to help them grow.  Michel loves growing vegetables and can spend hours in his fields tending to his crops.  He gets up at six in the morning to go his fields, and he returns at two or three in the afternoon.  As soon as he harvests his crops he takes them to market, where they sell very quickly.

Michel is married and has five children.  With the income from his business, he is able to pay the bills for water, electricity, schooling and food for all his family.

In the future, he would like to diversify the range of vegetables that he grows, and extend his growing land.

loans.use: to buy onion seed and fertilizer to help them grow.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza is 23 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 2 and 4 years old.

She has been busy growing agricultural products - vegetables and crops. She began her business three years ago. She earns additional income from animal husbandry. Shahnoza’s husband helps her with managing the business. 

Shahnoza wants to improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan of 2,300 TJS to buy furniture for her household. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Soern's Group

texts.en:
Soern is a 43-year-old married mother of five children. Her family lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has made a living through farming rice and growing cassava. She can earn about 20,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Soern’s group consists of three members, who all live in the same village. This is the fourth microloan for her group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loan has helped her to expand her current business and improve her livelihood. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Soern is going to use her portion to spend on land fees for growing rice and cassava. She hopes to grow her rice and cassava so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to spend on land fees for growing rice and cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 52-year-old married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a motor vehicle spare parts business where he earns a living. He also repairs motor vehicles as a source of additional income. He started this business to look after his family. He faces the hardship of inadequate capital to meet the high demands, while his dream is to diversify his business.

Abdullah intends to use the loan to buy more motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy more motor vehicle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro was born in 1985. She lives with her husband and two children in a region which is located in the southern part of Tajikistan. 

Since 2009, she has run her own business. Zuhro grows tomatoes and cucumbers. Her husband Chory helps her with growing vegetables. Zuhro runs her business well. She sells her harvest in a local market and has regular customers. 

Zuhro is going to buy coal to use for keeping warm in her house. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 TJS to buy coal. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy coal for her household.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses has an internet cafe business in Kitengela town and has been running it for three years now. He is 32 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with one child. He also supports four people in his family.

He will be using the loan to buy gas cylinders for resale, which will be a new business that he is venturing into, and he plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders for resale.

loans.name: Muhamudu

texts.en:
Muhamudu is a 36-year-old business man with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He has two motorcycles in his transport business and wishes to buy another motorcycle to increase his income. He plans to have more motorcycles in his area because it is the most used transport. 

Muhamudu needs a loan to buy a third motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Kiringa Dev't Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman and blessed with 5 children, who live in a rural homestead with her. She is a member of Kiringa development group which is comprised of 15 members.

Beatrice is securing a loan through her group whose members are guaranteeing her. She is a hard working woman who is running a retail shop as her main business and her other sources of income are agriculture and the sale of second hand clothes. She has been able to get income from these businesses for looking after her family and paying her children’s school dues and providing them with all the basic needs. 

Her dream is to expand her business to greater heights and she is hopeful that with this loan from UGAFODE Micro finance Limited (MDI), her business is going to expand. She thanks her fellow group members for being there for her and Kiva lenders for partnering with the group. She says that the community has benefited a lot from Ugafode not only through loans but also have acquired financial literacy which has enabled them to better manage their businesses and take care of their families.

Pictured are the group members, and the extra member is the chairperson whose loan is already running, he signed the waiver form though.

loans.use: to buy retail stock.

loans.name: Mirtagi

texts.en:
Mirtagi is 27 years old. He is married and has a baby. His baby is newly born and his wife is taking care of him. Mirtagi lives with his lovely and young family in Abseron region. He distributes foods to stores. 

A while ago his car was crashed and today Mirtagi wants to repair his car. For this reason, he needs a loan in amount of 1000 AZN. Mirtagi says thanks to Kiva for their help and support.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children aged 12 and 9 years old. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for two years. Her spouse does provide additional income. Besides farming, she also has a retail shop. Right now her monthly income from her business is KES 15,000.

She will be using the loan to buy cattle feed. She will also buy retail goods like sugar, salt and cooking oil for selling in her retail shop. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay her loan and save more.

This is Mary's second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loan successfully. Her hopes and dreams in future are to build a modern house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed and retail goods for resale.

loans.name: Ana Gina

texts.en:
Ana Gina lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. She runs a general store selling goods in their village to make a living. For five years, she has been able to support her husband's income from employment.  

She has borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family's needs. In the future, Ana Gina wants to live in a comfortable home with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 41 years old and is from Nyahururu. He is married to Elizabeth and they are blessed with three children aged 13, 8 and 6 years old.

Godfrey is a butcher, a business he has been running for the last 13 years, and his monthly income right now is KES. 25,000.

He has applied for his first loan to enable him buy some goats for slaughter and he has plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to expand his business.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy goats for slaughter, from which he will sell the meat to his customers at his butchery.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a 46-year-old male married with thirteen children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. 

He has a cocoa garden and sells cocoa to people around him. He also has a motorcycle for a transport business, which is a side source of income. He wishes to buy another motorcycle to expand his business, though poor infrastructure in the areas affect him.
 
Frank is requesting for a loan to buy another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 30 years old, and is from Nyahururu. He is married to Mary and they are blessed with one child aged 9 months old.

He is a butcher, a business he has been running for the last four years. His monthly income right now is KES. 30,000.

To enable him to buy some goats for slaughter, he has applied for his second loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya. He has plans of using the anticipated profits from his expanded business to pay his loan back to VisionFund and to expand his business.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy some goats for slaughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for three calves, fodder for feeding them, fuel, fertilizer and seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna, a mother of 1, operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also had a cosmetics buying and selling business. Her husband is an optician.

She earns well to support the needs of her child and is able to sustain her business. Rosanna has borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Malika

texts.en:
Malika was born in 1991. She is not married and has no children. Malika lives her parents and brothers. There are five people in her family. 

Malika is a successful young businesswoman. She is a sewer and sews women’s national dresses. She services her clients from her house. She has been busy with this business for more than two years. Malika has her regular customers. 

Malika and her family live poorly. They do not have a TV set. Malika wants to buy a TV set for her family, because she wants to watch TV and to hear the news. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy a TV set. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a TV for her household.

loans.name: Donokhon

texts.en:
Donokhon is married and has two young children. Sodikjon is her husband. 

Donokhon is a person who always tries to earn money and provide a better life for her children. She began her own business dealing in animal husbandry when her children were little. She manages the business alone. She has two cows. 

She has requested a loan of $2,000 USD to increase the number of animals she has for sale. She hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan since it will be used to improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Hafitha

texts.en:
Hafitha used her previous loan to buy vegetables to sell in her grocery shop and it has been profitable. She has been able to repay the loan in time and successfully. 

She will be using this loan to buy vegetables and fruit to sell in her grocery shop. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of vegetables and fruit. 

This will be her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to own her own home and educate her child.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruit to sell in her grocery shop.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 33-year-old married man, and is blessed with two children. He hails from Rusheeshe village, Bwanda parish, Buhunga sub-county, Rukungiri municipality. He has applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 from this institution.

David is involved in agriculture and is also a carpenter. He does his business from Rusheeshe T.C and has been doing this business for over 12 years and it is where he has been getting his income.

He is a hard working man, but has always been let down by insufficient capital to improve his agriculture business. He will buy coffee husks to mulch his banana plantation and also buy improved seeds for planting. He thinks this will improve the quality of his bananas and also the yield will be high.
With this financial support from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), David is hopeful that his agriculture business will improve.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mulches.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en:
Mastona is 31 years old. She is married and has three children. 

Mastona has been busy with animal husbandry for more than ten years. She has three cows now. Mastona manages her business well. She has a great opportunity to develop her business as she lives in a rural area. 

Mastona’s husband Jasur has a small income. They live poorly and their house is in a bad condition. Mastona is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints etc. for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints etc. for repairing her house.

loans.name: Elmie

texts.en: Elmie has been selling grocery goods in her village for years to make a living. She has successfully repaid her previous business loans. She made some home improvements with her profits. Recently, she took a new loan to buy grocery goods to sell. She is thankful to GDMPC for providing loans to small entrepreneurs and helping them to improve their living situations.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Misael

texts.es: Misael tiene 31 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas de 8 años y 14 años de edad. Misael trabaja como panificador desde hace mas de 6 años y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Misael y su familia habitan en condiciones muy humildes pero poco a poco van mejorando sus condiciones gracias a las Instituciones que financian a personas de escasos recursos como es el caso de Misael. En esta ocasión solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un pequeño cuarto dormitorio y así dar mayor comodidad a su familia. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, ladrillo, arena y hierro.
texts.en: Misael is 31 years old and lives in a home of his own with his wife and two daughters, ages 8 and 14.  Misael works as a baker and has been earning a living and supporting his household this way for more than six years.  He and his family live under humble conditions, but they are improving little by little, thanks to the institutions that finance people of limited resources, such as Misael.  He is asking for a loan through FUSAI, so he can build a small bedroom to make his family more comfortable.  He will use the money to buy cement, bricks, sand, and iron bars.

loans.use: to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella is a married woman who has raised pigs for more than ten years, while her husband earns a living from his carpentry works. As you can see from her photo, she takes care of and feeds her pigs.

Estella is asking a loan in order to buy feed and additional piglets to enlarge her business venture, since she expects an increase in demand in the market. She wants to build a pig's shelter to use it for expansion.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en: Hanifa was born in 1966. She is married and has 4 children. Her children are adults. She lives with her family in a rural area. Hanifa started her own animal husbandry business. She manages the business well. She has 3 cows now. Hanifa sells milk and milk products to her neighbors. Hanifa is going to repair her house, because it is in poor condition. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy building materials. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer living in the Murang area of Central Kenya. She is married and has 2 children. Jane has been farming for 30 years planting very good looking vegetables that she sells in the area. She loves farming, because it is her income source. Her biggest challenge is lack of enough money for farming.

Jane chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, because their products are reasonable and affordable, and are offered at low interest rates. During the training, she learned how she can improve her living standards through farming. This loan will bring in more poultry, increase her income, and improve her standard-of-living.

loans.use: to buy more poultry

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi âgée de 40ans a pour conjoint un mécanicien chauffeur et mère de 02 enfants de 11 et 07ans scolarisés. Elle revend depuis 2011 des produits alimentaires et des ustensiles de cuisine au marché. Afin d'améliorer la demande des clients, elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit lui permettra de faire développer son activité et d'assurer le bien - être de la famille.
texts.en: Kayi is 40 years old and married to a driver mechanic. They have two children of eleven and seven who both attend school. Since 2011 she has been selling food products and kitchen utensils at the market. In order to improve the offer for her clients, she requests a first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise. The profits will enable her to develop her business and to guarantee her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy food products and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a farmer living in the Muranga area of Central Kenya with his wife and two children. Agriculture has been their main source of income for the past eleven years.They produce and sell milk, eggs, tea and green vegetables.

Stephen chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer their loans at a reasonable interest rate. During the training, he learnt how to develop a savings culture. This dairy loan will increase the amount of litres produced and thus increase his income, which will in turn help him feed his family well.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a 49-year-old man, married with 6 children. He is an agriculturalist who also sells timber. Godfrey started the timber business in 2009. He started it purposely to raise finances to support his family.
However, Godfrey has encountered several challenges in his business, for example banana diseases which have destroyed all the banana plantations in the area.
People also sell Godfrey poor quality, immature timber.This usually affects the quality of his products and his reputation.
Godfrey has applied for a loan from UGAFODE to be able to improve and raise adequate capital in his businesses, which will enhance his service delivery and increase his income. Godfrey is pictured here with his wife.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 50 years old and married with three children.

Florence works hard to provide for her family. She sells tomatoes in the Dansoman-Accra and requests GHS 1,000 through ID-Ghana to purchase one big box to sell to customers.

Florence has previously borrowed and repaid 5 loans from ID-Ghana. She has been selling tomatoes for 6 years.
Florence has been working hard enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase one big box of tomatoes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lindi Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid, who is in her early 50s, is a divorcee with five children, two of whom are still at school and two of whom are grown-up. Mwanaid has been running a food vendor business for fourteen years now. She works from 6 am to 11 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mwanaid's 13th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle and food-cooking supplies. Mwanaid has paid all her loans successfully. She is doing fine with the loan and appreciates everyone who has supported their group. 

Mwanaid used the profit to pay school fees, buy a sofa set, build a house, buy a plot of land, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy food-cooking supplies. She dreams of expanding her motorcycle business and of buying a Noah car.

Mwanaid will share this loan with her loan group "Lindi" which has four members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying the loan.

loans.use: to buy food-cooking supplies.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza lives with her family in a rural area. She was born in the year 1980. Nargiza is widowed and has 3 children. Her children are 15, 12 and 5 years old. 

Nargiza is the only provider to her 3 children. She has been busy with sewing national women dresses for more than 17 years now. She has great experience in this field. Nargiza has her regular clients. She services her clients in a workshop which is located in a central part of her village. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy fabrics to increase her working capital and to sew more wonderful women’s dresses. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics to increase her working capital and to sew more wonderful women’s dresses

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sabalibougou dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le commerce d’ustensiles de cuisine (tasses, pot,…), du charbon de bois, des produits d’artisanat (encensoirs, canaris,…), des produits de la pharmacopée, du riz, des vêtements de toutes les qualités : pagnes wax, brodés et bazins. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sika (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des pagnes wax, brodés et bazins. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako en gros. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit à Sabalibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sika espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The five women in the Danaya group are mostly married and living in monogamous households. On average they are 45 years old with five children. They all live in the Sabalibougou quarter in Bamako district; they came to know each other within the neighbourhood and through their income generating activities at the Sabalibougou market. The members of this group sell kitchen utensils (cups, saucepans) charcoal, artisan products (incense holders, water jugs...) pharmaceutical products, rice, clothing of every description: wax pagnes, embroidered and bazin clothing. Hoping to have the possibility of buying their stock for cash, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and this is their third solidarity loan.
Mme Sika (who is sitting in the middle in the photo) has a good reputation in the world of wax pagnes and embroidered and bazin clothing. She plans to use her loan to purchase 60 wax pagnes at the wholesale market in Bamako. She will sell the merchandise for cash and credit in Sabalibougou and as an itinerant saleswoman to her mainly female clientele. With this loan Mme Sika hopes to make an average monthly profit of 100 000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to provide for her children's care.

loans.use: To buy wax pagnes.

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Carmen es originaria de Camoapa, Casada y madre de un hijo. Tiene 32 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de Cuajada, Crema, Leña y Helados. Inicio su negocio hace ocho años con la venta de cuajada y leche a los clientes más cercanos de la comunidad. Su meta próxima es mantener el negocio creciente. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Leche, Leña, Azúcar entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que lograra incrementar sus ingresos. Su plan futuro es aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Carmen, 32, is originally from Camoapa. She is married and has a son. She is a saleswoman who sells cottage cheese, cream, ice creams and firewood. She started selling cottage cheese and milk to local costumers eight years ago. Her short term goal is to continue expanding her business.

Carmen is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar and firewood, among other things. She thinks that this loan will be useful for her and it will help her to increase her income. Her goal for the future is to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar and firewood, among other things.

loans.name: Francisco Ramón

texts.es: Francisco es un adulto mayor, que trabajó durante más de 20 años como obrero de construcción, pero a causa de un accidente que sufrió hace 4 años, se vio obligado a cambiar su actividad y poder generar los ingresos necesarios para su familia. Actualmente confecciona bolsos para la venta, actividad que le enseñó un amigo y a la que se dedica desde entonces. Francisco quiere utilizar el crédito en la ampliación del taller (mejoras locativas) donde pueda trabajar más dignamente, porque el espacio que tiene actualmente es una habitación pequeña en un barrio de invasión. El sueño de Francisco es poder sacar una producción más significativa que le represente un aumento de sus ingresos para su sustento.
texts.en:
Francisco is a senior citizen who worked for more than twenty years as a construction worker. However, due to an accident he suffered four years ago, he was forced to change occupation in order to generate income for his family. He is currently making purses, an activity he learned from a friend. 

Francisco will use the loan to enlarge his workshop, in order to have a better place to work; he works in a small room in an informal settlement. Francisco’s dream is to increase his production in order to improve his income and be able to better cover his expenses.

loans.use: to enlarge his workshop.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es una mujer de 43 años de edad luchadora, con muchas fuerzas y con el deseo de salir adelante. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad de primaria incompleta ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron ayudarle pero agradece a DIOS y a sus padres por haberle brindado la oportunidad de estudiar y tener un grado de conocimiento básico. Su estado civil es casada y junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo de hortaliza (papa), maíz y frijol. De su matrimonio tienen 5 hijos pero solo 2 dependen de ellos ya que los demás están adultos y en hogares aparte. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que desde pequeña fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. Juntos se apoyan diariamente para salir adelante y que a sus hijos no les falte nada trabajando la tierra por la cual agradecen a DIOS por ser propia la cual está a una distancia de 20 metros de su casa de habitación.
Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la compra de semilla certificada de papa, compra de fertilizantes, abono, entre otros que ayudaran a que sus cultivos de hortalizas estén protegidos y seguros.
Su sueño es poder mejorar su vivienda y cultivar más hortaliza; pero la prioridad de ella es ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales teniendo una mejor educación y a sí mismo un mejor futuro ya que ella no quiere que pasen por la misma situación que ella paso.
texts.en:
Agustina is 43 years old and a plucky woman with a lot of strength and a desire to get ahead. Agustina did not finish primary school as her parents were very poor and could not support her. Agustina thanks God and her parents, however, for the time that was able to study and to develop very basic knowledge in school. Agustina is married and, alongside her husband, she makes a living growing vegetables (potatoes), corn and beans. The couple has five children but only two still depend on their parents. The other three are adults and have their own homes. Agustina has a lot of experience as from a young age her parents taught her to work the land. Every day Agustina and her husband support each other in order to prosper and to make sure that their children do not need for anything. They work the land and thank God that they own that land, which is located just 20 metres from their house.

Agustina is currently applying for a loan in order to invest in certified potato seeds, fertiliser, manure and other supplies that will help to keep her vegetables crops protected and safe.

Agustina's dream is to improve her home and to grow more vegetables but her priority is to see her children become professionals with a higher level of education. Agustina wants them to have a better future as she does not want them to live in the same situation as she did.

loans.use: to buy certified potato seeds and supplies to look after her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Daniela Auxiliadora

texts.es: Daniela es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y madre de un hijo. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida. Se siente agradecida con KIVA y MiCrédito ya que con el crédito logro comprar mayor producto para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Un cerdo en pie, Verduras y Carnes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Daniela is originally from the city of Granada. She is married and a mother to one son. Daniela is a businesswoman and makes a living selling meals. She feels grateful to "Mi Crédito" and Kiva as, with this loan, she can buy more stock in order to satisfy her customers' demands. Daniela is applying for this loan in order to buy a live pig, vegetables and meat. Daniela believes that this loan will be of great help to her as she will be able to make higher profits.

loans.use: to buy a live pig, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Fredy Mauricio

texts.es: Fredy es un hombre de 38 años dedicado a la venta de alimentos fritos, dulces y gaseosas en un puesto ambulante frente a una universidad de la ciudad de Medellín, en compañía de su hermana que sufre una discapacidad. Su sueño es mantener las ventas en el puesto, durante la temporada de vacaciones y tener buen surtido cuando regresen los estudiantes a clases. Por lo que quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de surtido (mecato, gaseosas, cigarrillos, chicles), para que las personas tengan más variedad de productos para comprar y acreditar su puesto de trabajo.
texts.en: Fredy is 38 years old and makes a living selling fried foods, sweets and fizzy drinks at a street stall across from one of Medellin's universities. He works with his sister, who has a disability. Fredy's dream is to keep sales up at his stall during the holiday period, and to keep his business well-stocked for when students resume classes. To do this Fredy wants to buy stock (pastries, fizzy drinks, cigarettes and chewing gum) so that customers have a greater variety of stock to choose from and to make his business better.

loans.use: to buy stock (pastries, fizzy drinks, cigarettes and chewing gum).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine, a coverstitch sewing machine, and a stationary sewing machine.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 28-year-old married mother of one child who has been selling women's pajamas and bags for 13 years. In July 2013, she established her own business to improve her family's living standards and cover their increasing needs.

Today, Zeinab is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to increase her business merchandise with a special new release of women's lingerie and underwear to develop her business sector and diversify her products.

This is Zeinab's first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower. Through her future loan, she is planning to expand and develop her working sector to start wholesale trade.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with a special new release of women's lingerie and underwear to develop her business sector and diversify her products

loans.name: Fatema

texts.en:
Fatema is a 31-year-old housewife from the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband and children in their own kachha house (a house made with mud, straw and bamboo). Together with her husband Fatema is raising two school-going children who are in grade 7 and 6.  Both Fatema and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.

Fatema and her husband Sofiar are both engaged in animal husbandry. They began this business several years ago with the purchase of a cow as the major source of income for the family. Thanks to their hard work, now they have two cows in their herd.  They sell the milk in their locality and with the income manage to cover their household expenses.  As the prices of essential goods are increasing day by day, they are unable to give enough financial support to their family, so they have decided to expand their business. With the goal of increasing the size of their herd, they want to purchase one more cow.

Fatema heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and has taken out a loan from them to purchase a cow.  The income that she will get from the business will be used to educate her children and improve their living conditions.

She dreams of building a concrete-made house in future.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow so as to expand her dairy business.

loans.name: Binodini

texts.en:
Binodini is a rural housewife from the village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. She lives there with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) .  Both are receiving an education. They are in grade 2 and grade 1 respectively. Binodini has completed her primary education.  Her husband Joydev, aged 27 years, is a farmer by trade.  He studied up to grade 9.

Binodini has a hard life and a low income, but a kind heart and a good character.  Her husband has been involved in growing agricultural crops, such as potatoes, beans, chillies, etc. for over 15 years. Binodini also helps her husband in his agricultural work.  They sell the resulting harvest in the local market which is the main source of income for the family.

Now, in order to provide their family a better living standard, they need to develop their business. So, Binodini has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers to grow more potatoes in their agricultural land. They want to get a larger harvest to provide the family all the necessities. She dreams of educating her children properly and starting a grocery shop of their own with the income she will get.

She is very much grateful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna lives in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter).  She is a 39-year-old housewife who has a primary education.  Both their son and daughter are in college. They have a small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made).

Krishna's husband Bankim, aged 53 years, is a farmer with many years of experience running his agricultural business. He grows different seasonal vegetables in their ancestral land.  Krishna also helps her husband with his agricultural work. The gathered harvest is sold locally and the family somehow manages to support itself.

Krishna and her husband would like to enlarge their agricultural business in order to give a better lifestyle to their family.  Their income is not sufficient to cover all the expenses of a family of four members, especially in these days when the prices of everything are going up.

So Krishna has taken a loan from BJS to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers, so that she can start farming potatoes which is a very important vegetable and is used in most of the dishes in India.  They hope that this will be a very lucrative business.

Krishna is an enthusiastic and hardworking woman who does her best to have a successful and profitable business with which they can fulfill their dreams.
Krishna aspires to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house with the profit from her business.

She is very much thankful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for farming potatoes.

loans.name: Djiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguisèmè est majoritairement  composé de femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, du bois de chauffage et des condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffage. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camionnette de bois dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle mixte. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Djiguisèmè group is made up mostly of polygamous women. On average they are 42 years old with five children. They all live in Kanadjiguila and met in the neighbourhood. The members of this group sell firewood and condiments. Hoping to expand their businesses, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their third solidarity loan.
Mrs. Awa (the woman standing on the far left in the photo) is well known in the firewood business. She plans to use her loan to purchase one van load of wood in the villages surrounding Bamako. She will sell the wood retail in Kanadjiguila to a mixed clientele. With this loan Mrs. Awa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90 000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business. Her reason for collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a plot of land for lodgings.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Phulmoti

texts.en:
Phulmoti is a 39-year-old, hard-working widow.  She lives in the remote village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She has three children (one son and two daughters).  All of them are studying in grade 6. Though Phulmoti only studied up to grade 4, she is very much concerned about her children's education. They live in their own house. 

Phulmoti has had to struggle a lot since she lost her husband few years back and to bear the household expenses and the educational expenses of her children. She has been running an animal husbandry business. She is the only breadwinner for the family who somehow covers the cost of her household expenses and the educational expenses of her children. Thanks to her tireless work and dedication, she now owns a dairy cow and two sheep.

With a goal to further develop her business in order to give her children sufficient financial sustenance, she has taken out a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS.  She plans to invest the loan to purchase one more dairy cow. She wants to start a milk products business selling milk, curd, butter, paneer (fresh cheese) etc.  One more cow means more milk.  She will sell her products in her locality.  She expects more profit from this business, as the products have much demand in the market.

She dreams of saving money from the profit, after covering all her household necessities, and she wants to build a concrete-made house with the income from her business.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow so as to expand her existing business.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is a 45-year-old single lady who has been employed in a beauty salon for 35 years. She is very happy working in this domain, since she believes that she is very talented and experienced in it.

Majida is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to complete building her dream house in her village to make sure that she is going to have her own comfortable living space. Majida is planning to move from the city where she is now living to the village she comes from and start her own career and living in the future which is an important step she is working hard to accomplish.

loans.use: To complete building her dream house in her village to make sure that she is going to have her own comfortable living space

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 45-year-old widow living with three children. She started her business (a computer library) in 2005 with a small amount of capital she had from her savings. She has approached UGAFODE Micro-finance Limited (MDI), Rukungiri branch, for a loan. 

Annah has faced several challenges in her business operations which include limited capital, seasonal purchase of her products, and constant power fluctuations which affect her sales.

She has a dream of starting a big stationery shop and a shopping center in a big town. She hopes then, she will be able to provide employment to young unemployed ladies that she can train and impart skills to
. 
She appreciates UGAFODE and Kiva for the financial support rendered to her. In the photo is Annah at her business.

loans.use: To buy  a printer

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Darakert village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband, two little kids (ages 5 and 1 year old), her parents-in-law and her brother-in-law.

Gohar and her family are involved in farming. They own a greenhouse and some arable land where they cultivate potatoes. The whole family takes care of the farm and they work hard to earn good agricultural income for their living expenses. 

Gohar has now applied for this loan to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and to cover heating costs for the greenhouse. This will be a huge support for the whole family so they can continue running their farm successfully.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and cover heating costs for the greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, 37 years old, is married and has a twelve-year-old child. Dorothy lives in a town near the market and has customers who can find her easily. She is applying for a loan of GHS 1,000 from ID Ghana. She sells second-hand clothing in the market. Dorothy will use the loan to buy one bale of second-hand clothing to sell to customers. 

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy one bale of second-hand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: María Noelia

texts.es:
María, a sus 64 años de edad, es una mujer pujante y luchadora que se ha ganado la vida trabajando como comerciante independiente, pues desde hace 34 años tiene una chaza en la que ofrece dulces, minutos a celular y otros, actividad que se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos y por ello, trabaja todos los días de 10 am a 6 pm, sobrepasando los diversos obstáculos que se le presentan por la contaminación ambiental y los demás riesgos que representa la labor de calle.
Con el ánimo de incrementar sus inventarios para tener más variedad de productos a ofrecer, ella solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará surtido al por mayor (dulces, mecato, galletería, cigarrillos), esto le permitirá satisfacer los diversos gustos de su clientela, mejorando los ingresos personales.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener la capacidad económica para descansar y disfrutar de una vejez tranquila, hasta que  Dios y su cuerpo se lo permitan.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old.  She is a strong woman and a fighter who has earned a living working as an independent businesswoman.  For the past 34 years, she has had a cart from which she sells candy, prepaid cellphone minutes, and other products.  This activity has become her only source of income, and she works there everyday from 10am to 6pm.
