She overcomes the many obstacles that she faces such as pollution and other risks associated from working on the streets.  

With the goal of adding to her inventory, in order to offer a greater variety of products, she is seeking the help of this loan with which she will purchase merchandise in bulk (candy, snacks, cookies, cigarettes).  This will allow her to satisfy the various tastes of her customers, increasing her personal income.  María states that her greatest goal is to have the financial capacity to relax and enjoy her old age in peace, for as long as God and her body will allow her to.

loans.use: purchase merchandise in bulk (candy, snacks, cookies, cigarettes).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fire wood and palm oil

loans.name: Sheraton Group

texts.en:
Tatu is a mother of two kids who have finished their schooling. She is in her late thirties and manages a business of 'mamalishe' (a small restaurant). She sells bites like chapati, vitumbua (rice cakes) and donuts with tea and lunch foods like rice or ugali (maize porridge) with meat, beans and vegetables. She also manages a door-to-door clothes business. Tatu starts her business at 7 am and works to 4 pm and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is Tatu's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, and she will use the money to buy cooking ingredients like a sack of rice and maize flour for her business. With the previous loans, both of which were paid back successfully, she bought business food stocks and clothes. She managed to earn extra income which she used to cover school fees and home expenses. In the coming years, Tatu would like to build a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Sheraton” which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients like a sack of rice and maize flour for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing to restock her shop

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es: Rosa, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y reside en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Hace dos años que ella inicio con su propio negocio, vende productos de la canasta básica como es arroz, frijoles, manteca, pan, queso, condimentos, churros, galletas, verduras etc. Piensa surtir su negocio y ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 8,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar carnes, y embutidos para vender, ya que no tiene suficiente en su negocio y los clientes le solicitan. Su plan es mejorar el negocio cada día para tener una fuente de ingresos fija y ayudar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49 years old.  She is a single mother of three children, and they live in the city of San Perdo Sula.  Two years ago, she started her own business selling basic food products such as: rice, beans, lard, bread, cheese, condiments, churros, cookies, vegetables, etc.  

She is thinking of stocking her business, and has decided to seek a loan of 8,000 Lempiras with which she will purchase meats and sausages to sell because she does not have enough in stock and her customers have requested them.  Her plan is to improve her business everyday so that she may have a fixed source of income and be able to help her son.

loans.use: purchase meats and sausages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dried fish to expand her sales

loans.name: Sveta

texts.en:
Sveta lives in Hovtashat village of Ararat region. She lives there with her husband, 24-year-old son and 23-year-old twin daughters. Sveta and her husband are involved in agriculture. They breed cattle and also own a greenhouse where they cultivate different types of greens. The meat and milk that Sveta and her family produce is sold in a nearby open market and the family is able to earn an income. 

Sveta is requesting a loan to renovate her greenhouse and purchase seeds to plant. Her loan will enable her and her husband to enlarge their farm. Sveta hopes that lenders will support their farm.

loans.use: to renovate her greenhouse and purchase seeds to cultivate

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Masis town with her daughter and son who is a teacher in a local village school. Marine has been involved in agriculture for 15 years. Her children assist her with farming activities. They cultivate greens in the greenhouse that they own and also keep chickens.

Marine requested a loan, which she will use to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse and seeds and fertilizer for land cultivation. This loan is very important for Marine's agribusiness as new cultivation season starts and she needs to be prepared.

loans.use: to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, seeds, and fertilizer

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar is 32 years old, married, and has one child who attends school. His wife is a barber. Elmar’s family is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now lives at Fuzuli region-Bala Bahmanli village. Elmar operates a “Chayxana,” which is translated into English as tea house. He serves samovar tea with leblebi (a snack made from roasted chickpeas) to customers. 

Elmar requested a loan for 2,100 AZN, which he will use to change an old door and the windows of his “Chayxana”. In the future, Elmar wants to increase the size of his “Chayxana” and monthly income.

loans.use: to change an old door and the windows of his “Chayxana” (tea house)

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Vidas is in her late 40s and is a widow with three children. One of her children is still at school and the other two have finished. Since 2002, Vidas has worked selling clothing and selling chickens door-to-door. She works from four in the morning through seven at night seven days a week and is able to make a very good monthly profit. She received three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania that she used to continue her clothing business and start selling local chicken. Vidas is happy with her loans and appreciates everyone who has supported her loan group. She used the profit from her loans to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  

Vidas is requesting a loan to buy fabrics and clothes to resell. She will share her loan with her loan group “Momela,” which has six members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. Vidas dreams of providing a better education to her child who is still at school.

loans.use: to buy fabric and clothing to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana Margarita de 57  años de edad,  tiene un hijo  que depende de ella, vive con su esposo, tiene casa propia, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de venta de cerdos para destazo y venta de maíz.
Doña Ana Margarita sus clientes son dueños de bodega, personas que se dedican a la comercialización de cerdos, su venta es una vez por semana.
Doña Ana Margarita está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, con el apoyo del crédito espera suplir la necesidad de financiamiento que tiene para esta ocasión ya que le venden este producto bien barato y desea embodegarlo para hacer concentrado para los cerdos y para revender.
Su sueño es tener un negocio de pulpería bien fuerte en su casa.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2014.
texts.en:
Ana Margarita is 57 years old, and has a son that depends on her.  She lives with her husband in a house that they own.  For many years, she has devoted herself to her business of selling pigs for slaughter, and selling corn.  Ana Margarita's clients are grocery store owners, and people who work selling pigs.  She makes her sales once per week.  

Ana Margarita is seeking this loan to purchase corn.  With the help of this loan, she hopes to meet the financial need that she currently has, as they are offering her the product at a very low price.  She wishes to store it to make feed for the pigs, and to resell it.  Her dream is to have a small grocery store in her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- February 2014

loans.use: purchase corn for her business.

loans.name: Manik

texts.en:
Manik lives in Hayanist village with her two kids (her daughter is in the photo). She is a divorced woman who has been involved in agriculture. Her farm is not big but her desire to make it big and successful is huge. She keeps two cows and grows cherry and plum trees. Manik sells the gathered agricultural harvest  in the local market on weekends.

Manik is a very hardworking woman who does her best to earn a good income and provide appropriate living conditions for her children. Manik also works at a local fish store three days per week.

Realizing how important agriculture is for sustaining her family's living, Manik has applied for this loan. She is asking for a loan of USD 370 to be able to enlarge her livestock by two pigs. She will be very grateful to lenders if they support her agricultural business and help her to develop it.

loans.use: to pay for pigs

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
José de 21 años de edad,  estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo de 3 años.

José desde hace cinco años se ha dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y aprendió ya que acompañaba a su abuelo cuando él iba a sembrar. José camina cinco minutos para ir al terreno donde siembra maíz y frijol, el horario es de 6 a 11 de la mañana, el préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas  abono y pesticidas,  para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz con regadío.

Espera sacar ganancias con la cosecha y poder tener una casa más segura, ya que es actualmente de lámina y siempre tener trabajo para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 21 years old, and studied until second grade.  He is married, and his wife is a homemaker.  They have a three year old son.  For the past five years, José has worked in agriculture, a trade that he learned by accompanying his grandfather when he would go to farm.  José walks five minutes to get to the plot of land where he plants corn and beans.  His schedule is from 6am to 11am.

He needs this loan to purchase agricultural supplies like manure and pesticides, to plant 7,000 square meters of corn with irrigation.  He hopes to make a profit with his harvest to be able to have a more secure home, as it is currently made of sheet-metal, and to always have work to support his family.

loans.use: purchase agricultural supplies like manure and pesticides, to plant 7,000 square meters of corn with irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair, hair lotion, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es: Juan Antonio es un joven de 39 años de edad, es comerciante de pulpería  que atiende con el apoyo de su esposa, es padre de tres hijos en edad escolar. Juan Antonio solicita este crédito para invertir en productos para su negocio, ya que actualmente carece de mercaderías de la necesidad de sus compradores, lo cual es penoso decir no hay cuando el cliente tiene toda la confianza de encontrar lo que busca en un solo punto, es por eso que el decide hacer esta inversión con el apoyo de financiamiento, lo que le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan Antonio is 39 years old.  He owns a small grocery store which he runs with the help of his wife.  He is the father of three children who are in school.

Juan Antonio is seeking this loan to invest in the purchase of products for his business.  He is currently lacking the merchandise that his customers need.  It is painful for him to tell his customers that he is out of merchandise when they are confident that they will find everything that they need in one place.  For this reason, he decided to make this investment with the help of the loan, which will help him to improve his income.

loans.use: purchase perishable goods like: meats, fruit, vegetables, eggs, and basic grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, peppers, fish, Vita, dry bushmeat, onions, and charcoal for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Together Group

texts.en:
These four women are part of Together Group and are into the sale of African wax-print fabrics, rice, cosmetics and fruit drinks.
Comfort, who is in her late 40s, is married with three children who are still at school. She has been selling second-hand clothing and cosmetics for 10 years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Comfort's second loan from ID-Ghana, and she wants to use it to buy a bale of second-hand clothing to sell to customers. 

Comfort will share this loan with her group which has four members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second-hand clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Antehwe Group

texts.en:
These four women comprise Antehwe Group and they sell African wax-print fabrics, sandals, ladies' slippers, wigs, hair products, and maize.

Margaret, who is in her early 50s, is single, with no child. She has been selling African wax-print fabrics, sandals, and ladies' slippers for three years now. She works from 8 am to 5 pm, walking from door-to-door every day and she is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Margaret's sixth loan from ID Ghana, which she wants to use to buy African wax-print fabrics, sandals, and ladies' slippers to sell to customers. 

Margaret will share this loan with her colleagues who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. The entire group will need a total of GHS 4,300 to invest into their businesses.

loans.use: to buy African wax-print fabrics, sandals, and ladies' slippers to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es: Sandra es una mujer de 50 años de edad, dedicada a la venta de mercancía variada desde el año 2011, cuando quedó desempleada; con un embarazo de alto riesgo, que no le permitía movilizarse al mismo ritmo de su anterior trabajo, decidió dedicarse a la actividad comercial, con la que ha logrado ingresos para apoyar el sustento de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y 7 hijos.  Su negocio lo realiza mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, a través d e los cuales ofrece productos a crédito,  que traen  precios especiales y muchos artículos que le gustan a su clientela. Los principales artículos de su oferta son la ropa, calzado, carteras y perfumes. Su día laboral inicia desde las 7 de la mañana, hasta las 8 de la noche, Sandra compra de contado para obtener descuentos y así generar mejores utilidades. Su mayor desafío es incrementar sus ingresos, porque su capital no es suficiente para atender la demanda y para ampliar sus posibilidades de ganar dinero. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará prendas, calzado y perfumes, que le han encargado para hacer de su credikiva su mejor inversión.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 50-year-old woman who has been selling a variety of products since 2011 when she become unemployed; with a high risk pregnancy which didn’t allow her to move at the same rhythm as her previous job. She decided to work in business which she has received earnings to support her household which is made of her spouse and 7 children. 

Her business is done through specialized guides of products and catalogues through offer goods on credit that bring special prices and many articles that her clients like. The main articles she sells are clothing, footwear, bags and perfumes. Her workday begins at 7am until 8pm. Sandra makes cash purchases to get discounts and thus generate better profits. 

Her biggest challenge is increasing her revenue because her capital isn’t enough to meet demands and to increase her possibilities of earning money. This is the reason she is turning to Kiva for a loan, her first financing that she is doing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy garments, footwear, and perfume which have been commissioned to make her Kiva loan her best investment.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, and perfume.

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Danelia es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, casada y madre de tres hijos ya independientes. Tiene 44 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Inicio su negocio hace varios años, cuando decidió obtener ingresos extras y fue así como comenzó a vender cosméticos manteniendo el negocio hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es aumentar sus ventas. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Perfumes, Cremas, Shampoo, entre otros productos de uso personal. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para diversificar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes y así obtener mejores ganancias. Su plan futuro es aumentar el número de clientes.
texts.en: Danelia comes from Estelí city. She is 44, married, and is is the mother of three independent children.  She is a trader and sells cosmetics. She set up her business several years ago when she decided to earn extra money, and this was how she began selling cosmetics. She has continued developing this business until today.  Her next goal is to increase her sales. She is asking for a loan to buy items for personal use such as perfume, cream and shampoo. She feels that the loan will be a great help in broadening the range of products she offers to her customers and thus making a bigger profit. Her plan for the future is to increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy items for personal use such as perfume, creams and shampoo.

loans.name: Gladis Estella

texts.es:
Gladis, a sus 50 años de edad, ha pasado por grandes dificultades, pero motivada por el amor de sus 3 hijos y por su espíritu de superación, ha logrado salir adelante.
Hace 15 años comenzó con su propio negocio, un puesto de venta de jugos naturales y frutas, beneficiándose de las ciclovías que se implementan en la ciudad, pues trabaja los días y en los horarios en el que éstas funcionan; poco a poco su negocio fue dando buenos resultados y  junto con su esposo compraron una vivienda y montaron una tienda de abarrotes, pero luego de unos años, se separó de su esposo y hoy en día, únicamente cuenta con los ingresos que da el puesto de jugos y frutas; a pesar de todos los inconvenientes, ella ha logrado generar los recursos para dar una vida digna a su familia.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos (frutas y desechables), recipientes plásticos y utensilios de cocina, esto le permitirá cumplir con las exigencias de sanidad exigidas por las autoridades y además mejorará la imagen de su negocio, atrayendo así a nuevos clientes y mejorando las ganancias que recibe por las ventas.
Gladis manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio para que sea más rentable y le garantice una estabilidad económica para continuar apoyando a sus hijos y darles una educación universitaria adecuada para que sean personas íntegras y se forjen un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
Gladis, 50, has experienced great difficulties but motivated by her love for her 3 children and for her desire to better herself, she has managed to get ahead.

Fifteen years ago she started her own business, a stall selling natural juices and fruits, benefiting from bike lanes placed in the city; working on the days and hours that they are it operation. Little by little her business had good results and with her husband, they bought a house and set up a grocery store but some years later she separated from her husband and now counts on the income from the juice and fruit stand. Despite all the inconveniences, she has managed to generate resources to provide a decent life for her family.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies (fruits and disposables), plastics containers and utensils, this will allow her to fulfil the sanitary requirements demanded by authorities and also improve the image of her store, attracting new clients and improving her earnings that she receives in sales.

Gladis says her biggest wish is to continue strengthening her business so that it is more profitable and which guarantees an economic stability in order to continue supporting her children giving them an adequate university education so that they become people with integrity and forge a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (fruits and disposables), plastics containers and utensils.

loans.name: Pablito Roga Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Pablito Roga está en el 1er ciclo, es un grupo nuevo que tiene puesta las esperanzas en el programa de comités, que les permitirá poder seguir creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Arminda por su parte se dedica a vender bebidas de todo tipo, comenta que con esfuerzo pudo montar su pequeño negocio que hoy le ayuda a dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Comenta que gracias a que tiene variedades siempre, esta con una buena clientela formada.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de vinos, cervezas, gaseosas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y mejorando sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
The Pablio Roga group is in its first cycle.  It is a new group that has placed its hopes in the Committees Program.  It will allow them to be able to continue growing and improving their living conditions and those of their families.

Arminda sells all types of drinks.  She states that, with effort, she set up her small business.  It now helps her to give her family everything that she was not able to have.  She says that thanks to always having a variety, she has a good, established client base.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy wine, beer, soft drinks, and more.  This way she will be able to continue growing and improving her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy wine, beer, soft drinks, and more.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo es de la Ciudad de Santaní, es mecánico, es soltero, tiene casa propia. Es un muchacho trabajador, responsable y muy honesto, comenta que empezó a trabajar como ayudante en un taller, cuando entro a trabajar ni conocía las herramientas ni de que se trataba un motor de una motocicleta, con la voluntad de trabajar y de salir adelante supero todos los obstáculos que tenía.
Su sueño de siempre era de ser un mecánico y aprendió mucho en el taller donde empezó y gracias a eso al correr de los años abrió para su propio taller. Ahora cuenta ya trabaja de forma independiente tiene su propio taller cuenta con clientela bien formada.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la ampliación de su taller, y de esa forma poder seguir mejorando el servicio que presta a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hugo is from the city of Santaní.  He is a mechanic, and he is single.  He has his own house.  He is a hard-working, responsible, and very honest young man.  He says that he started to work as a helper in a shop.  When he started to work, he did not even know the tools or anything about a motorcycle motor.  With the desire to work and to get ahead, he overcame all of the obstacles that he had.

His dream has always been to be a mechanic.  He learned a lot at the shop where he started.  Thanks to this, over the years he opened his own shop.  He says that he now works independently.  He has his own shop, and he has an established customer base.

He is requesting this loan to be able to expand his shop.  This way he will be able to continue improving the service he provides to his customers.

loans.use: to expand his mechanic's shop.

loans.name: Las Puntuales Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Consuelo  mujer de 52 años de edad, acompañada, con cinco hijos mayores, su negocio es la  venta de prendas de oros y plata desde hace 20 años negocio que le permitió sacar a sus hijos y familias adelante  en la vida, ella  misma comercializa sus  productos y viaja a municipios cercanos a su domicilio, el crédito que solicita es para invertir en productos como anillos de damas, anillos de hombre, pulseras de pie, pulseras de mano, aretes, cadenas gruesas, cadenas finas, tanto de material de oro como material de plata. Rubí es una mujer que tiene 31 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada, ropa nueva, Rosa tiene 44 años y su negocio es el destace de cerdo y Nilda tiene 50 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa, calzado, hielo, refrescos naturales etc.
texts.en:
The group has four members, who are successful female entrepreneurs. One of them is Consuelo, a 52-year old woman who lives with her partner and five adult children. She makes a living selling gold and silver items and has been in the business for 20 years. This has allowed her to support her children and family. She directly sells her products and travels to municipalities nearby. 

She will use the loan to buy products, such as women and men rings, ankle and wrist bracelets, earrings, and thick and thin necklaces, all of them in gold and silver materials.

Rubí is a 31-year old woman who sells used and new clothes. Rosa is 44 and works in pig butchering, and Nilda is 50 and sells clothes, shoes, ice, natural soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: to buy products, such as women and men rings, ankle and wrist bracelets, earrings, and thick and thin necklaces, all of them in gold and silver materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
Maria vive en al ciudad de Chincha, cada día se levanta muy temprano para poder trabajar en su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre de un pequeño de 3 años al cual quiere mucho.

Maria esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio y de esta manera poder abastecer su negocio y mejorar la atención a sus clientes, asi ella seguirá trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Poder retomar ss estudios y brindarle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Maria lives in the city of Chincha. She wakes up very early every day to work in her clothes-selling business. This allows her to obtain income and get ahead, especially considering she has a 3-year old son whom she loves very much. 

Maria is grateful to Kiva because thanks to their support she will be able to buy supplies, stock her business and improve customer service. She will keep working and fighting towards her big dream: "to resume her studies and provide her son with a good education".

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Es una mujer sociable, tiene 48 años de edad, casada, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas. Tiene 28 años de ser docente. Tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales 2 son mayores de edad, que han formado su familia y 4 adolescentes que se encuentran estudiando. Con el objetivo de apoyar a su familia, reducir el hacinamiento, ya que actualmente habitan 8 personas y vivir de manera segura, solicita su noveno préstamo a Pana Pana para construir un anexo de concreto y utilizarlo como cuarto para sus nietos. Con los créditos anteriores que le ha brindado Pana Pana, le ha permitido mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, tales como: Mejorar el techo, la letrina. Aún recuerda con alegría que hace cinco años con el primer financiamiento que le brindo Pana Pana, le permitió cambiar la madera de su vivienda. Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto (cemento), continuar apoyando a su familia y a su nieto que se encuentra delicado de salud y comprar algunos electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Delia is a friendly woman, 48 years old and married, and originally from Puerto Cabezas. She has been a teacher for 28 years.
She has six children. Two of them are adults with their own families, and four are teenagers who are still in school.
With the goal of supporting her family, reducing overcrowding (since there are eight people living in her home), and living more securely, she is requesting her ninth loan from Pana Pana to build a concrete addition on her home, to be used as a bedroom for her grandchildren.
Previous loans from Pana Pana have allowed her to improve her home, such as by repairing the roof and the latrine.
She still looks back with happiness on her first loan from Pana Pana five years ago, which enabled her to replace the wood in her home.
Her dream is to build a concrete home, continue supporting her family and her sick grandson, and buy some home appliances.

loans.use: to build a concrete addition on her home and use it as a bedroom for her grandchildren.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bonnie fish, rice, coal, and pigs' feet for her business.

loans.name: Naveeda

texts.en: Naveeda, age 43, is a married woman who enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory. She has been doing it for many years and has retained a good number of customers. She has three daughters and two sons. Her husband is not in good physical shape to support her family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes and education.  In order to meet the growing demand of embroidery, she needs to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors so she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation. She expects to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
La señora Ninfa es casada, y tiene dos hijas, tiene casa propia, es comerciante propietaria de una bodega y despensa bien surtida con buena ubicación donde día a día trabaja para poder sacar adelante a su familia, todo esto con la ayuda de su esposo.
Es una señora humilde, trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta, se esfuerza día tras día para poder salir adelante y de alcanzar sus metas, comenta que empezó con un pequeño Kiosko, donde vendía hielo, helados y comidas rápidas soñaba siempre de tener una despensa y ventas de bebidas en general Al correr de los años y  con su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su marido e hijos amplio su negocio mando construir un salón más grande para poder surtir más su Kiosko y para habilitar su una bodega.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas, comestibles, verduras, frutas y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, dando a sus clientes todo lo que piden.
texts.en:
Ninfa is married and has two daughters.  She owns a well-stocked store in a good location.  She works there day to day in order to be able to get her family ahead.  She does all of this with help from her husband.

She is a humble, hard-working, responsible, and very honest woman.  She puts forth great effort day after day in order to be able to get ahead and reach her goals.  She says that she started with a small kiosk where she sold ice, ice cream, and fast food.  She always dreamed of having a store and general drink sales.  Over the years, with her effort and help from her husband and children, she expanded her business.  She directed the construction of a bigger room in order to be able to stock her kiosk more and to set up a store.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy drinks, food, vegetables, fruit, and more.  This way she will be able to continue with her sales by giving her customers everything they ask for.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, vegetables, fruit, and more.

loans.name: Jorge Antonio

texts.es:
Jorge Antonio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como guarda de seguridad  casado con una familia compuesta por 4 hijos y su esposa  el salario del él es el único ingreso para su familia ya que su esposa se queda al cuido de sus hijos de los cuales dos de ellos están en edad escolar.
El señor Jorge le solicita un crédito a kiva para  los gasto de uniformes , compra de libros y cuadernos  y  el pago de matrículas para el inicio del año escolar 
Ya que para él es una satisfacción que sus hijos asistan a la escuela  a recibir el pan del saber
texts.en:
Jorge Antonio lives in the city of Managua and works as a security guard. He is married and his family consists of his wife and four children. His salary is the only income his family receives since his wife takes care of the children. Two of his children are in school.

Sr. Jorge is requesting a Kiva loan to pay for expenses such as uniforms, books, notebooks, and the tuition for the start of the school year. He is pleased that his children are attending school so that they can become more knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for uniforms, school supplies, and tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estella es una mujer de 56 años, viuda y madre de dos hijos adultos, dedicada a la producción y venta de alimentos como arepas de chócolo, morcilla y tamales, lo que aprendió desde niña al lado de su madre.
Estella tuvo que abandonar su actividad durante dos años, a causa de un derrumbe que le destruyó su casa. Ahora está retomando su negocio para tener un ingreso, ya que su esposo falleció y si bien sus hijos le ayudan, ella quiere sustentarse sin tener que molestarlos. Por lo que invertirá el crédito en la compra de insumos (verduras, grano, carnes), un fogón y la pipeta de gas, con lo que puede trabajar desde su casa por las mañanas y salir a vender los productos en la tarde.
Estella sueña con ampliar su negocio y fidelizar cada día más clientes.
texts.en:
Estela is a 56-year old woman, widow and mother of two adult children. She cooks and sells food, such as "arepas de chócolo" (sweet corn cakes with cheese), blood sausage and "tamales" (corn-based pastry), an activity that she learned from her mother when she was a little girl. Estela had to stop the activity for 2 years after her house collapsed. She is now restarting her business to obtain income, given that her husband passed away. Her children are willing to support her, but she wants to support herself without having to disturb them. 

She will use the loan to buy ingredients (vegetables, grains, meats), a stove and a gas bottle, so that she can work from home in the mornings and sell her products in the afternoon. Estela's dream is to expand her business and increase her loyal client base.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (vegetables, grains, meats), a stove and a gas bottle.

loans.name: Saparbu

texts.ru: Сапарбу 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей. Все дети проживают отдельно со своими семьями. У Сапарбу - среднее образование, оптимистичная, трудолюбивая. Супруг находится на заработках в России, высылает часть своей зарплаты семье в Кыргызстан. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сапарбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 33 года назад, с покупки скота на 4,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сапарбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 8 дойных коров, 15 овец. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: отгонные пастбища, корма. Зимой скот содержит у себя в хозяйстве, а с весны и до осени выгоняют на выпас чабану на пастбище. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сапарбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сапарбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Saparbu is 51, married, and has three children. All of her kids live away from home with their own families. Saparbu has a high school education and is optimistic and hardworking. Her spouse lives and works in Russia and sends part of his earnings home to Kyrgyzstan. Saparbu earns her family's main income through animal husbandry, which she first got involved in 33 years ago when she purchased livestock for 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Saparbu currently has eight dairy cows and 15 sheep. She has everything necessary to care for the animals, including pasture land and feed. She keeps the animals at the farm during the winter and turns them out to pasture with a shepherd from spring to fall. She earns 15,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, Saparbu applied for a loan with the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan to buy calves to increase her livestock headcount. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save enough money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es:
Sayda vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la ganadería y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar alimento para sus animales como concentrados y forrajes. 

Agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sayda lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco in the south of Peru. She is an enterprising and hard working woman who has improved her family's conditions through her principal economic activity of raising livestock and everything is going well. With this opportunity, she is in need of more feed for her animals like concentrates and fodder. 

She thanks the lenders and promises to be responsible in her repayments.

loans.use: purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Genaro Carlos

texts.es: El señor Genaro tiene 53 años, casado con hijos ya mayores de edad, se dedica a la actividad de confección y venta de trajes de pepino un traje muy usado para estos carnavales, el  tiene su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de la Illampu de la ciudad de La paz donde se encuentra variedad de disfraces para toda ocasión,  este es su primer crédito con la institución el señor Genaro va usar este préstamo para  la compra de tela por mayor,  para mejorar su producción ya que esta época es de mucha demanda de trajes que tiene que entregar, el señor Genaro es un apersona muy trabajadora tiene ganas de seguir delante de mejorar  su calidad de vida. En la foto el señor Genaro esta junto a su esposa.
texts.en: El señor Genaro is 53 years old with adult children. He works primarily in making and selling costumes used during Carnival. He has his own workshop that is located in the zone La LLampu in the city of La Paz. He makes a variety of costumes for all occasions. This is his first loan. He is going to use it to purchase fabric on wholesale in order to improve his production because he has entered a season of high demand and he needs to finish orders. Genaro is a hard working person who wants to get ahead and improve his quality of life. In the photo, Genaro appears with his wife.

loans.use: purchase fabric for wholesale in order to make costumes.

loans.name: Luis Ernesto

texts.es: Ernesto es un adulto de 53 años, quien a raíz de perder su empleo, monta una tienda de abarrotes, dulces y gaseosas, pensando que así no tendría que salir de su casa y que podría aprender a llevar su economía por sus propios medios. Invertirá su crédito en la compra de surtido para la tienda (mecato, granos, galletería, lácteos y otros productos de la canasta familiar) y mantenerla agradable para sus clientes Ernesto sueña con ver a su hijo de 10 años convertido en un profesional, para lo cual trabaja incansablemente desde las 7am hasta las 20 horas todos los días.
texts.en: Ernesto is 53 years old, and after losing his job decided to start a small store from which he sells groceries, sweets, and sodas. He works from his home and is now solely responsible for his economic situation. Ernesto will invest his loan in the purchase of items for his shop (snacks, grains, cookies, milk products, and other basic goods), in order to continue to serve his clients. His dream is to see his 10 year old son grow up and become a professional, which is why he works tirelessly from 7am to 8pm every day.

loans.use: to buy items to stock his store (snacks, grains, cookies, milk products, and other basic goods)

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda is a married woman and has been running her own beauty parlor for many years. She is doing her job passionately; she knows the techniques of makeup and hair styling. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Chanda is a responsible mother of four children. She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been running her business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has one cow, which she uses for selling milk to the people in her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Zubaida has become known for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 5th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow. Zubaida is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en: Asima is a 24-year-old married woman. She has been in business selling milk with her husband for the past three years. She has one cow, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. Asima has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and certified seeds for potato cultivation

loans.name: Lana

texts.en:
Lana is a 29-year-old, hard-working woman from the Samtredia district. She lives with her husband and school-aged son. Lana's husband is a baker and earns 300 GEL monthly. 

To satisfy her family's increased needs, Lana has engaged in a trading business. She purchases clothes at wholesale prices and sells them locally. From this activity, Lana has a small income and has been motivated to start another lucrative activity. 

With her own saved money, she has built a greenhouse and is now requesting money to develop this new business. She wants to install irrigation in the greenhouse, and purchase seeds, chemicals and a tractor. This new business will give her the opportunity to become financial stable and to earn important income seasonally. 

Lana will be very grateful and will greatly appreciate your help.

loans.use: To buy seeds, chemicals and a tractor, and to install irrigation in the greenhouse

loans.name: Margot Drina

texts.es: La señora Margot tiene 30 años, tiene dos hijos de las de 8 y 5  años, ella se dedica a la venta de la sagrada hoja de coca, ella vende sus productos en el acopio de coca de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Margot,  va a usar este préstamo para compra de coca por taque ya que esta época la hoja de coca es muy escasa por las lluvias que hay en la zona de los Yungas,  y esto hace que suba el precio, por eso ella necesita el dinero para comprar y abastecerse de este producto, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Margot enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Margot is 30 years old and has two children, ages 8 and 5. She sells the sacred coca leaf and offers her products at a coca distribution center in the city of La Paz. This loan is her first transaction with Emprender.

Sra. Margot will use the loan to buy coca leaves by the sack since the supply is scarce as a result of the rains that have hit the District of Los Yungas. This has resulted in an increase in the price, so she needs the money to buy and build up her reserve of this product. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can increase her inventory of merchandise.

Sra. Margot faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with the competition. She will utilize her profits by continuing to buy merchandise so that she can generate more income. Margot is pleased and grateful for the opportunity she has received to grow her business and improve her income. In the end, she will improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of coca leaves to resell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 42-year-old married woman. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña guapa 2 está en su segundo ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2 de las 20 señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, que están luchando y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Epifania quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir  que debe seguir esforzándose por mejorar. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa y sumado a la venta de ropas que hace, se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas varias para la venta, como ser jeans, remeras, pantalones, shorts y demás, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Guapa 2 is in its second loan cycle for the women's committee, where all of them are committed to working and providing mutual support so they can all make progress.
They are conducting a survey to eliminate poverty. Two of the ten women are under the poverty line and are working hard to improve their conditions in life.
One of the members is Epifanía, who is at the highest level of poverty. She must keep working to improve.
Through her efforts and ongoing labor, and by applying the behaviors characteristic of a successful woman engaged in the business of selling clothing, she is gradually improving her situation.
She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in buying clothing to sell such as jeans, T-shirts, pants, shorts, and so on, and thereby continue her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy jeans, T-shirts, pants, shorts, and other clothing.

loans.name: Uriel

texts.es: Uriel tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo. Su actividad económica de Uriel es la venta de artefactos como televisores, computadoras y celulares, él tiene una pequeña tienda que esta ubicado en su casa y desea ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de artefactos. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar artefactos como por ejemplo radios y televisores.
texts.en: Uriel is 35 years old, lives with his partner, and has one child. His primary economic activity is selling electronics such as television sets, computers, and cell phones. He has a small store located in his home from which he sells such electronics, and he wants to grow and improve his business. Currently, Uriel is requesting this loan in order to buy more devices to sell, such as radios and television sets.

loans.use: to buy devices such as radios and television sets

loans.name: Mauricio Enrique

texts.es: Mauricio es un campesino de 41 años de edad, tiene una fábrica de arepas de maíz en la ciudad de Sincelejo que ha sido su sustento familiar, y hace poco más de un año se dedica también a la cría de pollos de engorde, gallinas y truchas, negocio que ha sido de tradición familiar. Hace las ventas en las tiendas y a los vecinos de la vereda. Quiere invertir su crédito en la compra de más gallinas, pollos de engorde y la ampliación del lago para la cría de las truchas. El sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, generar empleo y mejorar la calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en: Mauricio is 41 years old, lives in the countryside, and has a store from which he makes and sells corn arepas (traditional Colombian snack) in the city of Sincelejo. This has been his main method of supporting his family. However, a little over a year ago, Mauricio decided to also raise chickens, hens and trout, business which has been in his family. He sells his produce in various stores as well as directly to neighbors in his area. He wants to invest his loan in the purchase of more hens and chickens, as well as to enlargen the lake where he cultivates the trout. His dream is to grow his business, generate employment, and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more hens and chickens, and later to enlargen his lake for trout cultivation

loans.name: Edgar Jose

texts.es: Edgar es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, soltero y padre de un hijo. Tiene 23 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos. Inicio su negocio con el apoyo de su papa quien lo impulso para crear su propio negocio y hasta el día de hoy lo ha mantenido con esfuerzo y dedicación. Su meta próxima es diversificar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Blusas, Pantalones, Sandalias entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ampliar la variedad de sus productos. Su plan futuro es aumentar su inventario y así obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Edgar, originally from the city of Estelí, is a single father of one son. He is 23 years old. He is a businessman who works selling clothes and shoes. He began his business with the help of his father who pushed him to create his own business, and ever since he has maintained it through his hard work and dedication. His next goal is to diversify his product offerings. He is asking for this loan in order to buy blouses, pants, and sandals, among other items. He believes that this loan will be very helpful to him, as it will allow him to increase the variety of his prodcuts. His future plan is to continue diversifying and increasing his inventory, in order to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, and sandals, among other items

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María Jesús es una joven de 27 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo quien esta pequeño el cual depende de ella únicamente. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo cursado hasta el 6 grado y se dedica al cultivo de hortaliza como ser: papa, brócoli, coliflor, lechuga, repollo, etc. así como también el cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijol. Actividades inculcadas por sus padres desde muy pequeña quienes son agricultores por generaciones familiares. El terreno que ella trabaja es propio gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres. Su producto es comercializado en el mercado local y vendido a los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona.
María Jesús solicita ayuda para invertir en su cultivo de papa comprando fertilizantes y abono para fortalecer la planta, sus raíces y la tierra en la que esta plantado el producto.
Sus planes a futuro son los de poder mejorar sus cosechas mediante la ampliación mejorar sus ingresos, como también los de seguir cultivando pero en cantidad y calidad para ofrecer más a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Jesús is 27 years old and a single mother of one child who is financially dependent on her. She attended school through Grade 6 and she farms vegetables like potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, lettuce, cabbage, etc. She also grows basic grains like corn and beans. She learned this from her parents at a very young age as her family has been farmers for generations. 

The land she works is her own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents. She sells her product in the local market and through the different middlemen who come to the area. María Jesús is requesting a loan to invest in her potato crops, buying fertilizer and manure to strengthen the plants, their roots and the ground they are planted in. Her plans for the future are to expand her crops by planting more in order to increase her income. And she wants to continue planting but with more quality and quantity to offer to her clients.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her potato crops.

loans.name: Hernán Ramón

texts.es:
Herman Ramón  vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja desde hace muchos años como conductor de una empresa del estado. 
El señor Herman está solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como piedra, cemento, hierro para llevar a cabo la construcción del porche  de su casa esto con el fin de darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda ya que es la parte del frente de su casa 
Confiando mucho en dios y a  las personas que están  trabajando con los financiamientos, kiva para poder   hacer las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Herman Ramón lives in the city of Managua. He has worked for many years as a driver for a state company. Herman is requesting a loan to buy construction material like stone, cement and re-bar to finish construction of the porch of his house. This will provide more security to his house as it is at the front of the house. He has confidence in God and the people who are working with the loans, Kiva, to be able to undertake these improvements to his home.

loans.use: to buy construction material.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Djicoroni. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de condiments (persils, aubergines, choux), poissons fumés, viandes et  produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fanta (femme debout en 2ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (persils, aubergines, choux).  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 corbeilles d’aubergines, 2 corbeilles de persils, 4 corbeilles de choux à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fanta compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and mainly living in polygamous households, the four members of the Benkadi group are on average 38 years old with six children. They all live in Djicoroni and met around the neighbourhood and through their income generating activities at the market in Djicoroni. The members of this group sell condiments (parsley, eggplants, and cabbage), smoked fish, meat and cosmetic products. With the objective of expanding their businesses, the members of this group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their third solidarity loan.
Mrs. Fanta, (who is standing second from the left in the photo) is a well-known condiment seller. She will use her loan to buy four baskets of eggplants, two baskets of parsley, and four baskets of cabbage at Bamako. She will sell the merchandise by retail to her mainly female clientele. Mrs. Fanta hopes to make an average monthly profit of 60 000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and to cover her minor household expenses.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy car products such as soap, carpet shampoo, filters, grease, and glass cleaner

loans.name: Zuhran

texts.en: Zuhran is a 41-year-old married woman. (The man shown in the photo is Zuhran’s husband.) She is a responsible mother of six children and is able to provide them with the basic necessities of life. She has been helping in her husband's business of furniture making. They have been doing it together for many years. Over time they have become famous for providing good quality furniture in her community.   In order to purchase good quality wood along with packs of polish and nails in larger quantities, she applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf foundation. In this way they would be able to cater to more customers without delay, which ultimately helps in bringing more cash home. Zuhran dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood along with packs of polish and nails

loans.name: Mercedes Nicolasa

texts.es:
Mercedes de 65 años de edad, soltero sin hijos, bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su familia. Desde muy joven trabaja para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad su carga se ha minorado, porque sus hijos son adultos en independientes, pero siempre lucha día  a día para seguir aportando para los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de frutas y verduras como piña, bananos, naranjas, pipián, yuca, plátanos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, de forma ambulante recorre las calles  con un peso unos 10 kg. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de frutas y verduras para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mercedes agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 65 years old, single, and without any children living at home. She is originally from Leon, which is located in the western region of the country. She is very hardworking, responsible, and has a great desire to get ahead in life. In her free time, she enjoys spending time in the company of her family. Ever since she was young she has worked to assist with her family's expenses. Currently, her workload has decreased, as her children are now all independent adults. Nonetheless, she still works hard every day to continue supporting her home. 

Thanks to her hard work and her desire to get ahead, she has a business selling fruits and vegetables such as pineapple, bananas, oranges, pipian and yucca. She works 10 hours a day, offering her products on the streets. Sometimes she carries up to 10 kilograms of produce at a time. Her goal with this new loan is to stock her business with more fruits and vegetables, in order to improve her income in the not to distant future. Mercedes is very grateful for the help that KIVA lenders provide to low-income borrowers in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can work with dignity.

loans.use: to stock her business with fruits and vegetables such as pineapple, bananas, oranges, pipian, and yucca

loans.name: Renacer Ii Group

texts.es:
MELISSA DE 27 AÑOS, ES UNA JOVEN MUY ALEGRE Y TRABAJADORA.
ESTA CASADA CON ALDO Y ESTÁN EN LA ESPERA DE SU PRIMER HIJO, PERTENECE AL GRUPO RENACER II, CONFORMADO EN SU TOTALIDAD POR MUJERES TRABAJADORAS.
ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES EN UN PEQUEÑO ESPACIO QUE ACONDICIONO EN SU CASA, SUS PRINCIPALES CLIENTES SON SUS VECINOS.
EL PRÉSTAMO QUE ELLA OBTUVO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA PARA SU TIENDA, COMO ARROZ, AZÚCAR, FIDEOS, LECHE, ETC.
MELISSA SE ENCUENTRA MUY AGRADECIDA CON LAS PERSONAS DE KIVA  YA QUE SIN CONOCERLA, FINANCIAN SUS NEGOCIOS

EN LA FOTOGRAFIA, MELISA ES LA PRIMERA DE LA DERECHA, VISTE CON CASACA MORADA Y CHOMPA CELESTE. (EN LA FOTO ESTA TAMBIÉN LA PEQUEÑA HIJA DE ROSY).
texts.en:
Melissa, 27 years old, is a very happy and hardworking young woman. She is married to Aldo, and together they are awaiting the arrival of their first son. Melissa is a member of the lending roup "Renacer II," composed entirely of entrepreneurial women. 

Melissa works selling groceries from a small space in her home. Her main clients are her neighbors. She will use the loan that she receives to purchase merchandise for the store, including rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc. Melissa is very grateful for the help provided by KIVA lenders, who help her to finance her business even though they do not know her. 

In the photograph, Melissa is the first woman on the right, dressed with a purple jacket and blue shirt. Her daughter Rosy is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and other groceries

loans.name: Pablo Exalon

texts.es:
Pablo Exalon vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como conductor en una universidad de la capital 
Muy  dedicado en su trabajo para cumplir con las obligaciones que tiene con su familia.
Pablo está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de zinc y perlines para su casa ya que con el paso de los años se le ha venido deteriorando y esto solo lo puede hacer con el financiamiento que kiva le otorgue y así poder darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo Exalon lives in the city of Managua and works as a driver for a university located in the city. He is very dedicated to his work in order to be able to provide for his family. 

Pablo is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of metal sheeting and beams for his house, since it has been deteriorating over the years and he wants to make some repairs. Only with the help of this loan from KIVA will he be able to do so and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Nilo Marcio

texts.es:
Nilo de 51 años de edad, casado con un hijo de menor de edad, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su hijo, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, y la distribuccion de gaseosas, una pulperia  es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, sal, fósforos, jabón, tiste, frutas, jugos, gaseosas, galletas. El  dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Nilo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Nilo, 51 years old, married with a young child, is originally from Leon, a city located in the western region of Nicaragua. He is a very hardworking, responsible man, with a great desire to get ahead in life. In his free time, he enjoys spending time with his son. Unfortunately, because of his limited economic resources, Nilo was unable to pursue advanced studies as he was forced to begin working at an early age to support his home.  

However, thanks to his hard work and effort, he distributes soda and also has a small store from which he sells groceries such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, salt, matches, soap, fruit, juice, soda and cookies. He works 12 hours a day from an area set aside for the business in his home. His goal is to stock his business with more items, so that in the near future he can improve his earnings. Nilo is very grateful for the help of KIVA lenders, who help low income borrowers in poor countries to have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock his business with goods such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, salt, matches, soap, fruit, juice, soda, and cookies.

loans.name: Manos De Trabajo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Manos de Trabajo está conformado por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un hombre, padres y madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente la mayoría de los integrantes de esta asociación comunal no estudiaron por falta de recursos económicos. En la actualidad lucha para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora  tiene por actividad económica  la venta de cerdos en su casa de habitación, y por encargo, ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos en pie para la venta. La asociación comunal Manos de Trabajo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The lending group "Manos de Trabajo" (Working Hands) is composed of 8 members - 7 women and 1 man - responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children between them. These group members are from Malpaisillo, located in the western region of the country and characterized by its hardworking and responsible people. Unfortunately, the majority of the members of this lending group were unable to study due to limited econmic resources. Currently, all are fighting to provide a better future for their children. 

Thanks to her hard work and effort, the coordinator of this group has a business raising and selling pigs from her home. She works 10 hours a day. Currently, her goal is to buy more pigs to raise. The "Manos de Trabajo" group is very grateful for KIVA lenders who offer low income borrowers in poor countries such as Nicaragua the opportunity to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Primero Dios Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellos es Dámaso tiene 58 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos ya mayores y uno a su cargo,si bien es cierto es agricultor siembra granos basicos actualmente  su negocio es la venta de granos básicos por quintal como maíz, frijoles desde hace 11 años consecutivos, tiene 5 años de ser cliente de la institución, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos básicos por quintal como arroz, frijoles, maíz. Rolando tiene 51 años de edad y su negocio es tener un taller de calzado en su domicilio y María tiene 54 años de edad su negocio es la venta de sandalias de toda variedad.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three enterprising members. One of them is Dámaso, who is 58 and married. He has two adult children and one who is still under his care. Though he is a farmer and grows staple grains, he has had a business selling products such as corn and beans by the hundredweight for 11 years. He has been a member of this institution for five years. He will use this loan to buy products such as rice, beans, and corn.
Rolando is 51 years old. He is a cobbler and runs his business out of his house. Maria is 54 year old, and she sells a wide variety of sandals.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, beans, and corn.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of two children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers, buttons, and laces, to meet increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of zippers, buttons, and laces.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Sabougnouma ont en moyenne 36 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pagnes wax, boissons et des  condiments. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatim (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagnes wax. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 pièces de pagnes wax en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Fatim compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Sabougnouma group are married and living mainly in monogamous families. On the average, they are 36 years old, with three children. They all live in Kanadjiguila and know each other as neighbors as well as through the work at the Kanadjiguila market. The group members work as vendors selling traditional “pagnes wax” fabric, beverages and condiments. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan.

Mrs. Fatim (the one standing on the far left in the photo) is a well-known vendor of “pagnes wax” fabric. She plans to use her loan to buy 25 sets of pagnes was wholesale at the big market. She sells retail in Kanadjiguila and as a street vendor, mainly to female customers. Mrs. Fatim plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 70,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for some minor household needs.

loans.use: to buy traditional fabric.

loans.name: Danixa

texts.es:
Danixa pertenece al banco comunal “EMPRENDEDORES DE SAN CRISTOBAL” de la Asociación Arariwa.  

Danixa vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Ella se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción como piedras,cemento,arena entre otros. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y les va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cemento. 

Danixa está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota en el tiempo estipulado
texts.en:
Danixa belongs to the lending group "Emprendedores de San Cristobal", part of the microfinance instittution Asociación Arariwa. 

Danixa lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in the south of Peru. She works selling construction materials such as stone, cement, and sand, among others. She has had this business for many years and it is doing well. Currently, she is asking for this loan to buy more supplies such as cement. 

Danixa is happy to receive this loan, and promises to make all loan repayments as they become due.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 48-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business selling animals for many years. She started this business because her husband’s income was not sufficient to meet their household expenses. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

At present, Parveen has three goats. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, Parveen has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to purchase two more goats. She is in her sixth loan cycle, with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Bahía  (Azogues) Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres de la Bahía está formado por 7 socias y 2 socios quienes viven en la ciudad de Azogues, esta ciudad se caracteriza por ser la capital de la provincia del Cañar, su clima es frió, su gente se dedican a varias actividades como es la agricultura, albañilería, artesanías etc., y muchos de ellos han migrado en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades, su estructura arquitectónica se encuentra inclinada por su geografía accidentada. Las socias son mujeres que luchan día a día para mejorar su estabilidad económica y a su vez luchan para entregarles a sus hijos mejores oportunidades de vida y con su ejemplo que lleguen lejos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Inés, tiene 65 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos mayores de edad que están casados y viven  independientes, su esposo es de profesión mecánico, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Inés se dedica al comercio y al alquiler y confección de ropa ya que cuenta con un título profesional en corte y confección, esta actividad que realiza desde hace 43 años y le ha dado estabilidad económica, labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar ropa para alquilar y material para confeccionar como telas e hilos. Su meta es de continuar trabajando y espera conservar su salud.
texts.en:
The lending group "Mujeres de la Bahía " is formed by 9 members who live in the city of Azogues, the capital of the Cañar province, known for its cold weather. Residents of this city are dedicated to agriculture, construction, handicrafts, and other activities, and many of them have migrated in search of better opportunities. The members of this group work hard every day to improve their economic stability, and fight to provide their children with better opportunities in life. 

One of the group members, Inés, is 65 years old, married, and has 6 grown children who are themselves married and living independently. She and her husband, who works as a mechanic, live in their own home. Inés works repairing and making clothes, which she has been doing for the past 43 years. This work has provided her with economic stability. She works all week without a fixed schedule. 

With this loan, Inés will invest in the purchase of clothing, fabric, thread, and other items that she needs to do her work. Her goal is to continue working and preserve her health.

loans.use: to buy clothing, fabric and thread

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan nació y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al Sur del Peru. Su actividad económica es la venta de cámaras digitales de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cámaras.
texts.en: Susan was born in and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru. She sells digital cameras on the streets of the city. She has been doing so for many years and has been doing well in this business. Currently, she is asking for this loan to buy more cameras.

loans.use: to buy cameras

loans.name: Yarledis

texts.es:
Ella es yarledis, una mujer de 30 años, tiene dos hijos, el primer hijo lo tuvo en el momento que terminaba el bachillerato por esto no pudo continuar estudiando ya que debió trabajar para sacar al pequeño hijo adelante, por que la situación económica no era la mejor, ya que tenia todos los gastos del pequeño hijo.
Ella tuvo que iniciar la vida laboral donde el mínimo requerimiento era el bachillerato. el primer trabajo fue en una fabrica como rematadora y con el tiempo fue obteniendo experiencia en este campo, pese a que no era lo que ella quería en la vida vivía muy agradecida por la oportunidad ya que gracias al trabajo podía ofrecer mejor calidad de vida al hijo, pero nunca abandono la idea de estudiar lo que ella quería y no lo que por circunstancias le tocaba.
A los 22 años tuvo el segundo hijo y la situación económica volvió a decaer, ya que en el tiempo del embarazo no logro conseguir un buen empleo por la condición de gestante, después que el hijo nació pudo conseguir nuevamente empleo, pero los gastos eran aun mayores por lo que implica la manutención de un bebe y el otro hijo, por ello de momento no era posible continuar los estudios, cuando los hijos estuvieron mas grandes se disminuyeron un poco los gastos y empezó a contemplar nuevamente la idea de estudiar COSMETOLOGIA Y ESTÉTICA que era lo que siempre le había llamado la atención.
Hoy en día después de posponer tantos años el sueño que tenia logro comenzar a estudiar, cuando se encontraba estudiando una compañera le contó que KIVA era una corporación que ayudaba a los estudiantes y ella decidió postularse porque esto le seria de gran ayuda para comprar materiales o para los transportes.
Ella espera poder culminar los estudios para independizar y poder tener el propio negocio y sacar a los hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Yarledis is 30 years old and has two children. She had her first child when she was finishing school, and therefore she could not continue studying. She needed to work in order to provide for her child, since she did not have any other options. As she did not have her degree at the time, she had to take a job in a factory. Though very grateful for the opportunity, this is not what she wanted to do with her life. She never abandoned the idea of finishing her studies and always knew she did not want to let her circumstances dictate her future. 

At the age of 22, Yarledis had her second child and her economic situation once again deteriorated, especially since she could not find gainful employment while she was pregnant.
