After the birth of the child, she was able to once again find a job but her expenses were much higher than they were previously since she now had two children to take care of. For the moment, it was once again impossible for her to continue her studies. As her children grew, her expenses began to decrease and she began to consider the idea of studying cosmetology, something she had always been interested in. 

Today, after post-poning her dream for many years, Yarledis has finally managed to begin studying again. During her studies, a classmate told her about KIVA and the possibility to borrow for education expenses, and she decided to apply since this would help her pay for school materials and transportation. 

Yarledis hopes to finish her studies and become completely independent, with her own business, in order to continue providing the best life that she can to her children.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school expenses

loans.name: Jose Orlando

texts.es: El es  Jose Orlando, es una persona humilde, trabajadora,  deseosa de querer superarse en el campo de estudio y por eso quiere  estudiar técnico en administración empresarial   en campo alto, donde ve que puede alcanzar los sueños de superarse y así poder mejorar los conocimientos y poder acceder a nuevas oportunidades laborales y con esto darle a la familia mejores condiciones en todos los aspectos, el convenio con kiva es una excelente oportunidad para que estos sueños se hagan realidad y así mejorar la vida en todos los aspectos mencionados anteriormente.
texts.en: Jose Orlando is a humble, hard-working person who wants to advance in his field of study. For that purpose, he wishes to study technology in business administration at Campo Alto, where he see that he can achieve his dreams of advancing and, thus, be able to improve his knowledge and gain access to new work opportunities.  In this manner, he can offer his family better conditions in all aspects. The agreement with Kiva is an excellent opportunity to make these dreams a reality and, thereby, improve the family's lives in all the aspects previously mentioned.

loans.use: pay for a semester's matriculation in higher education.

loans.name: Jenny Paola

texts.es:
la señora jenny paola desde muy desde muy niña a tenido el interés por la carrera de la enfermería, siempre a tenido la ilusión, el sueño de ser una profesional y ayudar a las personas, pero el sueño se ve obstaculizado por motivos económicos, Por otra parte, es una persona muy responsable, estudiosa, con mucha paciencia y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Ella quiere crecer tanto a nivel laboral como personal y educativo. Con esta carrera ella puede mejorar mucho la condición de ella y la de la familia razón por la cual quiere ser mejor cada día, ya que vela mucho por ello.
Necesita el convenio por que no tiene los recursos económicos, no tiene ningún apoyo, ella sola se paga el estudio y le hes muy difícil tener saldado los gastos, por que aparte de los gastos del estudio tiene los personales y los de la familia, Pero ella anhela mucho terminar los estudios y el convenio Kiva es una gran oportunidad para que ella pueda logra ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Ever since she was a young girl, Jenny Paola has wanted to be a nurse. Her dream of becoming a professional and being able to help people was only blocked by economic limitations. However, Jenny is a very responsible person, who has studied hard, is very patient, and who has a great desire to get ahead in life. She wants to grow on a personal level as much as she wants to grow professionally. As a nurse, Jenny would be able to significantly improve her family's living condition. 

Jenny needs this loan because she does not have the resources, or family support, to pay for her studies. She will support herself entirely on her own, which will be very difficult given that she must pay for school in addition to helping with her family's expenses. Jenny very badly wants to finish her studies, and her loan from KIVA will be a great opportunity for her to do so.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition costs

loans.name: Xiomara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Xiomara del Carmen es una señora de 46 años, madre de dos hijos solamente uno a su cargo el cual está estudiando en la universidad.
Es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como recepcionista en una Institución de dicho municipio desde hace más de diez años profesión que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Se siente muy agradecida con Dios porque gracias a él y su esfuerzo como madre ya preparó como maestra a su hija mayor la que hoy es independiente y su hijo menor el que se está esforzando por terminar su carrera.
En este momento Xiomara tiene la necesidad de un crédito para cubrir los gastos universitarios de su hijo, ya que en marzo iniciarán las clases y tiene que pagar el arancel de la universidad de todo el año.
Pide el apoyo a los inversionistas de Kiva para que a través de Ceprodel le financien este crédito que tanto lo necesita porque con su salario no puede cubrir tantos gastos, ya que como en el municipio no hay universidad los estudiantes tienen que viajar hasta la ciudad de León ubicada a 90 kilómetros lo que incurre en más gastos y para las personas de escasos recursos se les hace aún más difícil pero con el propósito de superarse hacen un gran esfuerzo por llegar a cumplir sus sueños
texts.en:
Xiomara del Carmen is 46 years old. She is the mother of two children, only one of whom (who is currently attending university) is still under her care. She is originally from the municipality of Sauce, and has been working as a receptionist for the past 10 years. This work has enabled her to provide for her children. 

Xiomara is very grateful to god, because thanks to him, along with her own efforts as a mother, she has already been able to assist her older daughter through her Masters degree. This daughter is now independent, and it is now time for Xiomara to help her son finish his studies. 

Currently, Xiomara needs a loan to cover her son's university expenses, since classes start in March and she has to pay the fees for the whole year. She is asking for the help of KIVA lenders through the institution Ceprodel, to finance this loan that she needs to assist her son, since her salary is not enough to cover these expenses. There is no university located in the city where she and her son live, and all students must travel to the city of León (90 kilometers away) which implies high travel expenses as well. This makes it even more difficult for low-income families to send their kids to university, but with the goal of getting ahead and with plenty of hard work many of them are able to reach this dream.

loans.use: to pay her son's university fees

loans.name: A.a.h.h. Juan Parra Del Riego Group

texts.es:
AGRIPINA ES MADRE SOLTERA CON 02 HIJOS Y ES UNA MUJER LUCHADORA, EMPRENDEDORA Y MUY CARISMÁTICA.
ELLA SE DEDICA POR LAS MAÑANAS A LA VENTA DE FRUTAS EN SU PUESTO EN EL MERCADO DE SU LOCALIDAD, Y POR LAS TARDES  VENDE SANDWICHS.
ELLA ES EL ÚNICO SUSTENTOS DE SUS HIJOS QUE AUN ESTÁN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SUS DOS HIJOS TAMBIÉN LA APOYAN EN SUS TIEMPOS LIBRES EN EL NEGOCIO.

EL SUEÑO QUE AGRIPINA TIENE ES EL DE TENER SU CASA PROPIA, Y YA NO ESTAR PAGANDO ALQUILER Y ASÍ AHORRAR UN POCO MAS PARA LA EDUCACIÓN DE SUS HIJOS.

AGRIPINA LLEVA TRABAJANDO CON EDAPROSPO YA MAS DE 4 MESES Y SIEMPRE A SIDO PUNTUAL CON SUS PAGOS.

AGRIPINA AGRADECE INMENSAMENTE A LOS INVERSIONISTAS DE KIVA Y LES HACE LA INVITACIÓN CORDIAL PARA QUE VISITEN PERÚ 

AGRIPINA ES LA TERCERA DE LA DERECHA, VISTE CON POLO NEGRO CON RAYAS PLOMAS.
texts.en:
Agripina is the single mother of two children. She is a fighter, is hardworking, and is very charismatic. She works in the mornings selling fruit from a stand in a local market, and in the afternoons selling sandwiches. She is the only source of support for her school aged children, who help her with her business in their free time. 

Agripina's dream is to have her own home, so that she no longer has to pay rent. This will enable her to save a bit more for the education of her children. 

Agripina has been working with EDAPROSPO for more than 4 months, and has always been punctual with her loan repayments. Agripina is immensely grateful for KIVA lenders, and cordially invites them to visit Peru. In the photo, she is the third person from the right, dressed in black with white stripes.

loans.use: to buy apples, papaya, bananas, pineapples, grapes, etc.

loans.name: Tomasa Esperanza

texts.es: Tomasa, es una humilde señora que labora como conserje de una empresa y su esposo carpintero, tiene sus hijos que ya son independientes, esta pareja busca la manera de ganarse la vida con sus labores. Doña Tomasa solicita el crédito porque necesita comprar láminas de zinc y vigas ya que su techo no presenta buenas condiciones para habitar.
texts.en: Tomasa is a humble woman who works as a janitor for a local company. Her husband is a carpenter. Together they have children who are already independent. This couple is looking for a way to earn a living through their labor. Tomasa is asking for a loan to buy metal sheeting and beans for home construction, as the roof of their home is no longer in good condition.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and beams

loans.name: Lesver Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Lesver Miguel tiene la edad de 39 años, estudió la carrera de Médico Pediatra porque le gusta ayudar y sanar con la bendición de Dios a los niños, ver una sonrisa de alegría es su pasión e inspiración para hacer cada día mejor su trabajo y no un llanto de dolor por una enfermedad que le entristece al ver a los inocentes.
Con este don de paciencia y perseverancia que el señor le regaló atiende todos los días de la semana en el hospital del municipio de El Sauce a todos los niños que acuden con problemas de salud sobre todo los de escasos recursos y de las comarcas aledañas donde tiene más de cinco años de ejercer esta profesión.
El doctor Lesver como todos los conocen en el municipio es padre de familia de tres hijos dos de ellos estudiando en la universidad y uno en primaria.
Como se aproxima el inicio de clases en la universidad necesita un crédito para pagar el arancel de la universidad de su dos hijos y el hospedaje de las habitaciones donde ellos se quedan toda la semana, ya que por la distancia que queda León de El Sauce ellos no pueden viajar diario además porque es muy costoso por el pasaje y León es lo más cerca donde hay universidad.
Espera y confía en Dios que los inversionistas de Kiva apoyen su solicitud para llevar a cabo su inversión esto con el fin de que sus hijos no tengan un obstáculo para culminar su carrera en un futuro.
texts.en:
Lesver Miguel, 39 years old, studied pediatric medicine because he likes to help and heal children with the blessing of god. Seeing a smile on a child's face is a passion that inspires him to perform his job better and better each day. With patience and perseverence, Lesver tends to low-income children at the municipal hospital of Sauce. He has been working as a doctor for more than 5 years. 

Doctor Lesver, as everyone in his community knows him, is the father of 3 children - 2 of whom are currently studying at university and one of whom is in elementary school. As the beginning of the new school year is approaching, Lesver needs a loan to pay the tuition costs for his two oldest children, as well as boarding costs for them to live in Leon during the week (since it is too far and too expensive for them to travel from Sauce to Leon for classes each day). 

Lesver believes that KIVA lenders will support his request and help him with this loan, so that his children do not face any obstalces in finishing their studies in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for his children's education costs

loans.name: Akylay

texts.ru: Акылай 28 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Акылай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Акылай занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Акылай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 16 овец, также есть фруктовый сад, где растут яблоки и сливы. Фрукты реализуют оптовым покупателям. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Акылай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Акылай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en:
Akylay is 28 years old, and married with three children. She has a high school education. Her family's main income comes from livestock, a business she started nine years ago by buying cattle for 10,000 KGS. 

Through hard work, her business now consists of two dairy cows and 16 goats, as well as a fruit orchard where she grows apples and plums. She sells the fruit to wholesalers. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS. Akylay has applied for a loan from Bai-Tushum micro-finance bank to buy breeding calves to expand her business. 

She plans to use the extra income to invest in expanding her herd and buying the supplies to build a new holding space for the cattle.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a business of party supplies with her husband (also shown in the photo). They offer various colorful flowers, lights and decoration pieces for decorating homes and events like birthdays, parties, etc. They sell them to the people of their community and also supply the local market.  

Rukhsana wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of decoration pieces, artificial flowers and lights along with packs of paints in various colors. This will increase their sales and consequently their profits.  

She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy stock of decoration pieces, artificial flowers and lights along with packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Eduardo Cesar

texts.es:
EDUARDO ES UN JOVEN UNIVERSITARIO DE 19 AÑOS DE EDAD.

EL ESTUDIA INGENIERIA CIVIL EN UNA UNIVERSIDAD PARTICULAR EN SU LOCALIDAD, LLEVA ESTUDIANDO 02 AÑOS.

A EDUARDO SIEMPRE LE GUSTÓ LOS NÚMEROS  Y LE GUSTAN HACER PROYECTOS DE CONSTRUCCIÓN POR ESO QUE SE PROPUSO ESTUDIAR INGENIERÍA.

EL MÁS GRANDE SUEÑO QUE TIENE EDUARDO ES EL DE TERMINAR SU PROFESIÓN Y AYUDAR ECONÓMICAMENTE A SUS PADRES.
EL PRÉSTAMO LO UTILIZARÁ PARA EL PAGO DE SU MATRÍCULA Y DE LAS PENSIONES DE ENSEÑANZAS.
EL SE ENCUENTRA MUY SATISFECHO POR EL PRÉSTAMO CONSEGUIDO, Y A LA VEZ AGRADECIDO POR EL APOYO QUE LE ESTÁN BRINDANDO.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 19 years old and has been studying civil engineering for the past two years at a local university. Eduardo has always liked numbers, and upon graduation would like to work on construction projects. 

Eduardo's dream is to complete his studies and help support his parents economically. The loan he is currently asking for will be used to pay matriculation costs for the upcoming school year. He is very grateful for the help provided by his lenders.

loans.use: to pay matriculation expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a family member's operation

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili, who is a 53-year-old married woman, lives in the village of Kavshiri. She has a six-member family, and the important source of income they have is from agricultural activity. 

From an early age, Lili engaged in cow breeding, in cultivating maize and eggplant, and taking care of a vineyard. Lili and her husband sell their agricultural and milk products locally. However, it's difficult to lead a six-member family, cover all daily costs and satisfy their increased needs with only this mentioned income. 

Lili decided to request a loan for a trading business. She will purchase clothing and other home products at wholesale prices and then resell them among her neighbors and villagers. She will generate more money and will do her bit for the welfare of her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to start a business of trading in clothing

loans.name: Ferzana

texts.en:
Ferzana is 39 years old and married. She operates a beauty parlor, which she has been doing for nine years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her excellent services she has become very famous on her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, Ferzana would like to buy a larger variety of cosmetics products for her beauty parlor.  Because of a low cash, she requested a loan from Kashf Foundation for 50,000 PKR, which she will use to buy hair care products, skin products, and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She hopes to cater to more customers. Ferzana expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products, and creams for bleaching and whitening

loans.name: Jyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Жылдыз - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жылдыз занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жылдыз, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 5 овец, 1 лошадь. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Корма и сено заготовлены. Жылдыз также имеет небольшой земельный надел мерою 1,56 ГА, на котором ежегодно сажает картофель, пшеницу и ячмень для внутрихозяйственного использования и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жылдыз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Жылдыз планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку квартиры.
texts.en: Jyldyz is 39 years old, married and raising 3 children together with her husband. Jyldyz has a secondary education.  To provide the primary income for her family, Jyldyz is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started 21 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 3 dairy cows, 5 sheep and 1 horse.  She has all of the necessary conditions for keeping livestock.  The feed and hay have been prepared.  Jyldyz also has a small, 1.56 hectare, plot of land, where she annually plants potatoes, wheat and barley for internal consumption and sale. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Jyldyz requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy cows in order to increase livestock headcount and monthly income from sales of milk products. Jyldyz plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to buy an apartment.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 40-year-old, married woman. She is a vigorous woman and, for the past 12 years, she has been running a business, selling clothes. Naheed buys children’s clothes in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then she sells them to the people of her community for a reasonable profit. 

Naheed is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothes in different designs and sizes, to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Naheed expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.  

She is in her fourth loan cycle, with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes in different designs and sizes.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 58-year-old married woman. She is successfully running a small general store in her community with her husband. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of 3 children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of rice, grains and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history. She wishes to utilize part of revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, grains and flour.

loans.name: Yoshelin

texts.es:
YOSHELIN ES UNA CHICA MUY CARISMÁTICA, ALEGRE Y EMPRENDEDORA.

ELLA ES SOLTERA Y TIENE 19 AÑOS DE EDAD,YOSHELIN ESTUDIA ADMINISTRACIÓN DE EMPRESAS EN UNA UNIVERSIDAD PARTICULAR DE SU LOCALIDAD.

APARTE DE ESTUDIAR ELLA EN SUS RATOS LIBRES SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE ANIMALES ( CUY,  CONEJO, GALLINAS, ETC.), PARA PODER SOLVENTAR SUS ESTUDIOS, YA QUE DESDE MUY PEQUEÑA SUS PADRES BIOLÓGICOS LA DEJARON SOLA AL CUIDADO DE SUS ABUELOS.
SU MÁS GRANDE Y ANHELADO SUEÑO ES EL DE CREAR SU PROPIA EMPRESA Y GENERAR EMPLEO PARA LAS PERSONAS DE SU COMUNIDAD, ADEMÁS APOYAR ECONÓMICAMENTE A SUS ABUELOS.

YOSHELIN ESTA MUY FELIZ POR EL PRÉSTAMO OBTENIDO, YA QUE PODRÁ SEGUIR SUS ESTUDIOS.
ELLA AGRADECE A LAS PERSONAS QUE EN ELLA CONFÍAN EN LA GENTE JOVEN Y NECESITADA.
texts.en:
Yoshelin is a very charismatic, happy, and hardworking young woman. She is 19 years old, single, and studying business administration at a local univeristy. 

In her free time, she works raising animals (guinea pigs, rabbits, hens, etc.) in order to pay for her studies. When she was very young, her parents left her in the care of her grandparents, so she has always had to be somewhat resourceful. 

Yoshelin's biggest dream is to start her own business, generating employment opportunities for members of her community. Additionally, she would like to support her grandparents economically. 

Yoshelin is very happy to receive this loan and continue her studies. She is very grateful for those who trust in young people in need.

loans.use: to pay higher education expenses

loans.name: Aynek

texts.ru: Айнек 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Двое детей -строители, один сын работает в Якутии, 1 сын-студент, 1 сын-школьник. Супруг работает водителем. У Айнек - среднее образование, она домохозяйка занимается ведением домашнего и сельского хозяйства. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнек занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнек, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, также имеется 1,20 ГА земельной доли, на которой выращивает картофель и сеет зерновые культуры. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнек обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Aynek is 48 years old, married with five children. Two of them are builders, one son works in Yakutia, one son is a college student and one son is a student in school. Her husband works as a driver. Aynek has a high school education, and is a housewife managing the housework and their farming activity. 

The family's main income is from animal husbandry and farming. They started their business 14 years ago by buying cattle for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Aynek now has one dairy cow, and 1.2 hectares of land on which she grows potatoes and other crops. Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS.

Aynek has applied for a loan from Bai-Tushum micro-finance bank to buy cattle for breeding. She plans to increase her herd and pay for her children's education with the money earned.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигоре 22 года,  не замужем, проживает с родителями. У Нигоры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нигора занимается животноводством, помогают ей в этом брат и родители. Стартовала 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нигоры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 3 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нигора обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нигора планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en: Nigora is 22 years old, single and lives with her parents. Nigora has a secondary education.  To provide the primary income for her family, Nigora is involved in animal husbandry, with her brother and parents helping her.  She started 4 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 1 dairy cow and 3 sheep.  The monthly income amounts to 7,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Nigora requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. Nigora plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a new space for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Brayan Santiago

texts.es:
El joven Brayan Santiago, nació el 10 de mayo, Brayan vive con el papa, mama y hermana en el barrio Bosa la Libertad.
Brayan es un joven que está estudiando Mecánica Automotriz porque el sueño es tener una excelente formación para poder tener el propio taller de mecánica, ya que es un joven apasionado por los autos, Y así  poder brindar una forma de empleo para las personas con menos recursos. 
Es un joven que primero quiere tener una buena capacitación, como obtener primero el título de técnico laboral, después el título de tecnólogo y si es posible obtener el título de ingeniero automotriz.
Brayan por otro lado tiene otra pasión que es el fútbol, este joven en este momento está en un equipo de futbol, el cual toma como segunda oportunidad de vida, ya que es una actividad recreativa, pero el sueño de el es poder llegar a ser futbolista profesional.
Brayan divide el tiempo en estudio y deporte, ya que para ser deportista primero debe formarse como persona y tener buen estudio.
Para él, la vida lo es todo, ya que  si uno  lucha por  lo que no tiene y por lo que quiere tener, eso puede hacer que  en cierto tiempo la forma de vida pueda mejorar.
Brayan espera ser una persona con unas cualidades excelentes, las cuales le ayudaran a abrir muchas puertas en el transcurso de la formación tanto personal como laboral.
Esto es lo que Brayan espera ser y confía que con el convenio que kiva esta ofreciendo en este momento se pueda hacer realidad una parte del sueño que él tiene, sumándole las buenas acciones le ayuden a poder cumplir las metas y los sueños en un futuro.
texts.en:
Brayan Santiago lives with his father, mother, and sister in the neighborhood Bosa la Libertad. Bryan is studying to be an auto-mechanic, since his dream is to one day run his own auto shop. He has always been fascinated by cars. With this business, he hopes to be able to provide employment opportunities for low income people. 

Bryan wants to first have good training, as well as a degree, in order to finally become an automotive engineer. 

Bryan's other passion is soccer. He currently plays on a team, and though currently this is just a recreational activity he hopes to one day become a professional soccer player. 

Bryan divides his time between studying and sports, as in order to be an athlete he feels he first needs to grow as a person and have his studies behind him. For Bryan, life is everything, and he believes that if one fights for what they have and for what they want to have then life will slowly get better. Bryan hopes to be a person with excellent qualities, which well help open many doors for him in both his personal and professional lives. 

Bryan hopes that with KIVA's help, he will be able to make part of his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's matriculation expenses

loans.name: Shaiymbu

texts.ru: Шайымбу 23 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей, дошкольного возраста. У Шайымбу - среднее образование, она знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шайымбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 40,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шайымбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 10 дойных коров, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шайымбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шайымбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Shaiymbu is 23 years old, married and raising 2 school-age children together with her husband. Shaiymbu has a secondary education.  She knows precisely what she wants and tries to achieve it with all her efforts. To provide the primary income for her family, Shaiymbu is involved in animal husbandry, having started 5 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 40,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 10 dairy cows and 15 sheep.  The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Shaiymbu requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy sheep in order to increase livestock headcount. Shaiymbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and saving money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 69 years old and supports one member of his family. He runs a butchery in Nandi County and is served by VisionFund Kenya, Kapsabet office. He has been in this business for the last ten years and he gets an average monthly income of Kshs 50,000. 

He plans to use the amount borrowed of Ksh. 81,000 to buy a bull to slaughter and then resell in his butcher shop. John will use the profits from the business to repay his loan and build a new home.

He hopes to live a good life.

loans.use: To buy a bull for slaughter

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem, who is 55 years old, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to afford her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Айнагул - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнагул занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул, на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 10 овец, 2,34 ГА поливной земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает арбузы, помидоры, перец, и хлопок для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Также имеет парник на дому, в котором уже засеяны некоторые семена овощей, но требуется засеять теперь поливную землю. Примерно, доход от полеводства составляет 150 000 сом (KGS) в год. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку семян арбузов, помидоров, перца и хлопка для посевных работ. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку семейной автомашины.
texts.en:
Ainagul is 40 years old, and married with three children. She has a high school education. Their family's main income is from farming and raising livestock, which she started 20 years ago with 1,000 KGS. Thanks to Ainagul's hard work, they now have three dairy cattle, ten sheep and 2.34 hectares of land on which they grow apricots, tomatoes, peppers and cotton every year, both for their own use and to sell. 

They also have a greenhouse in which they have also planted seeds for a few different vegetables. However, she needs to irrigate the land. Her income from farming is about 150,000 KGS annually. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. Ainagul has applied for a loan from micro-finance bank, Bai-Tushum, to buy seeds (apricot, tomato, pepper and cotton) to plant. She plans to use the extra income to invest in expanding her herd and save for a family car.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, and seeds to grow watermelons, tomatoes, peppers and cotton.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra, a sus 28 años de edad, es una mujer pujante y trabajadora; motivada por la necesidad de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar, comenzó a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo productos por catálogo de marcas muy reconocidas a nivel mundial, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y lo realiza todos los días de la semana, ya que los fines de semana alterna su negocio trabajando como empleada en un negocio de comidas rápidas, lo que le permite complementar los ingresos para brindar a su hijo de 7 años el sustento diario y su educación; ya que por ser madre soltera toda la carga económica recae sobre ella.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para capitalizar su negocio, pues comprará mercancía en promoción (perfumería, cremas corporales y faciales, cosméticos) así tendrá la posibilidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos y satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, además podrá brindarles crédito, haciendo que sus ventas incrementen.
Con el ánimo de ascender a líder de ventas de la marca que ofrece, Alejandra trabaja arduamente para lograrlo, pues esto significará haber cumplido su sueño, lo que le permitirá generar mayor rentabilidad en su negocio y así podrá brindar una mejor educación a su hijo y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 28 years old, is a very hardworking woman motivated by the necesity to earn an income to support her home. She works as an independent businesswoman, selling internationally recognized brand name catalogue products. She works every day of the week, but on the weekends alternates her sales with her work as a fast food employee which allows her to complement her income and support her 7 year old son with his daily needs and education. As a single mother, all of this responsibility falls on her. 

The loan that she is currently asking for is to invest in her business. She will buy on sale merchandise including perfume, body and face cream, and other cosmetics. This way, she will be able to offer a greater variety of merchandise to her customers, and will be able to better satisfy their needs. She will also offer them credit, hopefully increasing her sales. 

With the hope of becoming a sales leader in the brands that she offers, Alejandra works hard to achieve her goals. She wants to improve the profitability of her business, in order to provide her son with a better education and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise on sale (perfume, body and face cream, makeup, etc.)

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah has a butchery business which she has been running for three years now. She also has a hotel as a secondary business. She is 25 years old, single and has two children. Right now, her monthly income from her business is KES 90,000.

She will be using the loan to buy meat for resale in her butchery. She will also buy cooking oil, vegetables, onions and cooking utensils for use in her hotel business. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya and she has paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes and dreams are to see her children get good education and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy more meat for resale

loans.name: Akhter

texts.en: Akhter is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a flour-grinding business for many years with her husband who is also shown in the photo. She is hard working and loyal. She is on her fifth loan from Kashf Foundation, requesting PKR 45,000 to purchase wheat. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a quality education for her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat for her flour-grinding business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of fowl to add to his current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, iron and stone.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is still running his boutique where he sells new clothes and shoes. His  current income is 40,000 KES.

Stephen requested his third loan from VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase new clothes at a wholesale price to sell. He will use the anticipated profit to start a new business. His dream is to open another business and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 51-year-old vigorous lady. She has been running a business selling clothes and bags. Shamim purchases clothes and bags in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Shamim requested from Kashf Foundation a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy a wide variety of clothing and bags in different colors, designs and sizes to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Shamim expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits toward the betterment of her family members. This is her fourth loan and she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing and bags in different colors, designs and sizes

loans.name: Boanerges

texts.es: Don Boanerges es originario de la ciudad de Estelí, casado. Tiene 52 años de edad. Es de oficio Técnico. Su meta es cancelar el crédito y solicitar otro y así seguir mejorando las condiciones de su hogar. Solicita el crédito para mejorar la red sanitaria de su vivienda. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para mejorar las condiciones de vida. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su cocina.
texts.en:
Boanerges is from the city of Estelí.  He is 52 years old and married.  He is a technician.

His goal is to repay the loan and to request another.  This way he will continue improving the condition of his home.

He is requesting the loan to improve the sanitary system at his house.  He believes that the loan will be a great help to improving his living conditions.  His future plan is to improve the infrastructure of his kitchen.

loans.use: to improve the sanitary system at his house.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is 54 years old and a married woman and mother of three children. 

The man shown in the photo is Majeedan’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Majeedan has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some spare auto parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Majeedan is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some spare auto parts.

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en: Mukhtar is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. She has one cow, which she uses for milk selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate extra profit. Mukhtar has become known for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is on her sixth loan, applying for PKR 45,000 to purchase one more cow. She expects to boost her sales and profit.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Makboolan

texts.en:
Makboolan is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

She and her husband have been doing agriculture work for many years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds, along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Makboolan applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, along with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Ariel Ancelmo

texts.es: El señor Ariel tiene 42 años, él se dedica a la venta de celulares, cargadores, accesorios, etc., muchas veces a pedido, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios y celulares por mayor  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tienen  pedidos de sus clientes, el señor Ariel  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de capital,  y va a utilizar los beneficios en el crecimiento del negocio su deseo  para  su negocio es tener mayores ingresos y apoyar a la familia económicamente y así mejorar su calidad de vida, se siente feliz y agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Ariel, age 42, sells cell phones, chargers, and accessories, etc.  He often sells by order.

This loan is his first cycle with the institution.  He will use the loan to buy accessories and cell phones wholesale.  His reason for requesting this loan is that he has orders from his customers.

Ariel faces the challenge in his business of the lack of capital.  He will use the profits for growth in his business.  He wishes for his business to have greater revenue and to support his family financially.  This way he will improve his quality of life.  He is happy and grateful for the opportunity provided to him by granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories.

loans.name: Adriana Dulce Maria

texts.en: Adriana lives wither her husband, Eduardo, and their three children in Totolapan. Adriana is employed by a nearby corner store, and Eduardo works in the field. They recently made an addition to their house of two bedrooms so the girls and the boy could have their own rooms. However, as it generally happens with people who self construct, they did not calculate the cost correctly and bought less materials than needed. Adriana and Eduardo could not afford to finish the construction. They have been saving for the last few months to finish what they started. Adriana is asking for a loan to finish buying the materials so they can have the two bedrooms completed. Since she and her husband have informal jobs, they do not have the opportunity to access credit in any other way. Eduardo will work on the construction, and a certified technician will supervise the work to make sure it meets the safety and quality standards. Adriana believes in hard work and is grateful for an opportunity to finish what she started long ago as just a dream.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building the bedrooms for their children

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en: Maria Cristina lives in Totolapan with her husband and daughter. Jose Luis, works as a driver and Maria Cristina sells shoes by catalog. They have been working hard and saving almost everything to do a very thorough renovation to their home. Unfortunately they did not make the right calculations and ended buying less material than what they needed. Their expenses were already high, so they just used some tin sheets as a roof for the bedrooms and a part of the porch. Maria Cristina has been saving to buy the materials and complete their house. This house has been a dream of theirs for quite some time so they are really excited. Both Maria Cristina and Jose Luis have informal jobs so access to credit is really limited. They are asking for a loan to buy the materials needed to complete the roof. Maria Cristina and Jose Luis will work to build the house and will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to make sure they meet the safety and quality standards. They have put a lot of work in their home and wish to complete their dream.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish the roof of her porch and two bedrooms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics in order to resell them

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es: Doña Josefina es originaria de La Trinidad, Estelí, casada y madre de tres hijos dos de ellos ya independientes. Tiene 42 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante. Su meta próxima es mejorar toda la infraestructura de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para optimizar el servicio sanitario de su vivienda. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá brindarle un hogar más agradable a su familia. Su plan futuro es seguir manteniendo el negocio que tiene.
texts.en:
Josefina hails from La Trinidad, Estelí. She is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are already independent. She is 42 years old, and is a shopkeeper by profession.

Her next goal is to improve the entire infrastructure of her house. She is applying for this loan to optimize the sanitary facilities in her house. She anticipates that the loan will be of great help to her, since she will be able to provide her family with a more pleasant house.

loans.use: to optimize the sanitary facilities in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy iron, metal bars, zinc layers and cement.

loans.name: Luida

texts.es: La Señorita Luida tiene 19 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de peinados y cosmetología en un instituto muy  reconocido de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Luida va a usar este préstamo para  el pago total de toda su carrera técnica y también para la compra de materiales que les piden para el estudio de peinados,  la Señorita Luida  enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar de lo que se pueda  y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder tener su propio salón de belleza.
texts.en: Luida is a 19-year old single woman who studies "hairstyle and cosmetology" in a well-known institute of La Paz. Luida will use the loan to repay her tuition in full and to buy study materials for the hairstyle piece. Luida is facing some challenges, such as the lack of financial support from her parents and the need to work in whatever she can. It is a tough situation working and study but she is willing to get ahead, finish the program and start her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to repay in full the tuition of her professional program.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is still happily married and her children are also well and still going on with school.

She is still operating her beauty shop and her monthly income is currently at Kes 70,000 per month. She has applied for her third loan with Vision fund Kenya to use in buying more beauty products and hair chemicals. She will use her profits to expand her beauty shop.

She has dreams of bringing up a happy family and owning a mega shop in this region.

loans.use: to purchase more salon boutique products.

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is still happily married and her children are also doing well.

Felistus is still selling new clothes and curtains and currently she is making a profit of about KES 8,000 per month. She is taking her fourth loan with Visionfund Kenya to purchase more curtains and new clothes to sell, and will reinvest the anticipated profits in the business.

Felistus's dream is to become a supplier and have a stable income.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and curtains for resale.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 55, has a business selling bed sheets. She buys a variety of bed sheets from the main city market and sells them to the people of her local community. She started her business because it was very difficult for her to meet her household's needs with her husband's small income. Therefore, she decided to help her husband with the earning. Now she plays a very important role in supporting her family. She has been in association with Kashf for the past seven years. 

At the present time, she is requesting a loan of amount 40,000 PKR which she will use to purchase a greater selection of bed sheets, covers and spreads by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. Nasreen expects a boost in her net income through her increased sales.

loans.use: to purchase a greater selection of bed sheets, covers and spreads.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo es un hombre trabajador y pujante de 55 años de edad, 20 de ellos dedicado a trabajar como empleado en diferentes restaurantes y cafeterías de la ciudad, de ahí adquirió la experiencia y el conocimiento necesario que lo motivó a independizarse y montar su propia cafetería, allí trabaja todos los días y cuenta con el apoyo de dos empleados; esto le permite generar los ingresos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar.
Con el fin de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará surtido al por mayor (gaseosas, mecato, dulces, alimentos preparados) y una estantería de exhibición, con esto podrá tener más variedad de productos disponibles para satisfacer los gustos de sus comensales, logrando mejorar la ventas y los ingresos que éstas generan.
Leonardo, con su espíritu de superación y tenacidad, sigue trabajando arduamente para lograr posicionar bien su negocio, pues hace poco tiempo se cambió de local y esto implica que debe darse a conocer, ofreciendo calidad y buen servicio; así habrá cumplido su mayor objetivo, con lo que podrá seguir generando ingresos y brindar un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a hard-working and strong 55 year old man.  For 20 years he has worked at different restaurants and cafeterias in the city.  That is where he acquired the experience and necessary knowledge to motivate him to become independent and to set up his own cafeteria.

He works there every day, and he has the help of two employees.  This allows him to generate sufficient income to pay for the household expenses.

In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting the help of a loan to buy stock wholesale (soft drinks, pastries, candy, prepared foods) and a display stand.  With this he will be able to have a greater variety of products available to satisfy the preferences of his diners.  He will manage to improve sales and the income that is generated.

Leonardo, with the desire to succeed and tenacity, continues working arduously in order to manage to position his business well.  A short time ago he moved his place.  It should be known that he is providing good, quality service.  This way he will fulfill his greatest objective, and he will be able to continue generating income and providing his family with improved well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (soft drinks, pastries, candy, prepared foods) and a display stand.

loans.name: Wilber Nicolas Vazquez's Group

texts.en:
Wilber, Simon and Rafael live in the "Antonio Gonzalez Curi" community, in the state of Campeche. This community is composed of 9285 inhabitants, out of which, 1.96% of adults speak some indigenous language. Of all the houses that exist in that area, only 1.7% has access to electricity. Currently, the members of this group work in agriculture, mainly harvesting corn. Furthermore, they work on the raising of sheep and cows. From these activities, they obtain the largest percentage of their income.
To illuminate their lives, they spend a large percentage of their income in purchasing sources of temporary light, that do not meet their needs. For this reason, they are sure that by acquiring a solar lighting system, they would save money, better their quality of life, spend more time with their families and allow their children to do homework at night.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will substitute the use of batteries and fuel.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy has been working in Rwanda's coffee industry for more than a decade. She has seen first hand the opportunity that it provides farmers, as well as the discrimination that women farmers often face. 

In 2013, Joy and her two friends, Peninah and Therese, started Women In Coffee Initiative, a women-owned coffee washing station that buys raw inputs from women farmers in Rwanda. Over the past year, Women In Coffee Initiative has worked hard to buy the necessary land and build the necessary drying tables to start their business.  With their internal capacity ready, Women In Coffee Initiative needs to buy a coffee washing machine, the last piece needed to officially begin their business.

Women In Coffee Initiative will not only support women coffee farmers, but they will also employ women employees.  During the washing and drying season (April - August), Women In Coffee Initiative estimates employing 75-100 workers to sort, dry, and package the washed coffee cherries.

This business has the potential to be a tremendous success.  With an experienced leader, a dedicated team, and a strategic location, Women In Coffee Initiative aims to become a strong player in both domestic and international markets. But, like many new businesses, Women In Coffee Initiative cannot access commercial bank loans because they haven't been in business long enough and their loan request is too small.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Women In Coffee Initiative can start their business and prove to Rwanda the strength of women in coffee. 

About the owners:
Joy is married with 7 children (5 boys and 2 girls) and other (8) extended family members. Joy is educated and holds a Master’s Degree in Project Management and has been working in the coffee sector since 2003.

Peninah is a single mother with 3 children (1 girl and 2 boys). Peninah did not get the opportunity finish high school because her family could not afford to pay her school fees.

Therese is widow and a mother of 2 children (1 boy and 1 girl). She dropped out of primary school because her parents were very poor.

Joy, Peninah, and Therese have been friends for decades.

loans.use: To purchase a coffee washing station and promote women coffee growers in Rwanda

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Tarana

texts.en:
Tarana lives with her husband and two children in the village of Alixanli in the Fuzuli region, but they are IDPs (Internally Displaced Persons) from Füzuli city. Tarana’s son is a student at a technical college and her daughter is in ninth class. When her daughter doesn’t have lessons, she helps her mother with her poultry business. Tarana has poultry - a few  hens, cocks, chickens, etc. She earns money by selling eggs and chickens to regular customers and neighbors. 

Tarana wants to buy more chickens to increase her business. She has applied to Kiva's partner, Komak, for a loan of 2,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Once Tarana increases her business, she will have more clients and a better monthly income. She says thanks to the Kiva organization for this aid.

loans.use: to buy more chickens

loans.name: Lidia Lizeth

texts.es: La Señora Lidia sigue con la misma actividad elaboración y venta de pan, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de harina por mayor,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de un horno de mayor capacidad para incrementar su producción ya que está creciendo su demanda, se siente agradecida con kiva por otra oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Lidia continues in the same business of making and selling bread. She says that she did very well with her previous loan, which was used to buy flour in bulk.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan in order to buy an oven with a larger capacity so that she can increase production and meet the growing demand. Lidia is grateful to Kiva for another opportunity to improve her business and her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a large capacity oven.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
La socia Rita pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Rita continua dedicándose a su negocio de constructora la cual realiza edificios, casas, entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para pagar impuestos de su empresa.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rita belongs to the "Patrón de San Sebastián" ("Patron Saint of San Sebastián") communal bank from the city of Cusco.

Rita continues working at her construction business, which builds buildings and houses, among others. She is a responsible and diligent person. She has been in this business for years, and it brings her personal as well as financial satisfaction. She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family in this way.

She is asking for the loan to pay taxes on her business.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her loan repayments.

loans.use: to pay taxes on her business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 62-years-old from the Kakamega region which is located in the western part of Kenya.  She supports four people in her family.

She makes bricks for construction, a business she has been doing for the last 15 years.  She earns a monthly income of KES 2,000, she has applied for her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to expand the business by making more bricks to resell. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to have a stable family.

loans.use: to expand her business by making more bricks to resell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 52-year-old lady from the Katito region of the Nyanza province in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Alfred and they are blessed with five children. She supports six people in her family.

She sells cereals at her local market, a business she has been doing for the last 27 years, and generates a monthly income of 5,200 KES. 

She has applied for her fourth loan of KES. 27,201 with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to purchase a Sunshine Box. This will ease the problem of purchasing fuel for lighting and other sources. She will be able to improve her business with this product.Her dream is to become stable to provide for her family.

loans.use: purchase a solar panel.

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
Phillis is a 30-year-old woman from Kakamega County. She supports three people in her family and is married to Nicholas, who is a businessman, and they are blessed with two children, ages 6 and 4-years-old.

She has a tailoring shop business where she makes clothes.  She has been operating it for the last 12 months and makes a monthly income of KES 12,200. She is taking her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to make new clothes once she adds more stock of threads and materials. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to open another business and support her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials and threads

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris has a hotel business in Oloitoktok town which she has been running for the past 3 years. She is 44 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children who are in primary school.

She will be using the loan to buy more stock of rice, flour, sugar, cooking oil and flour. She will be using the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to educate her children to high levels.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, cooking oil and flour for her hotel.

loans.name: Kasenyi United New-Monika Group

texts.en:
Djibriel is a member of the Kasenyi United Group and he borrows money from UGAFODE Micro finance through the sub group. He is proudly associated with the group since it’s the group members that have enabled him to get access to the UGAFODE group loan since they co-guarantee each other in the group. He is 38-years-old and he has four children, three of them are in school. 

He started a fishing business in 1990 with the hope of generating enough income which he will use to educate his children. In addition to fishing, Djibriel also has a produce business which boosts his incomes greatly and he is hopeful that he will be able to provide for the needs of his family given the profits he receives from the two businesses. Djibriel’s clients are people in his area of operation and the neighboring district.  His future hopes include giving his children a quality education so that they can compete favorably in the job market. Wild animals in the national park and hippos in the waters are his main challenge since he can’t do business till later for fear of being attacked by the animals from the national park.  Despite all the challenges, he is determined to carry on the business until he achieves his dream in life especially if the loan is granted.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and boats.

loans.name: Samato

texts.en:
Samato is 31 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 5 children. She sells livestock and the business has been profitable. 

She will be using this loan to buy goats for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her third loan term and she has paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to be successful in her business and give her children good education and health care.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 24 years old and married. He is from Nakuru. He has been running his hardware business for two years and earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

Evans requested a loan from VisionFund Kenya for 15,000 KES, which he will use buy 25 pieces of iron sheets to sell to his customers at the hardware store. His plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to buy a water storage tank, repay his loan to VisionFund Kenya, and expand his current business. In the future, he hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase  25 pieces of iron sheet to sell

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne has a boutique business in Kitengela town and has been running it for the last 10 years. She is 46 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. She makes a monthly income of KES 40,000.

She will be using this loan to buy clothes and bags for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to open a retail shop. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to be successful.

loans.use: To buy clothes and bags for resale in her shop

loans.name: Mario Enrique

texts.es:
Mario de 42 años de edad, realizo sus estudios hasta cuarto grado, está casado y su esposa es costurera, han procreado 3 hijos y solamente dos viven con ellos,  uno estudia octavo grado y el otro segundo año de universidad y nadie más vive con ellos.

Mario se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura y aprendió a sembrar  por sus padres ya que ellos se dedicaban al trabajo de campo, actualmente está sembrando 14,000 metros cuadrados de yuca a 200 metros de su hogar y está al pendiente casi todo el día. Con el préstamo comprara insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de la yuca, abono y pesticidas especialmente, ya que es un cultivo que es atacada por los gusanos.

Espera que el cultivo le genere ganancias para cubrir la deuda y para seguir dándole la educación a sus hijos que espera en un futuro puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mario is 42 years old and has a fourth grade education. He is married and his wife is a seamstress. They have three children, but only two live with them. One child is in the eighth grade and the other is in the second year at the university. No one else lives with them.

Mario has devoted his entire life to agriculture, having learned to plant crops from his parents since they were in the same line of work. He is currently planting 14,000 square meters of cassava on a plot that is located 200 meters from his house. Mario works on the land almost every day. With this loan he will buy farming supplies for his cassava crop, especially compost and pesticides. His crop is already being infested with insect larvae.

Mario hopes that his crop will generate income so that he can cover this debt and continue providing an education for his children. In the future, he hopes to see them become professionals.

loans.use: to buy compost and pesticides.

loans.name: Kasenyi United -New Group

texts.en:
James is a member of a sub group of Kasenyi United Group, a group he proudly identifies with. He is aged 33, and has two children, ages eight and five, with the firstborn in school. In addition to the two children, James has one other dependant that he takes care of, since he is a double orphan. 

He is a businessman involved in fishing at Kashenyi landing site, where he has been since 1999 when he started the business. He works eight hours per day, and when he is off the fishing site he is looking for markets for the fish he hopes to get the next day. His business is located in Kasenyi in Kasese district, and he started the business with the objective of making income which would help him cater for the needs of his family. 

His clients are mainly businessmen who deal in fish in and around Kasese district, and he hopes to use the money (two million shillings only) to buy fishing nets and boats so that he can catch more fish, make more sales, and hence get better profits. Competition is the main challenge that he is faced with, since all the fishermen have the same people that they sell the fish to, but despite the competition, James is determined to grow the business, since he hopes to catch better fish using the new nets, which will give him a competitive edge in the market. James is an honest man, and he believes that his honesty will help him stay in the business, especially if he is given a loan.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business selling used clothing and bags with her husband (in the photo) for the last few years. They purchase a variety of used bags from the main city and then sell them to the people in their area. Iram's husband has become famous for selling good quality used bags in the community. 

Iram is in her 4th loan cycle. She has asked Kashf Foundation for a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy stock of different used clothing and bags, taking into account the choices and tastes of their customers. This loan would enable Iram to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different used clothing and bags

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a 34-year-old man from Kakamega county which is located in the western part of Kenya. He is married to Mwenesi who is a business-lady and he supports five people in the family. He has three kids who are 12, 11, and 6 years old respectively.

He is businessman who has a small-scale retail shop, a business he has been doing for the last 5 years and makes a monthly income of Kes 15,000. He has applied for his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to purchase more stocks of shop items like sugar, milk, and flour. He plans to use the anticipated profit to expand his business.

His dream is to become a large-scale businessman and support his family.

loans.use: to increase stock for his shop

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 33 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 2 children aged 5 years and 1 month old. He has a motorcycle transport business as well as a hotel and butchery business in Kangundo town. He has been in the business for 5 years and right now his monthly income from his business is KES 18,000.

He will be using the loan to improve his hotel business by buying more stock of food items for use. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children.

This is his 3rd loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to have the leading hotel in his town and educate his children up to tertiary level.

loans.use: To boost hotel business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has three children. He lives in Muranga area of Central Kenya. He has been farming for 30 years where his primary income sources are eggs, milk, tea, and vegetables. He enjoys farming because of the income he earns. His biggest challenge is bad markets.

John chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the good loan terms and the training they offer their clients. During the training he was enlightened on how to manage his finances and to invest more. His highest monthly expense comes from school fees which he will be able to afford once he purchases another dairy cow with the loan received. In the future, he hopes that his family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is a married lady aged 41 years old, supporting 10 members of her family. She sells fruits and vegetables for a daily earning and has been in operation for a period of 5 years, earning an income of Kes 6,000.

She has asked a fourth term loan of 13,500 from Vision Fund and wishes to use this amount to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables for resale.  The anticipated profits she earns from the business will be used to repay back the loan.

Her dream is see her children excel in their education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Katenga Turibamwe Group

texts.en:
Jovia is a member of Katenga Turibamwe group and she is a mother of four children aged between eight and 15. She is a business woman dealing in the cattle trade  and also operates a s beauty salon in Kashogashoga, Mitooma district where she has operarted from since 1999. The business started small but with her hard work, it grew into a relatively big one.

She works on the cattle business for seven hours per day and outside the cattle business, she attends to her salon, which she has in the same area. She does all this in an effort to get money to educate her children and to sustain her family. Her clients are people from Mitooma and Bushenyi districts and she hopes to serve them better if she gets a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy hair dryers for her salon which will help her meet the needs of her customers. She has high hopes that she will make enough money in the form of profits and will live a better lifestyle. She is mainly challenged by thieves who break into her kraal and steal some of her animals but she is hopeful that if she gets the loan, she will boost her business and get higher profits.

loans.use: to buy hair driers and relaxers for the salon

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en: Pathani, age 33, deals in an animal sales business. She buys animals at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. Pathani makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. She therefore contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. Pathani is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Parsanka

texts.en:
Parsanka is 48 years old, married, and has six children. He has a butchery business, and it has been profitable. He makes a monthly income of KES 140,000. He also has a livestock selling business.

He will be using the loan to buy more stocks of meat as well as livestock for resale. He will use the anticipated profits to provide for the needs of his family. 

This is his fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and he has paid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of meat and livestock for resale.

loans.name: Auditor

texts.en:
Auditor is a 39-year-old man from Kakamega and married to Rose who is a housewife. They have four children, ages 11, 6, 3 and 1 years old respectively. He repairs computers; a business he has done for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 25,000 per month.

He is taking for his first loan of KES 20,000 with Vision Fund Kenya to use for buying a digital computer repair machine. The profits thereafter will be used to buy the current equipment and repay his loan.

His dream is to open a bigger workshop with digital equipment

loans.use: to purchase a digital computer repair machine with a new version to serve his clients promptly.

loans.name: Laura Valentina

texts.es:
La niña Laura valentina, una vez al querer salir al mundo para demostrar las fortalezas, los sueños y metas de seguir adelante  para llegar a ser una gran persona y ayudarle a la mama y hermanas. La mayor meta es ser la mejor ginecoobstetricia del mundo entero por lo cual a ella la inspira la familia y los casos por los cuales ha vivido los familiares, por eso desea luchar por esa nueva vida que viene, conocer mes a mes como va creciendo esa vida y que para la mama sea el mejor parto, no sufra mucho, porque ella desea hacer siempre las cosas con ayuda de Dios y con amor.
Tomo la decisión que mientras salía del colegio quería entrar a estudiar enfermería, por el medio de que adquiera mas conocimiento de medicina y era un medio para ella ser capaz de pagar la carrera y cumplir los sueños, por el cual le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar con unas cuotas más bajas gracias al descuento kiva, para que pudiera cumplir con los semestres y por eso quiere seguir adelante con esas cuotas, para que pueda seguir estudiando y cumpliendo los sueños, porque ella cada día mas demuestra la persona tan valiente, inteligente, entregada, honesta con metas y sueños que está dispuesta a cumplir para brindarle una mejor vida a la mama y las hermanas, ya que la felicidad de ella está totalmente completa con ese amor familiar, porque ella todo lo que hace lo hace con dedicación amor y ayuda de Dios.
texts.en:
The young Laura Valentina wants to go out into the world to demonstrate her strengths, dreams and goals of getting ahead in order to be a great person and help her mother and sisters.

Her greatest goal is to be the best gynecologist/obstetrician in the whole world. Her family and the cases that family members have gone through inspire her. This is why she wants to fight for the new life that comes, to know month by month how it is growing, so that it is the best delivery for the mother and she doesn't suffer much, because she always wants to do everything with God's help and with love.

She made the decision as she was leaving school that she wanted to study nursing so that she could gain some medical knowledge and be able to pay for a degree and fulfill her dreams. Because of this, they gave her the opportunity to study at a lower fee, thanks to the Kiva discount, so that she could fulfill the semester requirements. This is why she wants to move forward with these payments, so that she can continue studying and reaching her dreams.

Everyday she shows more the brave, intelligent, dedicated and honest person she is, with goals and dreams, and that she is ready to achieve to provide a better life for her mother and sisters. Her happiness is complete with the love of her family, because everything she does, she does with dedication, love and God's help.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for one semester.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 47-years-old and married. She has a business selling cereals, which she has been running for the past seven years. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with one child who is in college. Right now her monthly income is KES 8,000.

She will use the loan to buy more stock of beans and maize for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her son. 

This is her third loan term and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hope is to become successful.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and table.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an air compressor, table, chair and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 51-year-old married woman. For about 4 years she has been working in hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors, as well as packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers.
