loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors, as well as packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is still practicing poultry farming with a current monthly income of 12,000 KES. She requested a new loan for 30,000 KES, which she will use to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to  have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 54-year-old lady from Kakamega. She is a widowed woman and her children are grown ups, apart from two who are 13 and 5 years respectively. She operates a grocery, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

This first loan she is taking from Vision fund Kenya of KES 10,000 will be used in expanding her business. The anticipated profits will be used to buy more sacks of fruits and repay her loan.

Her dream is to become a wholesaler and bring up a stable family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of beans, maize, small fish, fruits, and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is still happily married to David and her children are doing well. 

She is still in the fruits and vegetables business.  Currently, her average monthly income is KES 30,000. She  has borrowed a loan of KES 41,000 to purchase more stock of fruits to boost her sales. She will use the anticipated profits  to expand her business. 

She also hopes to improve her living standards, be financially stable, and save enough money to pay school fees for her children and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase fruits

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 54-years-old, married and, together with his spouse, have been blessed with four children ages 20, 18, 16 and 14-years-old. He has a shop and a workshop business. He has been in the business for 13 years and right now his monthly income from his business is KES 60,000. His spouse also provides additional income.

He will use the loan to buy sugar, salt and soap for resale. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children.

This is his tenth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has repaid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to build rental houses and educate his children

loans.use: To add stock of retail goods for sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 59 years old from Nyahururu. She is married to William and they are blessed with five children, ages 20, 18, 16, 13 and 7 years old.

She has been running her business of poultry, rearing and selling for the last four years. To enable her to buy some construction materials for a poultry house, she has applied for her second loan of KES 80,000 form VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 15,000, and she has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya and educate her children.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, e.g. 20 pieces iron sheets, 10 bags of cement, and one lorry of stones for a poultry house.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en: Khatuna is a 39-year-old married woman from Tbilisi city, the capital of Georgia. She lives with her husband, a worker at a private company, who generates 300 GEL monthly. Khatuna is a teacher and it has been over 10 years since she has tutored and conducted private lessons to students from her house. To make their activities more productive, Khatuna decided to request a loan. Her application was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or re-start businesses. With the loan she will purchase a car and help her husband provide taxi services in his free-time. This additional income will greatly help her family to earn savings and live better. They rely on the goodwill of lenders.

loans.use: To buy a car to help her husband start a taxi business

loans.name: Soltan

texts.en:
Soltan, 58 years old, lives with his wife, son and daughter-in-law in the village of Boyuk Bahmanli in the Füzuli region. Soltan's daughter is married, his elder son is a taxi driver in the same village and his youngest child is studying at university. It has been 21 years since they have been Internally Displaced Persons - IDPs from Füzuli city. 

Soltan has been in the sheep breeding business for many years. He has applied to Komak for a loan of 2,150 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy more lambs to increase his business. He says thanks to the Kiva organization for its help. In the future, Soltan wants to help his son to buy a new house.

loans.use: to buy more lambs

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 32-year-old man from Kakamega, married to Maximilah, and they have one child, age 2 years old. He operates a soda depot. A business he has done for the past two years, earning an income of KES 23,000 monthly. 

He is taking a first loan of KES 20,000 with Vision fund Kenya to use in purchasing more creates of sodas. He plans to use the profits for improving the lives of his family members.

His dream is to own several of the soda depots in this region.

loans.use: to purchase more lorries of sodas to resell to his retail owners.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is 23 years old, and he is not yet married.

He is in a transport business, known as boda boda business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has practiced for one year. He has applied for first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy a heifer. With the anticipated profit from his business, he plans to buy a plot.

In the near future, he hopes to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 45 years old, married, and has four children. She has been running a grocery store for five years and earns a monthly income of 32,000 KES.

Agnes requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase additional stock for her grocery store. With the anticipated profits she plans to repay her loan and educate her children. In the future, she hopes to venture into dairy farming and improve the lifestyle of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a farmer in Emali town where he grows cash crops to sell. He is 64 years old, married, and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 6 children. He has been in the farming business for more than 10 years and it has been profitable.

He will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting on his farm. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children. 

This is his 5th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. His future hopes are to expand his farming business and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La socia María Esther pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia María Esther tiene 31 años de edad,tiene 01 hijo y es soltera, la socia se dedica a ejercer su carrera de guía de turismo, la socia trabaja con las diferentes agencias que solicitan sus servicios, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a ejercer su carrera el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para pagar gastos de educación.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
María Esther is a member of the "Patrón de San Sebastián" communal bank in the city of Cusco.  María Esther is 31 years old, and is a single mother of one son.  She is dedicated to pursuing her career as a tour guide.  She works with different agencies that seek her services.  She has been in this field for a long time, and she finds it very satisfying personally and financially.  She hopes to continue working so that she can support her family.

She is seeking this loan to pay for schooling costs.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making the payments on time.

loans.use: pay for school costs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josphine was able to improve her general store business with her first loan, and she now makes a monthly income of about 30,000 KES.

With her second loan with VisionFund Kenya she intends to purchase additional stock for her general store and use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to pay school fees for her children.

Her future hope is to grow her business into a wholesale store and provide a better life for her children and family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, salt, and flour.

loans.name: Catherine Nyambura

texts.en:
Catherine is 31 years old, married, and has one child. She has a boutique shop in Naivasha, which she has been operating for seven years.

Catherine requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy stocks of clothes to sell. With anticipated profit, she plans to pay school fees and buy sheep for rearing. In the near future, she hopes to expand her business to wholesale dealer and improve her family living standards

loans.use: to purchase stock of clothes to sell

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 22 años de edad,  que ha estudiado hasta bachillerato, es soltero actualmente vive con el papá y la mamá él solamente aporta de lo poco que gana para la comida y lo que le da a la mamá.

Carlos  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10  años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño el Papá,  ya que su papá desea que sus hijos  aprendan este oficio y se los  enseño para  que en un futuro se pudieran defender,  este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 20 minutos  y él viaja a pie. Carlos también trabaja con una máquina para desgranar maíz y le ayuda a el papá a cultivar la milpa.

Con el préstamo solicitado lo necesitara,  para terminar de pagar a las personas que le ayuden a sacar el cultivo,  ya que él andaba con la máquina de la comunidad sacando unos cultivos de las otras personas y las de él le quedaron pendiente,  pero él necesita que le ayuden para llevarlo para la casa esto le va ayudar mucho ya que con la ayuda del préstamo él tendrá como pagarle a personas que le ayuden.

Los sueños que tiene es comprar su propia máquina para desgrane del maíz, ya que desde pequeño él andado con esto y ya tiene experiencia y eso le ayudara mucho para tener ingresos y de eso poder mantenerse el estudio, debido a que desea seguir estudiando en la universidad no quedarse solo con el bachillerato.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 22-year-old, who has studied through high school. He is currently single and lives with his father and mother. He only contributes from the little that he earns for food and what he gives to his mother. 

Carlos has been working in agriculture since he was 10 years old. His father taught him this work, since his father wishes that his children learn this trade and he taught them so that in the future they could defend themselves. This work is at a distance of 20 kilometers and he travels on foot. Carlos also works with a machine to shuck corn and he helps his father to cultivate the corn. 

He will need the requested loan to finish paying the people who help him cultivate the land. He used the machine of the community to help others cultivate and his own corn was pending. But he needed them to help him to bring the corn to the house; this is going to help him a lot since with the help of the loan he will have a way to pay the people who help him. 

He dreams of buying his own machine to shuck the corn, because since he was a child, he has worked with it and already has experience. This would help him a lot to have income and be able to maintain his studies, since he wishes to continue studying in the university and not have just his high school education.

loans.use: to pay the people who help him cultivate the land.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna lives in Geghanist village with her husband, child and parents-in-law. The family has been involved in agriculture for many years. They don't have their own land, so they rent land and cultivate roses there. They sell the harvest in nearby markets. 

Syuzanna and her family also own a greenhouse, but because it is very old and damaged they are not able to renovate it and organize the cultivation process there. She has now applied for this loan to be able to renovate the greenhouse. She will be very grateful to lenders if they support her farming business and she will hope for their support.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Doña Inez es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, muchos ánimos y esperanzas de salir adelante y de cumplir lo propuesto en su vida manifestando a sus 33 años la gratitud y el respeto hacia sus padres por haber inculcado en ella valores, principios que son la base de la superación y prosperidad en la vida. Ella es casada y madre de 2 quienes estudian en diferentes grados de educación en la escuela de su comunidad. Desde hace varios años practica la agricultura ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaran dicha actividad y hoy en día en compañía de su esposo a quien ella agradece el apoyo incondicional por los muchos años juntos como equipo de trabajo y en su matrimonio. Sus cultivos están ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan caminando. Doña Inez tiene un grado de estudio de primaria completa por lo cual agradece a sus padres el apoyo incondicional que ellos dieron para que pudiera cursar su primaria completa.
Ella tiene como meta seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café de manera que puedan generar mayores ganancias para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos, apoyar a su familia en todo lo necesario y demás que ellos necesiten y ella pueda ayudar. Por lo que doña Inez hoy en día solicita financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas, etc. que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Inez is a woman with a lot of strength, and a lot of energy and hopes for getting ahead and achieving what she sets out to in life. At 33 years of age, she expresses gratitude and respect for her parents for having instilled values in her, principles that are the basis for getting ahead and prospering in life.

She is married and the mother of two, who are studying in different grades at their community school.

For many years, she has been working in agriculture, since it was her parents who taught her this trade, and today she works at her husband's side. She is grateful to her husband for his unconditional support through many years together as a work team and in their marriage.

Her crops are located in the same community, and are walking distance.

Inez completed primary school, for which she thanks her parents for the unconditional support they gave her. Her goal is to continue expanding her coffee crops so that they can generate greater earnings, so that she can secure the future of her children, and support her family in everything they may need and she can provide.

This is why Inez is now applying for a loan, with which she will improve her crops, giving them better attention, applying agricultural inputs like compost, fertilizer, coffee formula, fungicides, etc. that prevent insect contamination and diseases.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to tend to and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecaa is a 42-year-old lady from Kakamega town, within the western part of Kenya. She is married and supports three people in the family, and she has three kids of her own, ages 11 and 6 years old respectively.

She has a beauty salon within her local town. She has been operating this kind of business for the last three years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase blow driers and cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

Her dream is to grow her business and become a successful entrepreneur to support her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of hair chemicals and blow driers.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 48 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they have 2 children. She has been in the general store business for the last three years and also does dairy farming, giving her a total monthly income of around 60,000 KES.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she plans to purchase additional stock for her general store. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and to service the loan.

Jacinta aspires to expand her business and to improve the lifestyle of her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock like flour, soaps, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Stellah is 37 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have four children, aged 17, 13, 7 and 3 years respectively. She has been running a grocery store for the last two years with a monthly income of about 30,000 KES per month.

This is Stellah's 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to purchase additional stock for her grocery store in order to meet her clients' demands. She intends to use the anticipated profits to service her loan as well as pay school fees for her children.

She dreams of venturing into dairy farming and hopes to be able to build a modern home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery store.

loans.name: Brigitte Elena

texts.es: Brigitte de 43  años de edad,  soltera y con 1 hija, es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de derecho,  estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Brigitte trabaja en una consultoría, se desempeña en el área de asistente legal,  ha sabido salir adelante estudia mucho y  así culminar sus estudios y así poder ser  exitosa en la vida. Con el préstamo otorgado ella podrá realizar los pagos de su matrícula universitaria y la compra de útiles de estudio que necesita. Brigitte  se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con un fuerte abrazo ah Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá la promesa de salir adelante.
texts.en: Brigitte is 43 years old, single, and has one daughter. She is a nice law student. She studies a lot to achieve her life goals. Brigitte works in a consultancy, carrying out duties as a legal assistant. She has had a taste of moving forward, she studies a lot and in that way is completing her studies and in that way will be able to be successful in life. With the loan she will be able to make the payments of her university registration and to pay for the study supplies that she needs. Brigitte is very grateful for the help provided and says goodbye to Kiva, telling them to complete the promise of moving forward.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus has a retail shop business in Makueni town, and has been in this business for four years. She has three children, and right now, her monthly income is KES 22,000.

She will be using this loan to buy maize flour, milk, flour, and sugar for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in future, she hopes to have a successful business that will enable her to make more income to educate her children as well as provide for their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, milk, flour, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Nthenya

texts.en:
With her first loan, Nthenya successfully added stock to her grocery business and is currently making a monthly income of about 15,000 KES.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to purchase more vegetables and fruits for her grocery. She will use the anticipated profits to improve and expand her business to greater heights, which as a result will move her family toward better living standards.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Florah

texts.en:
Florence is happily married to Zablon, and their children are well and continuing in school. A fruit seller in Naivasha, she says her business is doing not too badly. 

Now requesting her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy a stock of apples for resale, Florence plans to pay school fees with her profits. In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest fruit shop in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy a stock of apples.

loans.name: Callista

texts.en:
Callista is 34 years old and is from Nyahururu. She is widowed and is blessed with two children, ages 18 and 15 years old.

She has been running her business of selling secondhand clothes for the last 9 months, and she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy more stock of clothes to sell to her customers.

Her monthly income right now is about KES 15,000 and she plans to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children, buy more clothes to sell and pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to educate her children to the highest grade possible and to have a successful business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of secondhand clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more caustic and palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 43-year-old married woman who, with her husband, has been running a business selling milk for many years. 

She has many buffaloes and goats and sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the cattle and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family.

She has five children. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make bigger profits, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: San  Roque Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ROQUE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana Gualberta ella es casada y tiene 61 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
Los socios que están pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto después de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chicha, negocio de venta de artesania, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “San Roque” which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Juana Gualberta. She is 61 years old, married, and has three children. She works at her business of raising and selling animals. Juana raises and fattens guinea pigs and chickens before selling them at different fairs. Through this small business, she has been able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell guinea pigs and chickens.

Juana is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as feed for their diet.

The members who are attached to the group photo arrived after the meeting since they requested permission to be late because of work reasons. The other members of the group have businesses such as selling “chicha” (a traditional beverage made from corn), selling handicrafts, managing a grocery store, and selling food.

Juana is grateful to those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and animal feed.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael, 53 years old, is from Nakuru. He is married to Grace and they are blessed with four children aged 30, 27, 23 and 21 years old. Michael has been running his business selling fruits and vegetables for the last 28 years. He has applied for his fourth loan of KES 90,000 from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy some more stock of the food he sells.

Michael's monthly income right now is KES 160,000. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to repay his loan to VisionFund Kenya and to add more rental houses in his plot. In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of bananas and vegetables to sell to his customers

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 36 years old and married. Together with his spouse they have three children. He has been in the butchery and farming business for the last 5 years, which earns him a total of about KES 50,000.

This is Peter's sixth loan with VisionFund Kenya after successfully repaying all the previous ones. He intends to purchase goats and sheep for his butcher shop and use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay the loan. 

His future aspiration is to run a chain of butcher shops and transform the lifestyle of his family.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for slaughter.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is 58 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has been running a green grocery for the last 17 years, with a current monthly income of 15,000 kshs.

This will be Magdalene's first loan from VisionFund Kenya, with which she plans to purchase additional grocery stocks for her enterprise. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Magdalene's aspiration is to run a wholesale grocery that can help her transform the lives of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stocks

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 45 years old. She is single with two children. Patricia has been selling fruits and vegetables for the last 14 years, and besides that, she also sells scrap, earning her a total of 30,000 Kshs per month.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to meet her customers' demand.She also plans to buy more scrap to sell and intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

Her ambition is to make her business grow to a point where it can fully sustain her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her fruit and vegetable business

loans.name: Jose Reynerio

texts.es:
José, es una persona que se dedica a la crianza de ganado, cerdos, aves de corral y al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz, frijol y maicillo), son actividades que aprendió de sus padres, hoy en día lo realiza como fuente de ingresos para salir adelante junto a su familia lo realiza en un horario de 5:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., trabaja todos los días, está acompañado y es padre de dos hijos.
El capital que está solicitando lo utilizara en la compra de dos vacas paridas y concentrado para cerdos, lo que le facilitar aumentar su ganado y tener el alimento necesario para los cerdos, espera tener mayor producción de lácteos, tanto para consumo familiar como para comercializarlo, con las ganancias pagara su deuda adquirida y mejorara el estilo de vida familiar.
Para José es muy importante cumplir su sueño el cual consiste en que sus hijos tengan una educación de calidad y en un futuro sean profesionales para que se desenvuelvan en un ambiente laboral lleno de oportunidades.
texts.en:
José is a person who is devoted to raising cattle, pigs and barnyard fowl, as well as growing basic grains (corn, beans and sorghum).  He learned these activities form his parents.  Now, in order to earn an income to get his family ahead, he works from 5am to 5pm everyday.  He is married and has two children.

The loan that he is seeking will be used to purchase two newborn calves and feed for pigs.  This will allow him to increase his cattle herd and provide him with the necessary food for his pigs.  He hopes to increase his dairy production, not only for his family's consumption but to sell it as well.  With his earnings, he will pay the newly acquired debt and improve his family's living conditions.

For José, it is very important to realize his dream of his children having a quality education and being professionals in the future so that they can develop in a work environment full of opportunities.

loans.use: buy two newborn calves and feed for pigs.

loans.name: Cyprian

texts.en:
Cyprian is 33 years old and married. He has been in the mobile money transfer business for the last 5 years, and he also runs a retail shop, giving him a total of about KES 25,000 per month.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya and he plans to expand his business by adding float to his mobile money business in order to meet his clients' demands. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to add stock to his retail shop.

His future hope is to grow his retail shop into a wholesale shop

loans.use: To add float to his mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Clement

texts.en:
Clement is 54 years old, married, and together with his wife they have three children. He has been in poultry farming for the last 6 years and apart from raising chickens Clement also does vegetable farming, which earns him about 30,000 kshs a month in total.

This is his third loan with VisionFund Kenya and he plans to purchase chicks, feeds and farm supplies. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He hopes and dreams to see all his children through school.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feeds for his poultry business.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone is 40 years old and together with his wife, he is blessed with three children who are in school.

He is in a welding business in Naivasha, a business he has been running for twelve years, and he has applied for fifth loan from Vision fund Kenya to enable him to purchase welding materials after repaying his previous loans on time. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business.

In the near future, he hopes to make his business grow.

loans.use: To purchase welding materials.

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku, 45 years old, has a retail shop and is also a farmer in Kangundo. She is married and she and her spouse have been blessed with 2 children, aged 18 and 14 years old. Nduku also takes care of her 2 nephews. She has been in business for 16 years and it has been profitable. Her spouse provides additional income. 

Nduku will be using the loan to buy sugar, cooking oil, salt, milk and tea leaves for resale. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay her loan and to save more. This is Nduku's 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has repaid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to install electricity in her home.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil and milk for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Estela

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Estela en su microempresa de confecciones, pues con el crédito invertido en materias primas e inusmos, logró una mayor liquidéz y tambien aumentando sus venta y utilidades en el negocio. Ella dice a sus finaciadores: "Muchos agradecimientos, espero seguir recibiendo el apoyo de Kiva y de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finacimiento, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, insumos, como telas, hilos, encajes etc,  para aumentar la producción de ropa y vender mucho mas, pues ha logrado sostener una clientela fija que hace nuevos requerimientos, a los cuales se proponde dar respuesta.
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Estela, a micro-entrepreneur who works sewing clothing. With her first loan, she invested in more sewing supplies and was able to improve her liquidity, increase her sales, and improve the profitability of her business. She says to her financers: "Many thanks, I hope to continue receiving the support of KIVA and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo." Currently, she is applying for a new loan, with which she will buy supplies such as thread, fabric, lace, etc. to increase her clothing production and sell much more. She has managed to sustain a fixed client base that always has new requirements, which she hopes to continue to attend.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fabric, thread, lace, etc.

loans.name: Satik

texts.en:
Satik lives with her husband, 18-year-old daughter and her parents-in-law. The family rents a plot of land near their village where they grow apricot trees. They also keep a cow and three oxen. In the greenhouse which they own, Satik and her family members cultivate greens. The farm that they run isn't very big, but the love and care they put into it bring them a sustainable monthly income.
 
Satik is now requesting a loan of USD 2000 to purchase a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, wheat seeds, fertilizer, and forage for the livestock. The loan will greatly support Satik's farming business and enable her to expand their income.

loans.use: to pay for a polyethylene cover for the greenhouse, wheat seeds, fertilizer, and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Mónica

texts.es:
Desde hace 24 años, la señora Mónica se dedica a comprar chonchos y reses para faenarles y ofreserlos en su  tercena  que se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Bolívar y cuando no puede venderle en carne les revende vivos para lograr tener algo de ganancia. El negocio es familiar ya que todos los miembros de su familia le ayudan pero su socia es su hija Geoconda.
Mónica tiene 40 años de edad esta casada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales uno esta asistiendo al colegio, Geoconda esta esperando poder entrar a la universidad. Lo que más desea Mónica es tener el suficiente dinero para hacer realidad los sueños de sus hijos que es sacar un titulo profecional y mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
For the past 24 years, Sra. Mónica has been buying pigs and cows for butchering. She sells the meat from the butcher shop located in her home in the city of Bolívar. When she is not selling meat, she resells live animals so that she can generate some income. The business belongs to her family, so all of the members help. However, her partner is her daughter Geoconda.

Mónica is 40 years old, married, and has four children. One child is currently in school. Geoconda hopes to enter the university.

What Mónica wants most is to have sufficient funds to fulfill her children’s dreams of earning a professional degree and improving their quality of life, as well as to have a peaceful retirement for herself.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cows so that she can sell the meat by the pound.

loans.name: Marvin Martin

texts.es: Don Marvin es originario de Estelí, casado y padre de dos hijos. Tiene 46 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la Tapicería en general. Inicio su negocio cuando lo heredo de su padre, y hasta el día de hoy lo ha mantenido. Su meta próxima es conseguir clientes potenciales a los cuales les pueda ofrecer sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Tela, Cuerina entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para incrementar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas. Su plan futuro hacer su casa propia e instalar un local propio para la elaboración de sus productos.
texts.en: Marvin, from Estelí, is married and has 2 children. He is 46 years old. He works in upholstery, after having inherited the business from his father. His goal is to grow his client base so he can offer his products to a wider range of people. He is asking for this loan to buy fabric and synthetic leather, among other supplies. He believes that this loan will help him to increase his inventory and improve his sales. His plan for the future is to have his own house in which he can have his own shop where he does his work.

loans.use: to buy fabric and synthetic leather, among other supplies

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es: Mauro es un hombre casado, y con 59 años de edad aun trabaja las tierras en las que siembra frejol y maíz, vive con su esposa y Mauro tienen dificultad para caminar ya que tienen problema en sus piernas y el mismo problema tiene su esposa pero él dice que eso no le impide seguir trabajando ya que es un hombre luchador y trabaja en lo que aun puede. El crédito está destinado para el pago de arriendo de terreno en el que va a cultivar sus plantas y para la compra de semilla, fungicidas y bonos para el cultivo de sus sembríos. Mauro aspira que le vaya bien en la cosecha para pagar el crédito y que le quede capital propio para las curaciones de su esposa.
texts.en:
Mauro is a married man who is 59 years old. He works the land on which he plants beans and corn. He lives with his wife.

Mauro has difficulty walking because of problems with his legs. His wife also experiences the same problem, but he says that it doesn’t keep him for working. He is a determined man who works because he is still able.

This loan will be used to pay the rent on the land that he uses to cultivate his crops. He will also buy seeds, fungicides, and compost for the crops he has planted. Mauro aspires to do very well during the harvest season so that he can repay the loan and build up capital for his wife’s treatments.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fungicides, and compost, as well as pay the rent on his farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a BBQ gril and wholesale ingredients and supplies (meat, potatoes, arepas, disposable plates/utensils)

loans.name: Philliys

texts.en:
Philliys is 44 years old, married to Emilio, and together they are blessed with three children who are in school.

She is in a farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, She has practiced farming for eight years and has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her to buy fertilizer, seeds, and pay for labor. With anticipated profit, she plans to buy a cow.

In the near future, she hopes to expand her farming business to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Simaloi

texts.en:
Simaloi is 52 years old and married. Together with her husband, she is blessed with five children who are in primary school. She has been in the green grocery store business for the last eight years and she also farms. In total, she earns a monthly income of 9,000 KES.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to upgrade her grocery store through the purchase of additional stock of vegetables. She will use the anticipated profits to pay the school fees for her children and improve their livelihood.

Simaloi's hopes and dreams are to build a permanent structure for her grocery business.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her green grocery business.

loans.name: Agaba

texts.en:
Emmy is a new client to the institution who is married and blessed with three children. Emmy is passionate about cattle keeping and his desire is to see his farm expand and his cattle looking healthy. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to buy more cows, construct a cattle shed for his calves and buy veterinary drugs.

Emmy hails from a village in the Buyanja sub-county of the Rukungiri municipality. 

Emmy is an honest and hardworking man but he has always been affected by limited capital.

His dream is to operate on a large scale so as to increase his profits.

With this loan, Emmy is hopeful that his business will increase and also his profits will increase.

loans.use: To buy cattle and veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 30 years old, married to Monicah, and together they are blessed with six children aged between 16 and 6 years old; the children are in school.

Peter is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru. He has practiced farming for five years and after repaying his previous loans well, he has applied for a third loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy a cow. With anticipated profit, he plans to buy land.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his farming business to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren has a rental housing business and has been running this business for 10 years now. She is 51 years old and married. Together with her spouse, has been blessed with give children, one of whom is adopted. Her husband also provides additional income. 

She will be using this loan to buy building materials for building rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to add more rental houses. 

This is her eighth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loan successfully. In the future, she hopes to expand her business by building more rental houses.

loans.use: To buy stock of building materials.

loans.name: Mbugua

texts.en:
This is Mbugua who is still happily married to Mary and their children who are also doing well.

Mbugua is in the livestock farming and motorbike transport business with a monthly income of 25,000 KES. 

This is Mbugua's third loan with VisionFund Kenya and he plans to buy young cows, goats and sheep for rearing to sell at a profit later on. He is also planning to buy a dairy cow for milk production. He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fee for his children.

He dreams of pursuing livestock farming in large scale and to become a meat supplier.

loans.use: to buy cows, goats, and sheep

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza es una joven de 26 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos, casada y agricultora que en compañía de su esposo se dedican al cultivo de café y granos básicos (maíz y frijol). Ella realizo sus estudios hasta el quinto grado de primaria y agradece el esfuerzo y apoyo económico que sus padres hicieron. Sus hijos son menores de edad y están en edad escolar estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación. Con una experiencia de más de 10 años trabajando la tierra ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ella tiene mucho conocimiento en las diferentes actividades a realizar. Las tierras que trabajan en compaña de su esposo están ubicadas a 1 kilómetro de distancia de la comunidad donde ellos habitan por lo que tienen que trasladarse en autobús de ruta hasta el lugar donde están sus cultivos de café. 
Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de abono, fertilizantes entre otros para poder cuidar y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos.  
Sus planes para el futuro es comprar más terrenos cultivados de café y así forjar un mejor patrimonio para sus hijos para obtener más ganancias y tener una mejor condición de vida. Sus sueños como madre es que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales cursando carreras universitarias para enfrentar con conocimiento los problemas económicos de manera favorable.
texts.en:
Maritza is 26 years old and a mother of four children. She is married and works as a farmer. She and her husband grow coffee and staple crops such as corn and beans. Maritza’s young school aged children are in different grades at the local school. Maritza  herself studied until fifth grade at primary school and she is grateful for the effort and financial support her parents gave her.  She has had over 10 years experience working the land and she has a great deal of knowledge in many areas of farming as her parents taught her how to work the land at a very young age. The land that she and her husband care for is one kilometer away from the town where they live so they have to travel by bus to get to their coffee crops. 

Maritza has asked the COMIXMUL cooperative for a loan to buy manure and fertiliser, amongst other things, to care for and maintain her crops.

In the future Maritza plans to buy more land to grow coffee so that she can create a better legacy for her children to have a better income and living conditions. Her dreams as a mother are to see her children become professionals after gaining university degrees so that they will have the ability to overcome financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers amongst other things to help care for her coffee crops

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 31 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child. She is a farmer and also has a hair beauty shop. She has been in the business for six years. Right now her monthly income from her business is 25,000 KES.

Mary will be using the loan to expand her business by buying beauty products for resale. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to improve the living standards of her family.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she repaid her previous loan successfully. Her hope in the future is to have a successful business and be able to provide for the needs of her family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for resale

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: Simón vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú. Su actividad económica es la elaboración de zapatos a pedido del cliente. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuero. Simón se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Simón lives in the city of Cusco in the south of Peru. He works as a custom shoe maker. He has had this business for a number of years and it is going very well. Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy leather. Simón is very grateful for the credit provided and promises to make all loan repayments as due.

loans.use: to buy leather

loans.name: Alis

texts.en:
Alis is 57 years old, married and together with her spouse they have five children. Alis has been in the farming business for the last 20 years with a monthly income of 7,500 KES per month.

This is Alis’s second loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer (in order to boost her produce) and also to purchase beans as stock for a side business. She will use the anticipated increased profits to buy household assets and improve the livelihood of her children.

Alis hopes to be a leading cereals supplier to stores and schools.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and beans for trading

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher has a potato-selling business which she has been running for four years now. She is 30 years old, married, and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with three children. Right now her monthly income from her business is KES 20,000.

She will be using this loan to buy more potatoes for resale. She will use the generated profits to buy a truck for supplying the potatoes. 

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya and she has repaid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: To buy potatoes for resale

loans.name: Agnetta

texts.en:
Agnetta is 41 years old, married, and together with her husband she has four children. She has been operating a retail general store business for the last three years with a monthly income of 20,000 Kshs.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to purchase additional stock for her general store with items like detergents, tea leaves, cooking fat, rice and flour. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

She hopes and dreams to push her business to a level where it can provide for all her family needs.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es de la ciudad de Paraguarí, tiene 18 años, está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería en Electromecánica, y comenta que su meta es poder llegar a ser un buen profesional que el día de mañana sea útil a la sociedad.
Es un joven que tiene grandes aspiraciones, ya que quiere poder ayudar a la sociedad por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder montar su propio laboratorio, que le será de mucha ayuda en sus prácticas, y así poder seguir aprendiendo más y más.
texts.en:
Angel is from the city of Paraguarí. He is 18 years old and is studying electro-mechanical engineering. He tells us that his goal is to become a professional so that he can be useful to society in the future. 

Angel has grand aspirations, as he would like to be able to help society throug his knowledge. He is asking for this loan in order to set up a laboratory, which will be very useful for his experiements and allow him to continue to learn.

loans.use: to set up a laboratory to conduct experiments

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en:
Josiah is 36 years old from Nakuru. He is divorced but supports his two children aged thirteen and seven years.

Josiah has been running his business of distributing Internet and play station games for the last eight years. To enable him buy a plasma television for use in entertaining his customers, he has applied for his third loan of 27,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya.

Josiah's monthly income right now is 10,000 KES and he intends to use the profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy a plasma TV to be used in entertaining his customers

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 38 years old, married to Scola Wayua and together they have two children aged four and three years respectively. He has run a butcher shop business for the last 13 years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES. 

This is Julius’s fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya and he intends to purchase cows and goats for slaughter for his butcher shop, which will enable him to earn better returns. He will use the anticipated returns to expand his butcher shop business and to provide a better life for his family.

He aspires to be a meat supplier to supermarkets and institutions.

loans.use: to buy cows and goats for slaughter for his butcher shop

loans.name: Lorena Lisseth

texts.es:
Lorena es una joven humilde, emprendedora, luchadora con una edad de 27 años, acompañada y madre de 2 hijos quienes están en la escuela de la comunidad en diferentes grados de educación. Con un grado de escolaridad de primaria completa agradece el apoyo moral y financieros por parte de sus padres a pesar de las muchas dificultades en esa época pues los ingresos generados no eran los suficientes para cubrir todos los gastos en el hogar y aparte los gastos para que ella pudiese seguir en la secundaria. En compañía de su conyugue se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café lo cual genera los ingresos para el sustento de su familia. La tierra que trabaja es una herencia por parte de su padre gracias a ello empezaron a trabajar y a generar ingresos. Sus clientes son los diferentes intermediarios que llegan y viven en la zona, bodegas, etc. 
Sus metas poder terminar de apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios para que se conviertan en personas profesionales, con mejores oportunidades en la vida que el trabajo de campo ya que es pesado y en ocasiones con los cambios climáticos y las plagas entre otras muchas veces se pierde la cosecha trabajada de meses y las ganancias son pocas. Ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y foliares para asistir sus cultivos y poder sembrar una nueva plantilla para seguir ampliando su cafetal.
texts.en:
Lorena is a humble, hardworking woman. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children who are in school. Lorena has a primary school education, and she is very grateful for the moral and financial support of her parents given the many difficulties she has had this year.  The income she has generated has not been sufficient to cover all of her home expenses or the expenses for her to continue her education. Lorena and her husband both work cultivating coffee crops, from which they generate the income needed to support their family. The land that they work was inherited from Lorena's father, and as a result of this gift they have been able to work and generate their own income. Their clients are different intermediaries that come to or live in their area, as well as bodegas and other buyers. 

Lorena's goal is to be able to support her children until they finish their studies and become independent professionals, with better opportunities then field work which is very demanding. Additionally, with climate change and plagues that sometimes affect the crops, there are many times when full harvests are lost, months of work are for nothing, and earnings are few. Lorena has asked for a loan to buy fertilizer and other agricultural supplies, with which she will take care of her crops and plant new plants to continue growing her coffee output.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to maintain coffee crops

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 56-year-old lady from Kakamega County, married to Francis who is a civil servant, and they have two children aged 19 and 30 years  old.

She operates a general store, a business she has run for the last seven years, earning an average income of Kes 10,000 per month. 

She is taking her fourth loan of Kes 30,000 with Vision Fund Kenya to use in buying more retail stock for her general store. The profits will be used to repay the loan and put aside some savings.

Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase  stock to retail in her shop

loans.name: Guillermo Jose

texts.es: Don Guillermo es originario de Teustepe, Casado. Tiene 32 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de cafetín y venta de ropa. Inicio su negocio en el mercado local de la ciudad, luego se trasladó a otro punto de la ciudad y ahí se ha mantenido hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es cancelar el crédito vigente. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Ropa para la temporada de verano tales como: Shorts, Camisetas, Trajes de baño entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que lograra incrementar su inventario. Su plan futuro tener un tramo propio donde pueda establecerse.
texts.en: Guillermo, originally from the town of Teustepe, is 32 years old and married. He has a business selling coffee and clothing. He began this business in a local market in his city, but later moved to a different location in the city from which he works today. His goal is to repay his outstanding loan. He is asking for this loan to buy summer clothing such as shorts, t-shirts, and bathing suits among other items. He believes that this loan will be very helpful for him to increase his inventory. His future plan is to have his own lot where he can establish his business.

loans.use: to buy summer clothes such as shorts, t-shirts and bathing suits

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annatacia is a farmer in Kangundo town, where she keeps livestock and also grows crops to sell. She is 31 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with two children. Her spouse also provides income. 

She will use this loan to buy building materials and finish the construction of their house. She will use the anticipated profits to start poultry farming and also to buy furniture. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to improve the living standards of her family and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy building materials for finishing her house.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la venta productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz,azúcar,leche y entre otros. Teresa en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como por ejemplo cremas, perfumes y entre otros. Ella pertenece al banco comunal "UNION,FUERZA,AMISTAD" y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz. Agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Teresa lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru. Her principal economic activity is the sale of staple household goods such as rice, sugar, and milk amont other products. In her free time, she also sells beauty products such as creams and pefumes. Teresa belongs to the lending roup "Union, Fuerza, Amistad" (Union, Strength, Friendship) and is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as sacks of sugar and rice. She is very grateful to investors for this loan and is very happy to receive this loan. She promises to comply with all loan repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sacks of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Maribel Cirila

texts.es: Maribel vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal "UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD" de la Asociación Arariwa. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carne, aceite y otras cosas mas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Agradece a los inversionistas por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Maribel lives in the beautiful city of Cusco and belongs to the communal bank "UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD" ["Unity, Effort and Friendship"] of the Arariwa Association. Her main economic activity is selling anticuchos [traditional skewers of roasted meat] as a mobile vendor. At this time, she needs the loan to buy meat, cooking oil and some other things. She has dedicated herself to this business for several years now, and it is going very well for her. She is grateful to the lenders for the loan provided to her, and she is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy meat, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, maggi cubes, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, coal, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishware (bowls, plates, spoons, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro trabaja de forma particular para una veterinaria vive con sus padres, comenta que su madre es empleada y el padre tiene  su propio  negocio. Sus metas futuras son recibirse y crecer profesionalmente  independizarse tener  un mejor  ingreso.
Está estudiando la carrera de veterinaria, y quiere ser un buen profesional que pueda ayudar a los animales, ya que eso le gusta mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de su matrícula, ya que así podrá seguir estudiando y luchando.
texts.en:
Alvaro works part time for a veterinarian. He lives with his parents and tells us that his mother is a house keeper and his father has his own business. Alvaro's future goals are to grow professionally and to become independent once he improves his income. 

Alvaro is studying to be a veterinarian, since he wants to be able to help animals which he likes very much. He is asking for this loan to pay his matriculation expenses, in order to keep studying and improve his situation.

loans.use: to pay university matriculation costs

loans.name: Forkland Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her early 40s, is single, with three children who are still at school. She has been a food vendor for ten years now.  She works from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Rehema's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy rice and some buckets for her food business and kept on increasing the food stock whenever she got a new loan.  She is doing fine with the loan and appreciates whoever supported their group.  

She used the profit to pay school fees, buy a plot of land, and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy small dry fish to resell.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group "FORKLAND," which has four members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to  buy small dry fish to resell

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco de 53 años de edad, casado con un hijo menor de edad, el cual está bajo su responsabilidad el joven estudia en la universidad. Francisco es originario del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región.  Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería agrónomo. En la actualidad a pesar de todas las adversidades que ha podido pasar junto a su familia, lucha día a día para brindarle mejores oportunidades de vida a su familia,  y cumplir sus más anhelados sueños como ver profesional a su hijo, y termina de construir su casa.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante  tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos lácteos como leche, cuajada, queso, crema,  el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y también lo desempeña de forma ambulante dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias, recorre las calles de su localidad para ofrecer su producto a clientes fijos como eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de productos lácteos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Francisco agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Francisco, 53 years old, is married and has a son who is studying at university. Francisco is originally from Sauce and is recognized for being hardworking and responsible, and for having a great desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources he was unable to complete his formal education, but he would have liked to study agricultural engineering. Currently, despite all the adversity he and his family have faced, he fights daily to provide his children with better opportunities and a better quality of life. His most desired dreams are to see his children become professionals and to finish the construction of his house. 

Thanks to his hard work, Francisco has establisehd a business selling dairy products such as milk, cheese curd, cheese, and cream. This business is located in a room in his house, and he also sells goods on the street. He works approximately 10 hours a day. His goal is to stock his business with more goods so that in the near future he can increase his income. Francisco is very grateful for the help that KIVA investors have provided to low-income borrowers in poor countries such as Nicaragua, enabling borrowers to have dignified work.

loans.use: to stock his business with dairy products such as milk, cheese curd, cheese, and cream

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio vive en la hermosa ciudad de Cusco al Sur de Peru pero nació en la ciudad de Urcos de la provincia de Quispicanchis,  él pertenece al banco comunal "Unión, Fuerza Amistad" de la Asociación Arariwa y su actividad económica principal es la compra de carros usados para luego desarmarlos y después vender sus partes como chatarra en una feria sabatina. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mas chatareria.
texts.en:
Leoncio lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in southern Peru, however he was born in the city of Urcos in Quispicanchis province. He belongs to the "Unión, Fuerza Amistad"
Communal Bank in Asociación Arariwa and his principal business is buying used cars to dismantle and then selling their parts as scrap metal at a Saturday market. At this time he needs a loan to purchase more scrap metal.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metal.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 51 years old and comes from Nyahururu. She is married to James and they are blessed with two children aged 13 and 7 years old.

She has been running her farming business for the last 20 years and to enable her to buy some planting seeds, fertilizer and to start a cereals business, she has applied for her first loan of KES. 30,000 form VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES. 15,000 and she has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to educate her children.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: To buy planting seeds, fertilizer and start a cereals business

loans.name: Baktykan

texts.ru: Бактыкан 50 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Старший сын оказывает сельхозуслуги по обработке земельных наделов на семейном тракторе, дочь замужем, средняя дочь работает швеей, младшие дети-школьники. Супруг посезонно работает на хлопковом заводе, в свободное время помогает Бактыкан. У Бактыкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бактыкан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 3 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1,26 ГА земельного надела, на котором выращивает хлопок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Baktykan is 50 years old; she and her husband have five children. The oldest son works by providing agricultural services (working the customers’ land on the family tractor). The eldest daughter is married. The middle daughter works as a seamstress. The youngest children are still in secondary school. Baktykan’s husband works at a cotton factory in season, and in his free time helps Baktykan. Baktrykan has received secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she raises livestock and grows produce, having launched three years ago by buying livestock for 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Baktykan’s hard work, her farm now includes four dairy cows and a 1.26-ha land plot, where she grows cotton. He monthly income is 15,000 KGS. In order to develop her farm further, Baktykan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan to increase her livestock headcount by buying cows. She plans to invest the resulting revenues in an additional increase of livestock. She also plans to save up to pay for further education of her children.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Girasoles Group

texts.es: Este grupo esta compuestas por tres empresarios exitoso una de ellas es Patricia mujer de 33 años de edad, casada desde hace varios años su negocio es dedicarse a vender ropa usada en su comunidad, municipios y comarcas cercanas a su domicilio, tiene 6 años de ser cliente de la institución, y a demostrado buen comportamiento en sus pagos, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa usada como pantalón de varón, pantalón de dama, camisas de varón, camisas de damas, shores, blusas, etc. Ana tiene 25 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y Bismar tiene 47 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en: This group is comprised of three successful entrepreneurs. One of them is Patricia. She is 33 years old and is married. For several years, she has earned her living selling used clothing in her community as well as municipalities and counties near her home. She has been a customer of this institution of 6 years. She has demonstrated reliable behavior in her repayments. This loan will be invested in the purchase of used clothing such as men's and women's pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, and more. Ana is 25 years old and her business is also selling used clothing and Bismar is 47 and his business is selling new clothing.

loans.use: to invest in secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Santa Cruz De Cocachacra Group

texts.es: El grupo “SANTA CRUZ DE COCACHACRA”  está conformada por 09 socias quienes se dedican al comercio minorista y a la  ganadería. Cecilia tiene 51 años es soltera con 01 hijo independiente. Ella se dedica a la crianza de animales cerdos pavos patos gallinas cuyes hace muchos años. Y a la vez  vende comida  en eventos que organiza la zona donde radica. Para luego expenderlos a los restaurant.   El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos para sus animales. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Cecilia es la se encuentra parada en la lado izquierdo viste blusa blanca
texts.en:
The lending group “SANTA CRUZ DE COCACHACRA” is composed of 9 members who work in small-scale businesses and livestock raising. 

Cecilia, one of the members, is 51 years old, single, and has an adult child. She raises pigs, turkeys, ducks, hens, and guinea pigs, which she has been doing for many years. Additionally, she sells food at events organized by her local community. 

With this loan Cecilia will buy food for her animals. All of the members of this group are grateful for KIVA lenders and the loans that they provide. In the photo, Cecilia is standing up on the left side, wearing a white blouse.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, ya que quiere poder terminarlos, y tener su título para poder trabajar y ayudar a su familia por medio de su profesión.
Su familia es su pilar, ya que siempre lo han ayudado y han estado con el apoyándolo. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que quiere poder cubrirlos y vio una gran oportunidad en el préstamo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Dina is from the city of Ybycuí. She is very dedicated to her studies, and hopes to finish soon so that she can begin working to support her family. 

Her family is her pillar, as they have always helped her when she has needed it. She is asking for this loan to invest in her studies, so that she can afford to pay for the rest of her education. She is very grateful for the opportunity to borrow.

loans.use: to pay university expenses

loans.name: Pera Group

texts.en:
Mariamu, who is in her mid-twenties, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school; the other one is still small. She has been running a genge (small grocery store or stall) for three years now. She works from 4:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Mariamu's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to restock the missing items (fruits and vegetables) in her genge. She dreams of improving her lifestyle and to make her business big.

Mariamu will share this loan with her group, "Pera", which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items (fruits and vegetables) in her genge.

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Chuso Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD DE CHUSO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Olivia ella es conviviente y tiene 24 años; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de salchipapas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como papas, aceite entre otros.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, artesania, maestro constructor y  agricultura.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These borrowers belong to the lending group "Virgen Natividad de Chuso." This group is located in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco. 

One of the borrowers, Olivia, is 24 years old and alternates her daily household activities with a business selling sausages. She has been doing this for a while now, and the business has been going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it daily. Olivia is very responsible and entrepreneurial, and hopes to keep up her business so she can continue to support her family. 

Olivia is asking for this loan to buy ingredients such as potatoes and oil, among others. 

The members that appear in the inserted photo asked permission to arrive late to the group meeting as a result of work commitments. The person whose face is blocked does not belong to this lending group. The other members of this group work selling animals, making handicrafts, overseeing construction, or in farming. 

Olivia is very grateful to those who help her to follow her dreams, and she promises to repay all loan installments according to the established repayment plan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as potatoes and oil, among others.

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martin, es una persona que se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, tiene 38 años de edad, le gusta mucho el trabajo en el campo, lo cual realiza con mucho empeño, es una actividad que le enseño su papá y es la forma que él tiene para salir adelante junto a su familia, ya que su esposa e hijos dependen económicamente de él.
EL crédito que requiere lo utilizara en la compra de una vaca horra, con lo que pretende en un futuro tener producción de derivados de la leche para mejorar la alimentación de su familia y también comercializarlos.
Sueña con aumentar las actividades económicas para mejorar su economía y así dar a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Martin is a farmer engaged in the production of basic grains. He is 38 years old and loves working in the field. It's a very hard activity that he learned from his father. It's the way that he earns a living for his family because his wife and children are financially dependent on him.

He has requested this loan used in the purchase of a heifer. He would like to produce dairy in the future to improve his family's nutrition and to take to market.

He dreams of expanding his economic activities to improve their family's economy to give his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer for milk production.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda  es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con   su  esposo  y sus  hijas sur de Honduras, su negocio es pulpería. 
Doña Yolanda el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: refrescos, carne, maíz, leche, carne frijoles manteca jabón etc. Con  el préstamo el  espera tener más mercadería que ofrecer para  poder cubrir los pedidos que en  esta temporada  que recibe a sus clientes. 
Doña Yolanda con los ingresos obtenidos mejorar su situación económica  de la familia, en el futuro el espera que su negocio sea  una pulpería más  grande y gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo y sueña con ver a sus hijos convertirlos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  para la  sociedad.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero  del  2014
texts.en: Yolanda is a very responsible, honest, and hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and their daughters in the south of Honduras, where she runs a small grocery store. Yolanda is asking for this loan to buy drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, lard, soap, etc. for the store. With this loan she hopes to have more merchandise to offer her clients. With the income that she earns, Yolanda will continue to improve the economic situation of her family. In the future, Yolanda hopes to have an even larger store, as well as the ability to raise her kids well and offer them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, lard, soap, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase fungicides and compost

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, 48 years of age, is married with one child. She has managed a rice retailing and frozen goods business for almost four years. With this business, she earns a net income of PHP 3,000, used as additional revolving capital and for family allowances. But, due to the high cost of necessities, she suffers insufficiency of working capital. 

Thus, Virginia is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy four sacks of rice to sell by the kilo. She is hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that she can further grow her business, to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of rice to sell by the kilo.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña María Consuelo es una señora de 51 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, con muchos ánimos y deseos de salir adelante, madre 9 hijos quienes ayudan en los diferentes haceos en el hogar y en el desarrollo de actividades en el campo en compañía de sus padres. Doña María Consuelo no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarle por la falta de dinero. Gracias al apoyo moral de sus padres ella pudo aprender las técnicas y procesos necesarios para llevar a cabo un buen cultivo de café con una experiencia por más de 15 años ella sigue trabajando duro y constante para salir adelante con sus hijos y su familia. El terreno que trabaja en compañía de su conyugue y sus hijos es propio y lo adquirió gracias a una herencia por sus padres el cual está ubicado muy cerca de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada caminando.
Sus metas y esperanzas para con su negocio es poder ampliarlo, generar mayores ganancias, comprar un nuevo terreno con plantilla nueva de café para que sus ingresos mejoren para el bienestar de sus familia y hogar. Como madre, apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo necesario y posible, fortalecer el patrimonio para los mismos y las demás generaciones. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas y poder asistir sus cultivos de café previniendo el deterioro por los cambios climáticos, enfermedades como la roya y bichos como la broca.
texts.en:
María Consuelo is 51 years old, head of her household, and works in agriculture. She has a great desire to get ahead. She is the mother of 9 children who help her with different chores around the house and in the field. María did not have the opportunity to study since her parents did not have the economic resources available to send her to school.
