However, thanks to the moral support of her parents she was able to learn different techniques and processes for successful coffee cultivation, which she has now been doing for more than 15 years. She continues to work hard to support her family. 

The land that she works along with her husband and children belongs to their family. It was inherited from her parents and is located very close to their home which means they can walk to it. 

María's goal is to grow her business, improve her earnings, buy new land and plant new coffee crops in order to continue to improve her business and better the well being of her family and home. As a mother, she supports heer children in every way possible, hoping to improve her wealth so that she can leave it for her children and future generations. Currently, she is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies, in order to protect her crops from deteriorating as a result of climate change or plagues.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to tend to her coffee crops

loans.name: Hugo De Jesús

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre trabajador y pujante, aunque se le han presentado muchas dificultades, siempre encuentra la manera de sobrepasarlas y seguir avanzando, motivado por el amor a sus dos hijos.
Hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica a trabajar en la fabricación y comercialización de calzado, el oficio lo aprendió con un familiar que se dedica a esta misma labor, poco  a poco fue perfeccionando la técnica y montó su propio negocio y contrató a varias personas para que le colaboraran en la distribución, pero luego de un tiempo terminaron por robarle toda la mercancía, causando graves daños a su economía. Hace algún tiempo se trasladó al departamento de Antioquia y ya radicado desea volver a iniciar su negocio; esto lo impulsa a solicitar el préstamo como un apoyo para seguir avanzando, con el dinero comprará accesorios, cueros, suelas y herramientas de trabajo, así podrá reiniciar su labor generadora de recursos.
Hugo manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es sacar adelante su negocio, trabajando arduamente, con esmero y dedicación y, en un futuro cercano desea convertirse en un distribuidor mayorista, con el fin de generar mayor rentabilidad para brindar a sus hijos una buena educación y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Hugo is a vigorous hardworking man. Although he has encountered many difficulties he always finds a way to overcome them and to continue moving ahead, motivated by his love for his two children. 

For approximately 10 years he made a living making and selling shoes, a profession he learned from a relative who was engaged in the same work. Gradually he perfected his technique and started his own business. He contracted with various people to collaborate in distribution.  But then for a while they ended up stealing his merchandise and causing serious damage to his earnings. A while ago he moved to the department of Antioquia and now that he has made his home there, he wants to start his business again. This motivates him to request a loan, as backing so he can continue advancing. With the money he will purchase accessories, leather, soles and work tools. This will enable him to re-start his work and make a living.

Hugo notes that he is eager to move his business ahead by working arduously, carefully and with dedication. In the near future he wants to become a wholesale distributor, with the goal of generating more profit so he can provide his children with a good education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase accessories, leather, soles and work tools.

loans.name: Honofre

texts.en:
Honofre is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 55 years old and he has three adult-aged children.

Aside from the farming business, he also engages in raising hogs to have an additional source of income. Honofre plans to acquire more pigs to raise, but he doesn't have enough capital.

For this reason, Honofre is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy hog feed and additional pigs to raise. Being a hard-working father, he believes that he will be able to improve the business and make it more profitable someday.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Jose Maximino

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive en un ambiente familiar junto a su esposa  y sus cinco hijos de 23, 21, 16, 11 y 9 años de edad, de los cuales 3 estudian y dos trabajan, para cubrir los gastos familiares se dedica a la cultivo de granos básicos y a la atención de una tienda en su residencia, aprendió todo lo relacionado con los cultivos de su padre y la tienda la fundo por iniciativa propia, su horario es de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m., lo hace con la ayuda de su esposa.
José necesita capital para realizar el pago de mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha, así como también invertirá el resto en la compra de golosinas, azúcar, aceite, sal, arroz, frijol, etc., será de gran ayuda para tener a tiempo la cosecha de maicillo en su hogar y surtirá la tienda con nueva mercadería para aumentar la clientela y mejorar sus ingresos.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más rentable que le los recursos económicos para cancelar sus deudas y dar a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y educación.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife and their five children ages 23, 21, 16, 11 and 9 years old. Three of his children are studying and two of them are working. In order to provide for his family, José works cultivating basic grains as well as running a small store from his home. He learned all he knows about crop cultivation from his father, and all about running a store on his own. He works from 6am to 6pm, alongside his wife. 

José is asking for this loan in order to hire some workers to help him with his upcoming harvest. With the rest of the money, he will purchase sweets, sugar, oil, salt, rice, beans, etc. for his store. It will be a great opportunity for him to obtain his harvest while at the same time being able to stock his store and increase his client base, thereby improving his income. 

José's dream is to have a more profitable business, so that he can use his earnings to repay his debts and provide his family with better food, clothing, and education.

loans.use: pago de mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha y compra de golosinas, azúcar, aceite, sal, arroz, frijol, etc

loans.name: Mundo De Colores Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por tres socias emprendedoras, una de ella es Lea mujer de 19 años de edad, acompañada, con un hijo, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada la cual la comercializa ambulante a sectores aledaños a su domicilio y barrios de la localidad, ella misma atiende su negocio y este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de mujer, pantalón de varón, camisas de varón, shores, blusas, etc. Bertha tiene 35 años de edad y su negocio es tener una mini pulpería en su domicilio y María tiene 53 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de granos básicos.
texts.en:
This lending group is composed of three entrepreneurial members. One of the members, Lea, is 19 years old and the mother of a small child. She works selling used clothes in the areas close to where she lives as well as in her own neighborhood. She alone is responsible for this work. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of clothing such as men's and women's pants, men's and women's blouses, etc. 

The other members of this group are Bertha, who is 35 years old and runs a small grocery store, and María, who is 53 years old and sells basic grains.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of used clothing such as men's and women's pants, men's and women's blouses, etc.

loans.name: María Ofelia

texts.es: Doña María tiene 64 años, separada y actualmente le queda una hija de 35 años, ella presenta una realidad que se vive en muchas familias en nuestra sociedad, debido a la violencia ella perdió a un hijo que era el apoyo para el sustento familiar, se vio en la obligación de estar como vendedora ambulante de algunos productos en las calles, como una mujer luchadora y emprendedora adquirió con dichas  ventas y la ayuda de un subsidio, una casa en la cual tiene una tienda con un surtido variado.  María sueña con una tienda más surtida para suplir más las necesidades del barrio donde habita, con el préstamo que desea adquirir ella surtirá su tienda con papelería y medias escolares para dichas temporadas y comprar más mercancía para su tienda en la que también distribuye productos de la canasta familiar  (granos, enlatados, lácteos, galletería),  esto hace que la señora María siga disfrutando de su labor y así aumenta cada día sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, debido a tantos problemas por los que ella ha atravesado es de mucha entereza y está dispuesta a triunfar.
texts.en:
María is 64 years old and separated.  She now has a 35 year old daughter remaining.  She faces a reality that is lived by many of the families in our society.  Due to the violence, she lost a son who supported the family.  She became obligated to sell some products in an itinerant manner on the streets.  

As a tenacious and enterprising woman, she made said sales and received the help of a subsidy.  She got a house in which she has a store that is stocked with various merchandise.  María dreams of a store that is better stocked in order to meet the needs of the neighborhood where she lives.

She wishes to use the loan to stock her store with stationery items and school socks for the school season.  She will buy more merchandise for her store in which she also distributes basic needs product (grains, canned goods, dairy products, and cookies).  This will make sure that María continues enjoying her work.  This way her income will increase every day, as well as her quality of life.  After having experienced so many problems, she is a woman of great strength.  She is ready to succeed.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (stationery items, school socks, and basic needs products).

loans.name: Carlos Francisco

texts.es:
Carlos, obtuvo una mejor producción de su cultivo de granos básicos gracias a  que pudo comprar los insumos necesarios para proteger la cosecha de plagas y preparar el terreno, sus ingresos son mejores, con los que ha podido cancelar sus deudas y mejorado las condiciones familiares, actualmente ha comprado muebles para su hogar.
En esta oportunidad solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de insecticidas, plaguicidas, abono y semilla de esta manera tendrá todo listo para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Carlos was able to improve his crop production of basic grains through his previous loan, since he was able to buy the necessary supplies to protect his fields from crop plagues. Additionally, he was able to better prepare his fields for the next growing season, improve his income, repay his debts, and improve his family's living conditions by buying furniture for their home. 

Currently, he is asking for a new loan to invest in the purchase of insecticides, fertilizer, and seeds, in order to have everything ready for his next harvest.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer and seeds

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 47 years old and a mother of four children. She is a hard-working mother who is engaged in the buying and selling of footwear within the town proper. She and her husband aim to continue sending her children to school, so that they will become professionals in the future. In this regard, she plans to further improve the business in order to generate a higher income.

Jane is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy more stocks of shoes, slippers, sandals, and belts to sell. She believes that, someday, she will be able to improve the business as she continues work hard for it.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes, slippers, sandals, and belts to sell.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking 20-year-old man. He is studying in a university taking up his BS in Criminology. 

Joseph has four siblings and he is someone who is very dedicated to his studies and the love of his family. His father worked as a security guard, his mother is a businesswoman and he works at various things to move forward. 

He is requesting this loan to pay school tuition fees. His goal is to continue working and encouraging his siblings to continue studying so that they all prepare themselves and become professionals.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 44 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school. Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc. 

Elisa has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina works hard to support three children. She is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Faustina requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.  

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Faustina is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family.

Ma. Fe has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising pigs.  

Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. Michelle is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Michelle is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.  She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Michelle is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support thirteen children. She is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Josephine requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Josephine is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and selling dried fish.  Elena is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like margarine, sugar, yeast, flour, etc for her bakery business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 35 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like margarine, sugar, yeast, and flour

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia works hard to support her family. Herminia is married and has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy equipment and materials for her repair shop.

Herminia has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Herminia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials for her repair shop

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling veterinary products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of veterinary products to sell for her business buying and selling veterinary products.

Jonah has been in this business for 3 years. Jonah earns more income from raising pigs.

Jonah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough money so she canafford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. Angie has been in this business for 12 years. Angie earns additional income from a general store.

Angie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, canned goods, etc. for her food vending business. 

Angie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 47 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Wilma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Wilma has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Wilma is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Saruuljavhlan

texts.en:
Ms.Saruuljavhlan is a bachelor degree student who studies in a private university as a financial analyst and economist. She is a really hard-working student. Her teachers do not have a negative thought about her and everyone thinks that she has a bright future. 

Saruuljavhlan thinks that obtaining knowledge regarding finance and economics will help to improve the Mongolian economic environment in the future. This loan is to pay for her tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ligaya is 47 years old and has children who are in school.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials, like linen, chalk, and thread.

Ligaya has been in this business for 27 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials, like linen, chalk, and thread.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena’s priority in life is her family. She always wants to give them a good future and this is the reason why she works industriously as a fruit and vegetables vendor. She is 37 years old. She wishes to add to her offered goods in her stall. To achieve this, she is seeking a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more vegetable such as cabbage, beans, pechay, potatoes and carrots. It would be a great help in making higher sales every day. She hopes that her loan request will be approved so that she can improve her business and their living as well.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable such as cabbage, beans, pechay, potatoes and carrots to sell.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs. She is in the business of selling grocery goods with the support of her husband who works abroad. Through this, she earns a good amount of income to support the household expenditures. In order to grow her sales, she has requested a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to see her children successful in their studies in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
This is Eduardo, 55, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Luzviminda, a housewife, and they have children. All of his children have graduated already except for the youngest. He and his wife manage their household while operating the business. He works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Eduardo operates a buy and sell business. What he basically does is buy different vehicles and motorcycles and sell them for a profit. He also has an accounting firm for additional income. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more vehicles and motorcycles for his buy and sell business.

Eduardo dreams that his business will continue to expand and hopes to give his family a good future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more vehicles and motorcycles needed in his buy and sell business.

loans.name: Jelyn

texts.en:
Jelyn is 48 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, Jelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap, etc.

Jelyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Jelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap, etc

loans.name: Veng's Group

texts.en: Veng is a 26-year-old farmer from Battambang province. He’s a father of one dependent daughter and she is too young for schooling. He is the one who supports the family. He grows rice for income. He has been with this business for three years and he can earn about 32,800 KHR per day. This is the second loan cycle for him with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has helped him to improve his family’s condition of living better than before. Now, he is the group leader of two requesting a total amount of 2,000,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is his loan portion. As the leader, he will spend his loan portion to buy a tractor for plowing his rice farmland. He hopes that his family’s income will increase.

loans.use: to buy a tractor for plowing his rice farmland.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising chickens. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is married and has three children. To make a living, Elsie manages a transportation service business while her husband works as a farmer on his own farm. She's been engaged in this business for more than nine years and she earns well from these activities. Elsie had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the repair of her tricycle. Recently, she requested a loan to buy new tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. The story of Elsie, and her business, is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy new tires

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, a mother of two, operates a general store to make a living. For 12 years of managing the store, she was able to sustain and support her children’s education. Her husband helps her in the business.  

In order to offer more to her customers, she borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future and she wants to see her children be successful.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Roxana, recurre nuevamente a solicitar más capital para invertirlo en la compra de pan, golosinas, bebidas, embutidos y aderezos, para tener más mercadería que ofrecer  en el chalet a sus clientes y continuar satisfaciendo sus necesidades.
Con el crédito anterior ella fortaleció su negocio aumento sus ventas y sus ganancias son mejores, lo que le ha permitido cancelar puntualmente sus cuotas y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Roxana returns to request more capital to buy bread, sweets, drinks, sausages, and condiments in order to have more merchandise to offer her customers in her snack bar and continue satisfying their needs.

With the previous loan, she strengthened her business and increased her sales. Her profits are also better, which has allowed her to make her repayments on time and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy bread, sweets, drinks, sausages, and condiments

loans.name: Jennylyn

texts.en:
Jennylyn is 28 years old and single.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, sugar, etc.

Jennylyn has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 14,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been farming rice for 18 years and she earns additional income from running a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 34 years old and married with eight children, three of whom are in school, Virgie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Virgie has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Virgie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Paso De Oro Group

texts.es:
El comité se formó con la unión de 17 mujeres jefas de familia que decidieron luchar por sus familias y formar este grupo que les será de mucha ayuda para ir mejorando sus vidas.
Nilda es una mujer muy sacrificada, que mediante la venta de frutas y verduras tiene los ingresos que le sirven para poder sostener a su familia. Desde muy temprano todos los días trabaja hasta muy tarde, y así está saliendo adelante. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, que le permitirá mejorar su plan de negocios y también sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank was started by 17 women, heads of family who came together as a group to strive for their families.  The group will help them improve their lives.

Nilda's a very self-sacrificing woman who sells fruits and vegetables to earn the income she needs to support her family.  She's getting ahead by working every day from early in the morning until very late.

She's requesting this loan to buy fruits and vegetables so she can improve her business plan and her income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Martiza

texts.en: Martiza, 23 years of age, is still single. She's been into the hog-raising business for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 1,000 per hog. Due to inadequate capital for her agricultural business, she would like to take a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feed to supplement the needs of her hogs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her hog raising business.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed to supplement the needs of her hogs.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing through NWTF to buy additional rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Beatriz has been in this business for two years. Beatriz earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Beatriz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Kay is 42 years of age and a mother of an adult child who is attending school. Kay helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living and is engaged in the pig fattening business for additional income. She grows and sells pigs to local traders or the butcher in her village. She has been doing this since 2006 and earns a normal income of KHR 10,000 per day.

Recently, she took a new loan, which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Kay is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector (a retail store). She has been doing this business for more than seven years. She earns well from this and repaid her previous loans successfully. She used this loan to buy goods for the store.

Natividad requests a new loan of PHP 5,000. She will use the loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en: Vevencia owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She is eager to have a profitable store and get a higher capital. So she decided to ask for a micro credit loan from GDMPC. Thus, she will be able to purchase more products to sell and keep developing the business. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used in her business. She works hard to provide the needs of her children. Currently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her three children. Her husband is an animal seller by profession, and he is responsible to fulfill the needs of his family. Shaheen is also providing sewing services and earning income to contribute along with her husband to manage the household. 

Shaheen needs different kinds of goods for her business such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. However, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Shaheen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some accessories such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Las Sonrientes Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por cuatros socias emprendedoras exitosas una de ellas es Xiomara mujer de 42 años de edad, casada su negocio es la venta de cosméticos variados con diferentes casas comerciales desde hace varios años, de ser cliente de la institución un año. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra  cosméticos de la Avon perfume de dama, perfume de varón, lociones para caballeros, cremas faciales, cremas para el cuerpo, vanidades, maquillajes, etc. Raquel tiene 34 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos, Nohelia tiene 23 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa calzado y Tanya tiene 25 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frijoles cocidos.
texts.en:
This group is composed of four successful entrepreneurs.One of them is Xiomara, who is 42 years old and married. Her business is selling a variety of cosmetics from different companies, something she has done for a number of years. She has been a client of this institute for one year. With this loan she will buy Avon cosmetics like perfume, cologne, men's lotions, face cream. body cream, compacts, make-up, etc.

Raquel is 34 years old and her business is also selling cosmetics. Nohelia is 23 and she sells clothing and shoes. Tanya is 25 years old and her business is selling cooked beans.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics from Avon like perfume, cologne, men's lotions, face cream. body cream, compacts, make-up, etc.

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Chuluuntsetseg, 50 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a train attendant for 27 years, while her husband is an operator at a mining company. Their son studies at university. 

Chuluuntsetseg is requesting a loan of 1420 USD to pay the remaining cost of her electric car. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air in cities because it produces no harmful pollution such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, or various oxides of nitrogen. The borrower will use her car mainly for driving to work.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
El socio continua conjuntamente con su esposa con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, él socio lleva buen tiempo con este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea que el negocio crezca en el futuro.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de cremas, perfumes entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to work with his wife in their business of selling beauty products. He has been in this business for a long time and is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts forth each day into his work. In the future, he wants to grow the business.

The borrower is requesting a loan in order to buy crèmes, perfumes, and other products. He is grateful for the loan he has received and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy crèmes, perfumes, and other products.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Esperanza tiene 25 años casada con dos hijos de las edades de 2 años y un bebe de 5 meses,  ella se dedica a la venta de frutas naturales, ella vende sus productos en un mercado de la zona de Chasquipampa, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Esperanza va a usar este préstamo para compra de frutas por cambio de temporada al por mayor, la señora Esperanza enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  frutas para ir mejorando su negocio  así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza is 25 years old, married, and has two children (a two-year-old and a five-month-old baby). She sells natural fruits at a market in the District of Chasquipampa. This loan is her first transaction with Emprender.

Sra. Esperanza will use the loan to buy fruits in bulk for the next season. She faces challenges in her business, such as dealing with the competition. Esperanza will use her profits to continue buying fruit so that she can improve her business, which will help her generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs so she can maintain her coffee plants.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto, aged 61, is married and blessed with five children. He has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost ten years, and earns a net income of PHP 200 a day. His profits are usually spent on their daily expenses at home. 

Due to insufficient funds to run a business, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase sugar, coffee, detergent soap, chips, and beverages to sell. He's hoping that his requested loan will help his business become more profitable and improved.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, coffee, detergent soap, chips, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a course in her degree program.

loans.name: Vuon

texts.en:
Vuon, age 32, grows and sells rice to earn an income. She sells her produce at local markets in her community, and she is known as a very hard-working woman. 

She and her husband have two children, and Vuon is responsible for caring for them as well as maintaining her household obligations. She lives with her husband and children in the village of Baray district in Kampong Thom province. 

Vuon wants to increase her rice productivity and earn a better income in order to better provide for her children. She has some savings set aside for purchasing a piece of land, which will enlarge her farming area. She has requested a loan which she will add to her savings so that she can buy the land she needs.

She is confident that that her investment will bring an abundant harvest and increase her income. 

Her goal is to ensure that her children receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to enlarge her farming area

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 42 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Juanita has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from pre-paid mobile load.

Juanita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La socia Gloria pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco. 
La socia Gloria continua con su negocio de cabina de internet, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra teclados ,mouse entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón de San Sebastián”, which is in the city of Cusco. She continues her Internet café business. Gloria has been in this business for a long time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. She is a responsible and industrious person who works in this manner so that her family can get ahead.

Gloria is requesting a loan in order to buy keyboards, a mouse, and other accessories. She is grateful for the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy keyboards, a mouse, and other accessories.

loans.name: Arquimides Antonio

texts.es:
Arquímides de 44 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es casado; su
esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene cinco hijos tres de ellas asisten a la escuela.

Él Se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 10 años, este trabajo lo aprendió de un amigo que lo invitaba a que trabajara como ayudante y así aprendió el trabajo y lo ha seguido haciendo; pero también don Arquímides, por las tardes se dedica a la agricultura.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 5 pliegos de lámina, 3 bolsas de cemento y 4 horcones para hacer el baño de su casa que ya está muy viejo; pero también con este préstamo pagara el alquiler de 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno para el cultivo, ya que con el crédito anterior le fue muy bien con el cultivo saco mucha ganancia con los frijoles, de esa ganancia alquilo otros 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno, por lo que este año sembrara 14,000 metros cuadrados de milpa.  

Sus sueños, es poder ayudar a sus hijos que terminen los estudios y tener maíz este próximo año  para que no falte la tortilla en la casa, ni la comida. Con las ganancias que obtenga de esta cosecha, sembrara más el próximo año y así poder tener más y así cada año poder cultivar mas para tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Arquímides is 44 years old. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He is married and his wife is a homemaker. He has five children and three of them are in school.

He has been a bricklayer for 10 years. He learned this work from a friend who invited him to work as an assistant and that is how he learned the trade. He has continued doing it, but Arquímides also farms in the afternoon.

The loan he is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy 5 pieces of sheeting, 3 bags of cement and 4 supports to remodel a bathroom in his house.  It is very old. He also wants to pay to rent 7,000 square meters of land to plant. With the previous loan, things went really well for him. He made a lot of profit on the bean crop and with those profits he rented another 7,000 square meters of land. So this year, he will plant 14,000 square meters of corn. 

His dream is to be able to help his children finish their education and have corn this next year so they won't have a shortage of tortillas or food in the home. With the earnings he will make from this harvest, he will plant more next year so he can have more and plant more every year for more profits.

loans.use: to buy five pieces of sheeting, 3 bags of cement, and 4 supports to build a bathroom and to pay for the rental of 7,000 square meters of land for planting.

loans.name: Arcoiris Del Amor Group

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer emprendedora de mucho éxito, es miembro del grupo compuesto por dos socios más. Ella tiene 49 años de edad es madre soltera con cuatro hijos a su cargo y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada en las comarcas y municipios cercano a su domicilio, esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años consecutivos, ella misma atiende su negocio y uno de sus hijos le ayuda a vender el producto. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa como pantalón de varo, pantalón de dama, vestidos, blusas, shores, pantalón de niña, camisas de varón, camisas de damas etc. Carlos tiene 22 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de comida y Hamilton tiene 41 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de pollo y servicio de transporte en caponera.
texts.en: Carmen is an enterprising woman who is very successful. She is a member of the group, with two other members. She is 49 years old and a single mother of four children. Her business is selling used clothing in the towns and communities near his home. She has been doing this activity for 4 years in a row. She runs her business herself and one of her sons helps her to sell the product. She will invest this loan in buying clothes such as men's pants, women's pants, dresses, blouses, shorts, girls' pants, boys' shirts, women's shirts, etc. Carlos is 22, and his business is selling food. Hamilton is 41, and his business is selling chicken and a transportation service in a caponera.

loans.use: to invest in buying used clothing, such as  men's pants, women's pants, blouses, shorts, girls' pants, boys' shirts, women's shirts, etc.

loans.name: Habibullah

texts.en:
Habibullah is a very hardworking man. He lives in Karachi, Pakistan. He owns a pharmacy in the main market. He is an active borrower of Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan. He has requested a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan to purchase medicines for selling purposes. 

Habibullah is a responsible father of five children. All of his children are enrolled in school. His elder son is studying in sixth class, and the younger one is studying in the second grade. 

Habibullah hopes that the loan will be helpful for his business and his family’s future. He is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for his pharmacy.

loans.name: Muzhar

texts.en:
Muzhar lives in Karachi, Pakistan with his family. He is a 36-year-old man. He is the father of one child. Muzhar is a children's school bag seller. He is very efficient at stitching bags. He works very hard so that he can meet daily family expenses. He owns a bag stitching shop in the market, where he stitches a variety of school bags and sells them at a good price. He also sells stocks of bags to retailers so that they can sell them in the market. All of his customers appreciate his work. 
Presently, Muzhar wants to purchase material for stitching school bags in order to sell them. Muzhar is so very thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase material for stitching school bags.

loans.name: Shehbaz

texts.en:
Shehbaz lives in Karachi, Pakistan. He owns a farm and a house. He sells fresh milk from his farm. He also sells cows. He is a very hardworking and honest person. He has asked for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase food for the cows and buffaloes.

Shehbaz loves his family. He is the father of four children. Two of his children are enrolled in school. He wants to provide a quality education for his children. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase food for the cows and buffaloes on his farm.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is aged 53, married and blessed with two children. She owns and operates a retail store in their village and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Due to insufficient funds to run her business, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase bread, curls, coffee, sugar, and beverages to sell. She also sells bananas to generate additional income for her family. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve and expand her business more.

loans.use: To purchase bread, curls, coffee, sugar, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Janbeth

texts.en:
Janbeth is 20 years old and lives with her parents and five siblings. Her parents earn money from their tailoring business. She is a student at the university pursuing a Bachelors of Science degree in Elementary Education.  

She is requesting a loan to pay her tuition so that she will concentrate on her studies without worrying about her fees. If she graduates from the university successfully, it will be a great help for the family. Her parents are hardworking individuals who are very caring to their children.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kamwenge in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Edward has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells maize. 

To help expand his business, Edward has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize seeds and will help Edward to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Edward hopes that in the future he will be able to have better living standards. 




"

loans.use: to buy more maize seeds

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married and she has children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Virginia operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are pork, beef, and processed meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business. 

Virginia hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 46 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Ibrahim has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells cooking oil, toilet paper, stationary items and other items. 

To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy items such as cooking oil, toilet paper, and stationary items, and will help Ibrahim to generate greater profits and increase his capital and profits. Ibrahim hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business. 




"

loans.use: to buy items such as cooking oil, toilet paper, and stationary items

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 32 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells produce items. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more ground nuts, beans, and flour, and it will help Grace to generate greater profits and improve her livelihood. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 




"

loans.use: to buy more ground nuts, beans, and flour

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 48 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Peter has been working hard to manage his Medical Clinic, which sells drugs and treatments. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and it will help Peter to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Peter hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more drugs

loans.name: Moraa

texts.en:
Meet Moraa, a farmer living in Kisii with her husband and five children. She has been doing agriculture for eight years, producing and selling milk, eggs, cereals, and tea. In farming, she enjoys planting cereals, but her biggest challenge is diseases affecting crops and livestock.

Moraa chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because she wants to enhance her farming projects and Juhudi helps farmers like her. During the training, she learnt how to manage her loan well. This loan will enable her to purchase a dairy cow, which will increase her income level through the production of milk, and also give her milk for her family's consumption.

loans.use: For purchasing a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past five years, Tadeo has been working hard to manage his grocery shop, which sells grocery items, soft drinks and stationery.

To help expand his business, Tadeo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock beer, soda and other stationery items, and will help Tadeo to generate greater profits and increase borrower capital. Tadeo hopes that in the future he will be able to acquire profits.







"

loans.use: to stock beer, soda and other stationery items

loans.name: Sugirmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Sugirmaa, 29 years old, lives with her family in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook at a lounge for two years. Her husband is a driver who has been working at a private firm since 2011. She is requesting a loan of 1100 USD to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for ger renovation. After the renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building materials to renovate her home.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Deo has been working hard to manage his grocery shop, which sells fruits, household items and others items. 

To help expand his business, Deo has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add fresh fruits to the business, and will help Deo to generate greater profits and increase his capital and profits. Deo hopes that in the future he will be able to acquire enough capital.

loans.use: to add fresh fruits to the business

loans.name: One By One Women Group

texts.en:
Monica is married and 40 years old with four children, two of whom are school going. She is a third-time borrower from Ugafode Microfinance Ltd. Monica is selling drinks on the outskirts of the city and also has a rental house where she earns income to look after her family. She has been servicing a loan of 800,000 UGX that she repaid well. She has now borrowed a loan of 1,200,000 UGX through the group in order to pay tuition for her children at the university. She is so grateful to the institution because she has been able to borrow money to pay school fees for her children and take care of them. She is an honest and God-fearing woman. Her dream is to see all her children finish school. 

The group members are proud to be Kiva partners. Thank you Kiva lenders. The lady dressed in black in the middle is the Ugafode Credit Officer in charge of the group.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Calvin

texts.en:
Calvin is 33 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past five years, Calvin has been working hard to manage her clothing sales business. 

To help expand her business, Calvin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for the business and will help Calvin to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Calvin hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 




"

loans.use: buy more clothes for the business

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is 38 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Hanifa has been working hard to manage her restaurant business, which sells food and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Hanifa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items, chairs and tables, and will help Hanifa to generate greater profits and expand the business. Hanifa hopes that in the future, she will be able to increase her income. 




"

loans.use: buy more food items, chairs and tables

loans.name: Perzi

texts.en:
Perizi is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past three years, Perizi has been working hard to manage his pharmacy, which sells drugs and baby items like pampers. 

To help expand his business, Perizi has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs, and will help Perizi to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Perizi hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger pharmacy.

loans.use: buy more drugs to stock his pharmacy.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Age 42 and a resident of Kandal province, Soeurn is a mother of three who are dependent on her because they are in school. The main sources of her family’s income are from her occupation as a local schoolteacher and her husband's job at a construction site.  Besides the household that she needs to take care of, she wants to focus on her child’s education. Therefore, she applied for an education loan to cover the school fees for her son who is eager to pursue his Bachelor's Degree majoring in Tourism and Hospitality. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To cover the school fees for her son

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Benkadi sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages plyogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 49ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Kalaban Coro dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro. Les membres du groupe font le  commerce de légumes, condiments, produits cosmétiques et bois de chauffage. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des  fruits et légumes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 corbeilles de bananes plantain, 3 corbeilles d’avocats à Bamako. La revente se fait à Kalaban Coro et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Awa espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en: The five women of the Benkadi group are married, largely in polygamous households. On average, they are 49 years old and have six children. They all live in the Kalaban Coro neighborhood, in the district of Bamako. They know one another through neighborly connections and their revenue-generating businesses at the Kalaban Coro market. The members of the group run businesses selling vegetables, spices for making sauces, cosmetic products, and firewood. With the goal of resupplying for cash, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle. Ms. Awa (the woman sitting to the extreme left of the photo) has a great reputation in the sale of fruits and vegetables. She expects to use her loan to buy three baskets of plantains and three baskets of avocados in Bamako. The resale will be done in Kalaban Coro and on foot to a clientele largely composed of women. With this loan, Ms. Awa hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA which will be used to reinvest in the business and to take care of the needs and health of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a farmer living in the Kisii area of Nyanza. He is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been farming for seven years, producing and selling milk, eggs, maize, bananas, cereals, and sugarcane. Besides farming, he has a retail business. In farming, he loves cereal farming since it has better returns. His biggest challenge is insufficient capital to undertake his farming projects.

Stephen chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because he wants to advance in farming. During the training, he learnt how to manage his farming activities. He said that this loan will provide more milk for his family's consumption and with the income that he gets out of it, he will be able to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rossette

texts.en:
Rossette is 41 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with none of them currently in school. For the past three years, Rossette has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells bed covers, pillows, door mats, etc. 

To help expand her business, Rossette has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bags, clothes, and pillows and will help Rossette to generate greater profits and add to her stock. Rossette hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags, clothes, and pillows.

loans.name: Jolly

texts.en:
Jolly is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past five years, Jolly has been working hard to manage her poultry business raising chickens and producing eggs. 

To help expand her business, Jolly has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry feeders and will help Jolly to generate greater profits and increase the number of chickens. Jolly hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 




"

loans.use: to buy more poultry feeders

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Jackson has been working hard to manage his produce business. . 

To help expand his business, Jackson has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beans, soya beans, groundnuts, rice, and posho, and will help Jackson to generate greater profits and increase his stock. Jackson hopes that in the future, he will be able to have more capital. 




"

loans.use: to buy more beans, soya beans, groundnuts, rice, and posho to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Meet Joseph, a farmer who hails from Kisii area. He is married and has 10 children, and has been doing agri-business for 10 years. He produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, cereals, and bananas. In farming he loves to sell milk because there are good returns. His biggest challenge is pests and diseases.

Joseph chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer low interest rates on their loans, and he also appreciates how Juhudi has brought a lot of unity among farmers. He states that this loan will enable him to produce more milk with his additional cow, and thus the milk will be for his family's consumption as well as for selling.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 50 years old, married, and lives with her family. She has a retail store serving several customers; she sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income while her husband works as a government employee. 

Bernadette has four years experience in this field. Bernadette is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to show customers her responsibility and reliability to serve. 

Bernadette requested this loan to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may open a bigger place and continue assisting her family with the additional income.

The story of Bernadette and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to buy additional goods and bottled products to sell.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is studying in a university, taking up Bachelor of Science in Hotel and Restaurant Management. 

Albert is someone who is very dedicated to his studies and wants to become successful in his career. His father is a businessman, and he helps his parents by working at various tasks to help their living situation. 

He is requesting this loan to pay the school tuition fees. His goal is to have a better life and career in the future.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a 55-year-old widowed woman and the mother of five children. She is in the business of selling ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing in their community. Through this, she earns a better income to support her family. In order to grow her sales, she has requested a loan from GDMPC Microcredit. She intends to use this loan to buy additional RTW to sell. She expects this to boost her earnings and profits and make a better life for the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ruoti

texts.en:
Ruoti lives in Kisii area. He is married and has nine children, and has been doing agri-business for nine years. He produces and sells milk, tea, and cereals. He loves dairy farming the most because it has good returns.

Ruoti chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they do invest in farmers and he wants to do more agriculture. During the training, he learnt how to use his loan and how to repay the loan effectively. This loan will provide more milk for his family's consumption and also for selling, and thus bring in more income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zoila Marina

texts.es:
Zoila, opta por un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de chicharrón, quesillo, aceite, aderezos, bebidas y repollo, estos son parte de los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar la venta de pupusas y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a fortalecer su negocio teniendo como resultado mejores ventas, mayores ganancias, con las que ha mejorado el estilo de vida familiar y la vistosidad de su negocio pues compro más mesas.
texts.en:
Zoila is requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of pork, cheese, oil, seasonings, beverages and cabbage. These are some of the necessary ingredients for producing pupusas [thick, handmade corn tortillas with filling] for sale and offering good service to her customers.

The previous loan helped her to strengthen her business and resulted in better sales and greater earnings, which she used to improve her family's living conditions. She also improved the visibility of her business by buying more tables.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, oil, seasonings, beverages and cabbage

loans.name: Confiance Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Confiance est majoritairement composé de femmes monogames.  Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (choux, persils), laitue et beurre de karité. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments (choux, persils,…). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 corbeilles de persils, 20 sacs de choux  au marché Médine de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché de Djicoroni  à une clientèle mixte. Madame Oumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 23.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son petit commerce dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Confiance group is mostly made up of monogamous wives. On average, they are 28 years old and have four children. They all live in Djicoroni and they know one another through neighborly ties. The group members run small businesses selling vegetables for making sauces (cabbage, parsley), lettuce and shea butter. With the goal of increasing their business funds, the members of the group decided to work together with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan cycle. Ms. Oumou (the woman standing to the extreme right of the photo) has a great reputation in the sale of vegetables for making sauces (cabbage, parsley, etc.). She expects to use her loan to buy 20 baskets of parsley and 20 bags of cabbage at the Medine market in Bamako. The resale takes place at retail at the market in Djicoroni to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Ms. Oumou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 23,000 francs CFA, which will be used to reinvest in the business. Through her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso, her objective is to increase the volume of her small sales.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices to make sauces.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen, 53 years of age, has been into the hog raising business for almost six years. She is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. They are harmoniously residing in their cozy village. 

Due to insufficient funds, Carmen would like to avail a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase hog feed and a hog to raise. In this business, she is earning a net income of PHP 3,000 for every hog that she sells. Her net profits from her business are usually spent on their food expenses and basic necessities. 

She is hoping that her business will continue to grow and be more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and a hog to raise.

loans.name: Rayito De Luz Para El Progreso. Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Rayito De Luz Para El Progreso” La cual  está constituido por 05 socios Responsables y leales. Vanesa de 21 años de edad es casada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo ha podido mejorar su vivienda. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de agua mineral, gaseosa y cerveza. El grupo “Rayito De Luz Para El Progreso” agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Vanesa es la tercera del lado derecho y viste polo blanco.
texts.en: This is the new communal bank "Rayito De Luz Para El Progreso” (Little Ray of Light for Progress).  It is made up of five responsible and loyal members.  Vanesa is 21-years old, married and has two dependent children.  She makes her living selling beverages.  With the fruit of her labor, she has been able to make improvements to her house.  Vanesa requested the loan to purchase mineral water, sodas and beer.  The communal bank "Rayito De Luz Para El Progreso” is grateful to all the people who made this loan possible.  Vanesa is the third from the right in the above photo; she is wearing a white t-shirt.

loans.use: to purchase mineral water, sodas and beer.

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim is 53 years old and single. She currently lives with her father and some nieces and nephews in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She helps her father operate their farm to make a living and earns additional income from selling tamarinds to local retailers in her village. Tamarinds are usually used by housewives to add sour flavor to soups or sauces.

As of now, Yim is borrowing USD 1,000 in order to buy more tamarinds for sale. Through this loan’s help, she will be able to sustain her business and stabilize the income of her family. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business, repair her family home and support her nieces and nephews in school.

loans.use: to buy more tamarinds for sale.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, 51, didn't have the opportunity to finish her primary school level. She is married to Thy, a fisherman, and together they have given birth to three children. Currently San lives with her spouse and her children in a village of Baray district, Kampong Thom, where they operate an agriculture business  farming rice on around one and a half hectare. This is the sole source of her family income. 

The loan she's requesting from Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is to buy timbers for home improvements. This loan will enable her to accommodate her children with a suitable home and prevent them from the weather conditions. In the future, she hopes to continue with her farming business so as to provide economic stability for her family, and provide an education to her children.

loans.use: to buy timbers for home improvements.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is studying for his Associate degree in Information Technology in a university.

Patrick wants to become successful in his career and be able to support his parents and help his four siblings' education. His father is a carpenter while her mother does household chores. 

He is requesting this loan to pay his school tuition fees. His ambition is have a better life and a successful career in the future.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fee.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en: Arcelie offers manicure and pedicure services to earn an income. Her husband is working as a school maintenance man to earn a living while she also sells grocery goods in their village. She has been in her retailing business for two years and she has been able to sustain it. In order to improve her business's return, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying a manicure set. She wants to improve her business and be able to generate more profits so she can support the family needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish, ice cubes and plastic bags for her business.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, ice cubes and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Henry Rene

texts.es:
Henry de 32 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado  de secundaria, está felizmente casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también al cuido de aves de corral que tienen en el patio de la casa, sus hijos asisten a la escuela local y son muy obedientes con sus padres, a veces vienen unos primos a jugar y hacerles compañía. 

Henry es residente estadounidense,  lleva 5 años viajando al país de las barras y las estrellas para ir a trabajar y hacer dinero, de esta manera ayuda a su familia a que tengan una buena calidad de vida. Cuando la temporada de trabajo es baja, Henry regresa a El Salvador a gozar de la compañía familiar y esperar un tiempo para luego volver a viajar en busca de trabajo. 

Henry quiere ampliar la casa en la que viven, él necesita el dinero para terminar de hacer una habitación para sus hijos, pues de momento solo tienen uno  para los dos y desea que tengan mayor comodidad, esto le será de gran satisfacción pues verá a su familia más contenta.

Henry sueña con tener una casa grande para su familia, de esta manera puede ir agradando su familia y llevar un sistema de vida más cómoda.
texts.en:
Henry is 32 years old and studied until eighth grade. He is happily married. His wife takes care of domestic duties and also cares for the poultry which they raise on the patio of the house. His children go to the local school and are very obedient to their parents. Sometimes their cousins come to play and keep them company.

Henry is a U.S. resident, and has spent five years traveling to the country of stars and stripes to work and make money, and in this way help ensure that his family has a good quality of life. During the low work season, Henry returns to El Salvador to enjoy the company of his family and wait until the time to return to travel in search of work.

Henry wants to expand the house in which they live. He needs money to finish building a bedroom for his children, since right now they only have one for the two children and he wants them to live more comfortably. It will be a great satisfaction to him to see his family more happy. Henry dreams of having a large house for his family, so that he can continue pleasing his family and working toward a more comfortable lifestyle.

loans.use: to finish building a bedroom for his children

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, charcoal, soap, shampoo and groceries to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns an income from raising pigs.

Maribel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, charcoal, soap, shampoo, and groceries to sell

loans.name: St.adolf Bakyara Twezimbe Group

texts.en:
