Josephat whose hand is raised is a 46 year old man married with five children living in Kyenjojo,Uganda and a member of St.Adolf Bakyara . He has been in a local brew (Waragi) distillation business for 5 years now.He obtains additional income from a retail shop dealing in general household items. He started his business with hopes of getting more income for educating his children and building a permanent home. He is faced with lack of capital and banana bacterial wilt that affects bananas, which is the major input product for the local brew.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more local brew to sell and pay workers.

loans.use: to buy more local brew to sell and pay workers.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet  is 51 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a retail store in their village where she sells assorted groceries  to generate additional income, while her husband works as a government employee. 
 Juliet wants to provide income for the family and to give her children a better education.
Juliet requested this  loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may gain bigger income to provide her family .

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Merline

texts.en: Merline is a young Cameroonian aged 24. He is married with a 2-year-old child. He has been in this business for over four years, which makes him very experienced and stable. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase his turnover by forty percent.

loans.use: to buy fowl feed.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Doña Paula es una mujer que diariamente lucha por el bienestar de sus 2 hijos quienes trabajan en el campo junto a su padre y ella desarrollando las diferentes actividades como: limpieza, aplicación de abono, foliares, entre otros. Su grado de estudio es de primaria pero no pudo completarla cursando únicamente tres años de estudio ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos para apoyarla. Sus padres le enseñaron a muy temprana edad a trabajar la tierra ya que no pudieron apoyarle con sus estudios y le heredaron la tierra que hoy en día en familia trabaja de esta forma generar los ingresos para su familia e hijos. Su propiedad está ubicada muy cerca de su casa de habitación a la cual en familia se trasladan caminando diariamente. 
Sus metas, planes y sueños tener algún día solvencia económica y rentable que ayude al desarrollo de su trabajo para llevar a cabo el mismo de manera libre y fortalecerlo poco a poco. Ella espera que mediante al sacrificio que hoy en día hace el futuro de sus hijos se mejor y más tranquilo ya que mediante este financiamiento que hoy solicita espera asistir y dar una excelente atención a sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de abono, foliares, formula de crecimiento y limpieza del mismo.
texts.en:
Paula is a woman who struggles daily for the well-being of her two children who work in the country together with their father and herself carrying out different activities such as: weeding, application of manure and foliar fertilizers, among others. She has a primary school education but was not able to complete her studies. She only completed three years of study since her parents did not have the resources to support her. Her parents taught her from a very early age to work the land since they could not support her studies and they had inherited the land which she works today to generate income for her family and children.

Her property is located very close to her home. Her family walks between these locations daily. Her goals, plans and dreams are to one day achieve profitability and economic solvency that will help her accomplish her work more freely, strengthening it little by little. She hopes that through her sacrifices her children will have a better and more tranquil future.

Through the financing which she is requesting today, she hopes to provide excellent attention to her coffee crops through the purchase of manure, foliar fertilizers, growth formula and weeding.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and maintenance of her coffee crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: , who runs her own business, to buy clothing and other stock for resale

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is from the village of Guam. She is 52 years old, married and has three children. To make a living Rowena owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. She has been in this business for two years and usually earns a net income of PHP 300 a day. At this moment, Rowena is asking a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy drinks, snack foods, spices and noodles for her business.In this way, she can sustain her family's basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, spices and noodles for her business

loans.name: Maria Julyfa

texts.en: Maria Julyfa  offers beauty products to her costumers in their village to make a living. She also has a farm where she gets her main source of income. She has been doing this business for more than two years. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for purchasing cosmetic products. Recently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer for the farm. She hopes to build some savings for a better future for her child.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer comes from Ozamis City. She has been engaged in the food production business. Aged 22, she learns to cook in order to help her family. She asks for microcredit from GDMPC in order to invest in her restaurant. She needs to purchase raw ingredients to prepare food to sell.  

Jennifer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven, 32, has four children and is currently dealing in cocoa products and bricklaying. 

He  began his business 10 years ago in Bundibugyo, Uganda with the hope of increasing his earnings. He has been faced with bad seasons, which affect his cocoa output, as much as he continues to work harder. 

His dream is to buy a plot of land and invest the money in the cocoa business. Steven needs this loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Luís Ángel

texts.es:
Luis es una persona muy familiar, vive junto con su mamá y un tío, está soltero pero tiene un niño tiernito, él junto con su tío son los que trabajan, pues su madre tiene imposibilitadas las piernas y por lo tanto no puede realizar mayores actividades.

Luís desde pequeño le ha gustado el trabajo de campo, todas las mañanas se levanta a ordeñar sus vacas y el resto del día se dedica a darles de comer y ejecutar todas las labores correspondientes. Sus hermanos emigraron hacia los Estados Unidos, él siendo el menor fue el único que decidió quedarse en El Salvador.  

El préstamo solicitado, es para picar zacate  y así tener materia prima para hacer concentrado y darles de comer a sus animales y puedan seguir dando leche incluso en esta época de verano.
Luís sueña con ampliar su ganadería y crecer económicamente, para luego en un futuro formar un hogar.
texts.en:
Luis is a very friendly person.  He lives with his mother and an uncle.  Luis is single but has an affectionate little boy.  Luis and his uncle are the ones who work, as his mother has a handicap in her legs and as such cannot do many activities. 

Since he was young, Luís has liked farm work.  Every morning he gets up and milks his cows.  He spends the rest of the day feeding them and taking care of the corresponding labors.  His siblings emigrated to the United States.  Being the youngest, Luis was the only one who decided to stay in El Salvador.  

The loan Luis has requested is for cutting grass to have raw materials to make animal feed to give to his livestock so they keep giving milk, even in the summer months. 

Luís hopes to expand his stock and grow financially so that he can later set up a home.

loans.use: to cut grass to have raw materials to make animal feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is married and has two children. She has been selling different kinds of cosmetic products within her village. She has been operating this business for almost two years. Judith would like to take out for a loan in the amount of PHP 13,000 to be able to buy all the cosmetic products needed by her customers. She hopes to obtain more cosmetics in order to encourage more customers to buy her products. In this way she can generate bigger income and improve her direct selling business.

loans.use: to buy all the cosmetic products needed by her customers

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por otro crédito, porque necesita capital para fortalecer su negocio, lo invertirá en la compra de pollitas de engorde y concentrado para alimentarlas, lo que le ayudará a aumentar su granja de pollos de engorde y de gallinas indias.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar las condiciones de la infraestructura de su granja, se ha mantenido trabajando sin problema alguno, ella y su esposo se encuentran bien de salud.
texts.en:
Ana decided on another loan because she needs capital to strengthen her business. She will invest the loan in chickens to be fattened, and concentrated chicken feed to nourish them. This will help her expand poultry operation (which includes chickens for fattening and Indian hens). 

The last loan helped Ana to improve the infrastructure on her farm, which she has been able to maintain without any problems. 

She and her husband are also in good health.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Vanessa Claire

texts.en: Vanessa Claire starts her new business providing food for the village in her cafeteria while her husband works overseas. She has two children still in elementary school. She was encouraged to improve her cafeteria for she will gain better income from this. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy raw ingredients and pots used for the cafeteria. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients and pots used for the cafeteria.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny y sus hermanos siempre trabajaron para ayudar a sus padres, comenta que sus metas futuras son el poder llegar a culminar sus estudios y poder ser alguien independiente, no depender de nadie, ser una profesional, tener un cargo o un trabajo digno en la sociedad.
De aquí a cierto tiempo se ve como una persona realizada como profesional, y como mamá porque tiene una hija de tres años por quien luchar día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y de esa forma seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jenny and her siblings have always worked hard to help their parents.  She says that her future goals are to complete her education and be able to become independent, not have to depend on anyone, become a professional, and have a dignified job.

She sees herself as a future professional and as a mother because she has a three year old daughter whom she works hard for every day.

She is asking for this loan to pay her bills so she can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene tres hermanos, dos de ellos son menores, él es el segundo en estudiar una carrera universitaria en su familia, recibe el apoyo de sus padres que tienen un negocio familiar el cual le dieron para atender y administrar. Su padre es peluquero y logro lo que tiene con el fruto de su esfuerzo, Juan valora eso y quiere terminar su carrera de Ciencias Contables para ejercer su profesión y hacer crecer el negocio de sus padres. Le falta poco para terminar la universidad y pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas de manera anticipada para poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Juan has three siblings, two of them are minors.  He will be the second one in the family to graduate from university.  He gets help from his parents who have a family business that they gave him to tend and manage.  His father is a barber and has what he has because of her efforts and growing his parents’ business.  He needs to complete his university studies and is asking for this loan to pay his bills so he can continue his education.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Maate

texts.en:
Maate is 36 years old and has a wife with eight children. His major work is driving a vehicle along side the cocoa business, where he has received extra income for the past 14 years. He serves the community around him with a target of earning more income to ensure that his children are educated and have a good standard of living. He major challenges are competition from other producers and the high fuel prices. His future plan is to buy a new car and build a main house.

Maate intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children and buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell and pay fees for the children.

loans.name: Crice

texts.en:
Crice, a 35 year-old married man with two children, lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. His main business is buying and selling products like maize, beans and nuts, a business he has been operating for ten years. He started this business because small scale farmers in his area were willing sell to him their products after the failure of producer cooperative societies when they could not access better markets.  He gets additional income from goat rearing and brewing waragi, a local brew.  He is faced with a problem of transporting his product to the market and hopes to build a permanent house for his family with profits from his business.

He is requesting for a loan to buy more products like maize and beans to resell

loans.use: to buy more product like maize and beans to resell.

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José tiene 24 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Soltera, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Su meta próxima es realizar un diplomado en Odontología y luego optar por una especialidad en periodoncia. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales e instrumentos necesarios para realizar sus prácticas profesionales. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá comprar los instrumentos necesarios para realizar sus prácticas. Su plan futuro es terminar con éxito su carrera.
texts.en: Maria José is 24-years old.  She is a native of Managua.  She is single and goes to one of the city universities.  Her goal is to get a diploma in Dentistry and later do a specialty in Periodontics.  She is requesting the loan to purchase the materials and instruments she will need to do her professional internship.  Maria José thinks that the loan will be a great help to her as it will allow her to purchase the instruments she needs to do her internship.  Her plan for the future is to successfully complete her degree.

loans.use: to purchase the materials and instruments she needs to do her professional internship.

loans.name: Quiere Al Niño Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Quiere Al Niño” y está conformado por 07 socios solidarios. Noemí de 43 años de edad es separada con 01 hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica  a la confección de prendas de vestir hace más de 06 años, lo cual le va muy bien siendo sus principales clientes el mercado mayorista de gamarra. Tiene como meta comprar su propio local en lugar comercial, ya que actualmente lo realiza en su casa. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de hilos, tela y botones. El grupo “Quiere Al Niño” Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Noemí es la tercera del lado izquierdo y viste polo blanco.
texts.en: This is the “Quiere Al Niño” group, made up of seven united members.  Noemi is 43 years old and is expecting a child.  She has been making clothing for six years and things are going very well for her, her main customers being the main garment market.  Her goal is to buy her own shop because she currently works out of her home.  She is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, and buttons.  The “Quiere Al Niño” group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.  Noemil is the third from the left, wearing a white polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Antolina

texts.en:
This sweet and tender hearted woman is named Antolina. She and her husband live in Isabela region wherein the main source of income is from agricultural work. She wants to become an independent and self-assured woman. She is starting her own business in animal husbandry. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets for her business. This new business will give her family an additional income. She is hoping to obtain her requested loan to start her new business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets for her business

loans.name: Necy

texts.en: Necy is married with two children and operates their own farm while her husband works as a construction worker to earn a living. For five years in farming she has helped to support her husband’s income for the family. She has improved her farm successfully. Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, Necy wants  to improve their income to make a better future for the family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is a 35-year old farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children ages 7-14. Rosie barely earns 3000 PHP from her farming business. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, pay for labor and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting her yield and income. In the future Rosie dreams of expanding her farm so that it will generate more revenue. Her children's education is still her priority.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for labor and pesticides

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a responsible mother of four adult-aged children. She is now 62 years old and happily living with family in the village of Guam. To make a living, she is engaged in the retailing business, particularly a general store. She has been in this business for three years. Cecilia wants to improve her business, but she lacks the necessary capital. With regards,to this matter, she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, curls, biscuits, beverages and condiments to sell. She hopes that she can obtain her desired loan to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, curls, biscuits, beverages and condiments to sell

loans.name: Robert's Group

texts.en:
Robert's Elwanda Group is a group of six lead farmers in the Kakamega North District, with Robert selected as the Kiva representative. Robert has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative, and he is on the right of the photo, with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 55 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant a ¼ acre of maize and a ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but they will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan Shillings. 

Robert is a reliable member of the community, and joined One Acre Fund because he needed better harvests. He is 38 years old and married with seven children. He has been working as a farmer for the last 12 years to support his family. In addition to this, Robert is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group and savings group. He described his harvest last year as being good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and enjoying the success he is having with its farm packages. 

Robert joined One Acre Fund in 2012 to get the best seed prices and new farming methods, and he is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. He is an active community member, and wants to help more farmers, so he has gotten more involved as a group leader and as a Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Robert's life because he has more farm training and he was able to save money and feed his family. In the future, Robert hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and to buy a cow. 

Robert and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers, through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make repayments. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to obtain hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Retche

texts.en: Retche managed a general store for five years and she earns well to support her husband’s income. She has sustained it and has plans to expand it. She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional grocery goods to sell.  In the future she wants to improve the business as well as the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Brisas De Apoyo Group

texts.es: Mirna es una mujer emprendedora, empresaria, tiene la edad de 38 años, es acompañada. Es miembro del grupo solidario que está compuesta por tres socias incluida ella, desde hace 17 años se dedica a vender frutas y verduras de manera ambulante, anteriormente comercializaba cosméticos de la Avon, Zermat y poco con las ganancias fue adquiriendo las verduras y las frutas que le generaban más utilidades, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras como yuca, chayote, ayote, tomate, cebolla, chiltoma, quequisque, frutas como papaya, melones, tamarindo, granadilla, guayaba para frescos, etc. Juana tiene 40 años y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras y Marbellí tiene 42 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de especies.
texts.en: Mirna is an enterprising and entrepreneurial woman.  She is 38-years old and married.  She is a member of a communal bank made up of three woman, including herself.  For the last 17 years, Mirna has made her living as a street vendor selling fruits and vegetables.  She previously sold Avon and Zermat cosmetics.  Little by little, with her earnings, Mirna acquired fruits and vegetables to sell, as that generated a better profit.  This loan will be invested in the purchase of vegetables, such as yucca, chayote, pumpkin, tomatoes, onions, peppers, and taro and fruits like papaya, melons, tamarind, passion fruits and guava for fruit drinks etc.  Juana is 40-years old, and her business is selling fruits and vegetables.  Marbellí is 42-years old, and her business is selling spices.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of vegetables, like yucca, chayote, pumpkin, tomatoes, onions, peppers and taro and fruits like papayas, melons, tamarind, passion fruit and guavas for fruit drinks etc.

loans.name: Dulce San Juan Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado por cuatro mujeres emprendedoras exitosas, una de ellas es Jeymy mujer de 27 años de edad, casada, con 10 años de experiencias en la compra y venta de cosechas de temporada y las comercializa en el mercado más populoso de la capital, ella misma atiende su negocio, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de frutas como naranja, tamarindo, sandias, jocotes, mangos etc. Reyna es una mujer que tiene 22 años de edad y su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas, Carla tiene 32 años y su negocio es el destace de cerdo y María tiene 53 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en: This group is made up of four successful enterprising women.  Jeymy is 27 years old, married, and has 10 years’ experience buying and selling seasonal harvests in the most popular market in the capital city.  She tends the business herself and will invest the money in fruits such as oranges, tamarinds, watermelons, plums, mangos, etc.  Reyna is 22 and buys and sells harvests.  Carla is 32 years old and sells pork.  Maria is 53 and sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 35 years old from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 3-12. She has farmed rice for a living for the last three years. Rubilyn is asking for a loan to buy pesticide, fertilizer and insecticides in order to maintain her farm. She is hoping that she can further support her business, while also meeting the needs of her household for food and school fees for her children.

In the future, Rubilyn hopes to have a bigger farm for a better income.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Matayo

texts.en:
Matayo is a thirty six-year-old married man with two children who owns a produce store in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in this business for 4 years and has gone ahead to pack maize flour that he supplies to schools and people near his area of operation. His hardship is that the business is seasonal, given the fact that farmers depend on rainfall for production. His vision is to become a market leader of produce plus owning a modern food store that will meet the demands of the increasing population. 

Matayo needs the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en: Rocela has been selling their farm products, like copra, in town, to assist her husband's income from driving. Her children were going to study in their elementary grades and she had to earn money for their needs. She received a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. She wants to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family. Rocela hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en: Scovia is 28 years old and married with four children, and her major business is cocoa production. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Her business is four years old and she is working hard to improve her economic status amidst obstacles like seasonal changes and competition. This is the major business in the area, hence she earns limited profits. She wants to expand her business in the future and diversify her business to also trade produce. Scovia has requested a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando vive en una casa de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es docente de policia. Rolando necesita el crédito para incrementar el monto de un anticretico (una modalidad de alquiler) y de esta manera vivir mas comodamente ya que actualmene solo ucupa un cuarto.
El sueño de Rolando es poder tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Rolando lives in a brick house with a cement floor in the city of La Paz. He trains police officers for a living.

Rolando needs the loan to increase the amount of the "anticredito" he is paying (a Bolivian method of rental, whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract) and in this way live more comfortably, as he is currently living in just one room.

Rolando's dream is to one day have his own house.

loans.use: to pay rent

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a member of this group in the Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of nine One Acre Fund lead farmers. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left. These group leaders represent a total of 83 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. John has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving a ¼ acre of maize and a ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan Shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. 

John is married and has nine children. He is 57 years old and is known as a friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group and burial committee. John has been a farmer for 30 years. John described his harvest as excellent last year but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. John first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. John joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, try new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and to send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. John plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for its farmers. John’s own life was improved because he has more profits from his harvest, more farm training, more farm group support, and he has been able to feed his family. 

John and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers with the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make repayments. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to access hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
Natalia tiene 20 años es soltera y pertenece al grupo Virgen de Guadalupe. Recientemente ha terminado su carrera de topografía, se encuentra muy contenta porque ahora viene desempeñándose en lo que le gusta, ella dedica 7 horas diarias a trabajar como topógrafa en una empresa privada. Ella comenta que pertenecer al grupo le ha ayudado a aprender sobre el emprendimiento y en un futuro piensa comenzar un negocio propio. Por ahora ha solicitado el préstamo para comprar un teodolito que es una herramienta de medición muy importante en su carrera. Ella agradece a las personas que la ayudan a poder lograr sus metas, y no solo las de ellas sino las de cada integrante del grupo.
En la fotografía ella se encuentra con un polo morado y una cartera negra.
texts.en:
Natalia is 20 years old, single, and is a member of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” group.  She recently finished her topography degree and she is very happy because now she works at what she enjoys doing.  She works seven hours each day as a surveyor for a private company and says that being a member of the group has helped her learn to about entrepreneurship and she plans to start her own business in the future.  For now she is asking for a loan to buy a theodolite, which is a very important tool for her work.  She is grateful to those who have helped her reach her goals and those of the other members of the group.

She is wearing a purple pull over and carrying a black purse.

loans.use: to buy a theodolite.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en: Rodelyn is married with three children and helps her husband manage their own banana farm for a living.  She has been harvesting and selling bananas for five years and she earns well to support their needs. To improve the farm she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer and weeding maintenance costs.  She hopes that someday she can provide her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and weeding maintenance cost

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 23 years old and married with two children ages 2 and 3. She operates a Sari-sari (general) store for a living for the past seven months. Tessie is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise to sell like toothpaste, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, shampoo, chips and amakan (woven bamboo) for house repair.  

She hope that she can eventually increase her capital so she can make her store bigger. Her children's education is her priority.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, shampoo, chips and amakan (woven bamboo) for resale

loans.name: Fulazia

texts.en:
Fulazia is a twenty nine year old female, married with five children and living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a cocoa garden which helps her get cocoa for selling to improve on her standard of living. She is so hard working that she desires to provide her family with basic needs, especially education, only to be affected by seasonality changes and thieves who steal her cocoa.

Fulazia is requesting a loan to buy more cocoa and food stuff like rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa and food stuff like rice to sell.

loans.name: Pingdwend Group

texts.fr:
KOTIME  est responsable du groupe PINGDWEND. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 01an07mois. 01 va à l’école. 
Mme vend des habits et pagnes depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les  femmes  et hommes.
Mme veut s’acheter 06complets pagnes batik et 10douzaines d’habits.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et mieux entretenir  sa famille.
texts.en:
Kotime is the representative of the PINGDWEND group.   She is doing well.  She is married and the mother of three children.  Her oldest child is 10 years old and her youngest is 19 months old.  One of her children goes to school.

Kotime has been selling clothes and "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) for two years.  She buys her merchandise at her district's market and resells to both men and women.  She wants to buy six pieces of "batik" fabrics (each piece measuring 1 x 3 meters) and ten dozen clothing items.  She plans to reinvest her profits into her activity.  Her ambition is to expand her business and to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy six pieces of "batik" fabric and 10 dozen clothing items.

loans.name: Los Robles Group

texts.es: Este grupo  está formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Gloria mujer de 29 años, sotera con un hijo, desde muy joven tenía un pequeño taller de costura en su domicilio y actualmente vende pinolillo, tistes, en un mercado de la capital desde hace 5 años, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 4 años. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como maíz, cacao, clavo de olor, bolsas, leña, molida etc. Ana tiene 39 años de edad su negocio es la venta de frutas, Gloria tiene 41 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de especies y Epifania su negocio es la venta de artesanía.
texts.en: This group is made up of four enterprising ladies.  Gloria is 29 years old and has a son.  She has had a small sewing workshop since she was very young and currently sells pinolillo and tistes in the capital city market.  She’s done this for four years.  She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as dried corn, cacao, cloves, bags, firewood, grounds, etc.  Ana is 39 years old and sells fruit.  Gloria is 41 years old and sells spices.  Epifania sells arts and crafts.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 28 year old man with six children and a wife. He is a cocoa farmer in Bundibugyo-Uganda, who works hard in the garden to increase his capital by selling cocoa to Esco Uganda. Moses is greatly affected by seasonality and competition from other cocoa sellers, yet his dream is to become a leading cocoa supplier to the leading agent in his area.
Moses has asked for a loan to buy cocoa to resell and maintain the cocoa farm..

loans.use: to buy cocoa to resell and maintain the cocoa farm.

loans.name: Charles' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 9 group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Charles selected as the Kiva representative.  Charles has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is pictured on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 9 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Charles is a reliable member of the community.  He is married and has 8 children.  Charles is 60 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 23 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Charles is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group and savings group.  He described his harvest last year as excellent. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages. 

Charles joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and earn enough to feed his family.  Charles also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers.  Charles is also involved in the community's peace coordination.  Charles plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business.  His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from the harvest, was able to save money and feed the family. 

Charles and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 36 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase fertilzer and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming rice for 18 years and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq  femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 43ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Kalaban Coro dans le district de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié,  de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kalaban Coro.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons, échalote…), pagnes wax,  encens et charbon du bois. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des oignons. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une tonne d’oignon au marché en gros. La revente se fait  au comptant et à crédit à Sabalibougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The majority of the five women who make up the Danaya group are married in polygamous families.  On average, they are 43 years old, and have five children each.  They all live in the Kalaban Coro neighborhood of the district of Bamako.  They are friends, relatives or neighbors, and also know one another through their income-generating activities at the Kalaban Coro market.  They are involved in small retail and sell condiments (onions, shallots...), wax-print "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics), incense and charcoal.  In order to have enough cash to buy fresh supplies of goods, the members of the group have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their third solidarity loan.

Mariam, the featured borrower, is a well-known onion seller.  In the photo, she is seated in the middle of the front row.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 1,000 kilos of onions, in bulk, at the market.  She resells her merchandise for cash or on credit in Sabalibougou, and she also works as an itinerant seller.  Most of her customers are women.  Thanks to this loan, she is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business and also used to take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy onions.

loans.name: Norma Evelin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Norma de 44 años de edad,   no logro estudiar mucho solo  logro estudiar hasta tercer grado en la escuela, actualmente la señora Norma esta acompañada  quien esta postrado en una cama debido a una fuerte enfermedad en sus piernas, la señora dentro de su hogar tiene tres hijos, dos de los cuales ya están casados y no viven con ella solo tiene a su hija menor quien esta estudiando su primer año de bachillerato .


La Señora Norma tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años, que fue cuando su pareja sufrió la terrible enfermedad, entonces decidió poner la venta de tortillas.  Anteriormente ya había tenido experiencia en esta actividad con su madre quien fue vendedora de tortillas, ella tiene la venta de tortillas en su casa , todas las tardes su hija menor le ayuda a vender tortillas o a dejar encargos de tortillas a las casas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar una plancha industrial para mejorar su negocio, ya que ella a estado haciendo sus tortillas en comal de barro, la cual le servirá de mucho porque podrá vender mas tortillas en menos tiempo y también podrá pagar el tratamiento de su pareja  para que se mejore.

El sueño de la señora Norma, es que su pareja pueda recuperarse y así poder trabajar juntos, ella vendiendo tortillas y él con su antiguo empleo de estructuras metálicas, pero también tiene otro gran sueño que su hija pueda graduarse del bachillerato y siga estudiando en la universidad para que se gradué de enfermera y sabe que lo lograra con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Norma, at 44 years old, did not manage to study very much, only until third grade. Currently Señora Norma is with her spouse who is weak and in bed due to a strong illness in his legs. Norma has three children in her home, two of which are already married and do not live with her. She only has her youngest daughter who is studying in her first year of high school. 

As of 8 years ago Señora Norma has had a business selling tortillas, which was when her spouse suffered the terrible illness. She then decided to get into selling tortillas. Previously she had already had experience in this sector with her mother who was a tortilla seller. She holds the tortilla sales in her house and every afternoon her youngest daughter assists her to either sell the tortillas or to drop off orders of tortillas at others' houses. 

The loan she is requesting to CREDICAMPO is to purchase an industrial griddle to improve her business, since she has been making her tortillas on a clay griddle. This will help her immensely because she will be able to sell more tortillas in less time and also will be able to pay for the treatment of her spouse so that he gets better. 

Señora Norma's dream is that her spouse is able to recuperate and therefore they can work together, her selling tortillas and him with his old job of metallic structures. However she also has another big dream that her daughter can graduate from high school and continue studying in university so that she graduates as a nurse. She knows that she will accomplish this with the help of her loan.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial griddle to improve her business of selling tortillas.

loans.name: Philip's Group

texts.en:
Philip, a member of Bidii Group in the Kakamega North District, is pictured here in a group of eight One Acre Fund lead farmers who represent a total of 79 individual One Acre Fund farmers. Philip has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is shown standing on the right in the photo with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving a ¼ acre of maize and a ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. 

Philip, who works to provide for his three children, is 40 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years. The community and other farmers know Philip as friendly, hardworking, reliable and trustworthy. He is also involved in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group and the prayer group. Philip described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group. 

Philip first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, and get fertilizer and hybrid seeds so as to earn enough to feed his family.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Philip plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for its farmers.  Philip’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, more farm training, more farm group support, and has been able to feed his family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto farmers. Philip and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seed and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund provides ongoing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is shown standing on the left.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Eddie

texts.en: Eddie is aged 25, married and blessed with three children. He has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost five years, and earns a net income of PHP 200 a day. His daily net profits are usually spent on their daily expenditures and saved for future emergencies. He would like to avail himself of a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 due to a lack of capital to use in his business. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted immediately so that his business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar, salt, sugar, coffee and beverages.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa de Jesús gracias a su primer financiamiento pudo comprar los insumos necesarios para poder asistir la siembra de la semilla de papa certificada de primera calidad que compro con la cual unos meses después obtuvo excelentes ganancias logrando sacar una buena cantidad de papa la cual vendió en el mercado local y con algunos intermediarios que llegaron a la zona. El apoyo económico que fue brindado por los inversionistas en la plataforma de KIVA en alianza con la cooperativa COMIXMUL dio esperanza a ella principalmente y a su familia para poder dar uso a la tierra que estaba inculta sintiéndose agradecida por la confianza depositada en ella como pequeña productora ya que anteriormente otras instituciones financieras no daban facilidad para poder acceder al financiamiento solicitado. Doña Teresa de Jesús nuevamente solicita financiamiento para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que ayuden a fortalecer sus cultivos de papa y poder obtener nuevamente una excelente cosecha en estas próximas temporadas ya que con las ganancias obtenidas anteriormente pudo comprar semilla de papa de primera calidad para cultivar pero quedo insuficiente el efectivo para comprar insumos por lo que espera nuevamente ser apoyada.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa de Jesús, thanks to her first financing, could buy the consumables necessary to be able to assist the sowing of certified highest quality potato seeds that she bought, and with which she obtained excellent profit some months later, accomplishing to harvest a large amount of potatoes. These she sold in the local market and with some intermediaries who arrived in the area. The economic support which was given by the investors in the KIVA platform in alliance with the cooperative COMIXMUL gave her and her family hope to be able to use the land that was uncultivated. 

She is feeling grateful for the trust placed in her as a small producer, as previously other financial institutions did not make it easy to be able to access the funds requested. Doña Teresa de Jesús again requests funding to be able to purchase farming consumable goods that help to strengthen her potato crops. She also hopes to again be able to obtain an excellent harvest in the next seasons, as with the previously obtained profit she could buy potato seeds of the highest quality to harvest, but she was left with insufficient funds to buy goods, and so she hopes to be supported again.

loans.use: with the purchase of agricultural consumable goods to maintain to her potato crops

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают сына. У Назиры - высшее образование, работает учительницей в средней школе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Назира занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь. Имеет все условия для содержания скота Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение мероприятия -годовщина смерти свекрови.
texts.en:
Nazira is 32 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising a son.  Nazira has a higher education and works as a teacher in a middle school.  As a source of additional income for her family, Nazira runs an animal husbandry business that she started 9 years ago with the purchase of 8,000 som (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Nazira has three milk cows and one horse.  She has everything necessary to keep cattle.  Her monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).  

With an aim to further developing her business, Nazira applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy cows in order to increase the size of her herd.  Nazira plans to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the size of her her and to save money for the traditional feast on the one-year anniversary of her mother-in-law's death.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Otinkorang Group

texts.en:
The group “Otinkorang” began its seventh cycle with ID Ghana. It is comprised of five members who are involved in the sale of fruit drinks, noodles, groceries, dippers, phone credit cards, bread, eggs and cosmetics. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners, one of whom, Cecilia, is a member. Cecilia has been selling tea and bread, noodles and phone credit cards for nine years. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children who are all in school.

The loan she will now take is to increase her capital (wholesale bread, noodles, phone credit cards, Milo (malted milk), sugar, etc.) that she will acquire at fairs in the city of Accra. Then she will sell it at her place of business. This kind of job allows her to make an income to maintain her home as much as possible. 

When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, she responded that she likes the health insurance subsidy program and the training program offered to clients by the institution.

loans.use: to increase her capital (wholesale bread, noodles, phone credit cards, Milo (malted milk), sugar, etc.) that she will acquire at fairs in the city of Accra.

loans.name: Aura Yaneth

texts.es:
Aura Yaneth ella trabaja en el área de servicios generales en el hospital santa clara, devenga un salario mínimo, vive con los dos hijos y los gastos son un arriendo, alimentación, servicios públicos, gastos personales y tratamiento del hijo mayor ya que tiene una enfermedad de mucho cuidado.

Estudia auxiliar de enfermería segundo semestre en campo alto, necesita el convenio kiva ya que es una mujer cabeza de hogar que como todas tiene sueños que cumplir y necesidades que nunca faltan, ya que como menciono antes los gastos que tiene que pagar son bastante y con la ayuda que le pueden dar en el pago de la cuota del semestre seria un beneficio grande para ella.
texts.en:
Aura Yaneth works in the general services are in the Santa Clara Hospital. She earns minimum wage and lives with her two children. Her costs are rent, food, public services, personal costs and treatment for her oldest son as he has a disease to be cared for. 

She is studying in her second semester at Campo Alto as an infirmary assistant and needs the Kiva agreement as she is a woman head of household, who like all others has dreams to accomplish and needs that are never lacking. As mentioned before, the costs that she has to pay are great and the support that they can give her with the payment of the bill for the semester would be a huge blessing for her.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of her enrollment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of beans, native rice and pepper for resale

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BADEGNA est constitué de  6 femmes (dont 4 mariées et 2 veuves) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  FARABA de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 11ème prêt. Les 10 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de DJENEBA qui est la 1ère femme assise dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, diverses qualités de condiments avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et  à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The 'Badegna' Group is made up of six women (four are married and two are widowed) who are, on average, forty-three years old and have four children.  They all live in traditional extended families in the Faraba district of the town of Bougouni.  They are connected through business, friendship and neighbourhood ties.

In order to improve their financial capabilities and reinforce their businesses, the group works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso, this will be their eleventh loan with the organisation.  The previous ten loans were all correctly repaid.

All the women work selling food ingredients.  Djeneba (sitting on the far left of the photo) will use her loan to buy various food ingredients from wholesalers in Bougouni.  She then sells her products at the market and through doorstep sales, for cash or on credit, to a range of different customers.

Djeneba expects to earn a monthly average of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be invested in her business and used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Niokhor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Niokhor, âgé de la cinquantaine, évolue dans le secteur de l’élevage et cela depuis plus de 10 ans. Il a démarré avec un bœuf qu’on lui avait vendu à crédit et qu’il a payé après avoir revendu sur le marché. Depuis qu’il connait IMCEC, il a arrêté cette pratique pour prendre des crédits, acheter des bœufs et pouvoir rembourser tranquillement sans contrainte.
En dehors de l’élevage, Niokhor s’active aussi dans le maraichage ; le prêt lui servira à acheter 2 bœufs de cent mille chacun et le reste, des semences d’oignon et de l’engrais.
Ces deux activités lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins quotidiens de sa famille (nourriture, eau, électricité).Pour faire face aux imprévus de la vie, il épargne une somme après chaque opération de vente soit de bétail, soit de produits maraichers.
Niokhor rêve de développer un grand projet de cultures maraichères dans le village où il habite.
texts.en:
Niokhor is in his fifties and has worked raising livestock for more than ten years.  He started his business with a beef cow which he bought on credit.  He repaid the credit once he had sold the animal at the market.  Since he began working with the field partner, UIMCEC, he no longer works in this way, instead he uses their loan system and is able to more easily repay the money.

As well as raising livestock, Niokhor also grows vegetables.  He will use his loan to buy two beef cattle for 100,000 francs CFA each, and the rest will be used to buy onion seeds and fertilizer.

His two businesses allow him to provide for the day-to-day needs of his family (food, water and electricity).  He regularly saves some of his earnings to help him cope with unexpected expenses.

Niokhor dreams of becoming an important vegetable farmer in his village.

loans.use: to buy 2 beef cows for fattening up, and onion seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Ndigue

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndigue habite dans un village situé dans la zone appelé « Petite Côte » où l’agriculture est l’activité principale des populations. Possédant un champ où il reste toute la matinée entre 6h et 14h, Ndigue sollicite un crédit afin d’acheter des semences d’oignons et pouvoir exploiter la terre. Puisque qu’il lui reste de l’espace, il en profite pour emboucher occasionnellement un bœuf, qui vendu, lui rapporte un revenu supplémentaire. A partir des bénéfices acquis, il s’occupe des charges familiales. 
Ndigue désire acheter une parcelle, la mettre en valeur et y loger sa famille. Il a aussi des projets en tête concernant l’embouche qu’il veut développer à grande échelle.
texts.en:
Ndigue lives in the 'Petite Côte' area, where agriculture is the primary occupation of the people.  He owns a field where he works from six in the morning until two in the afternoon.  He has requested this loan in order to buy onion seeds to grow on his land.

In addition to growing onions, Ndigue has some spare land so he raises beef cattle for occasional sale, to supplement his income.

Ndigue uses his earnings to provide for the needs of his family.  In the future, he would like to buy a plot of land, work to improve it, and then live on it with his family.  He also has plans to develop the livestock side of his business.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle for fattening up for resale.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses is a member of this group in Kakamega North District. He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo. The group leaders represent a total of 72 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Moses has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative, and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

Moses is 37 years old and has been a farmer for 18 years. He works as a farmer to provide for his five children. The community and other farmers know Moses as a hardworking and experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in the community in groups such as the men's group and the savings group. Moses described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Moses first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Moses joined One Acre Fund to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods and earn enough to feed the family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers. Moses plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to buy a cow. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Moses’s own life was improved because he has more farm training and was able to save money and feed the family.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Moses and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Saliou

texts.fr:
Saliou est un jeune de 38 ans qui vient tout juste de démarrer dans l’embouche. Il s’activait dans le petit commerce de divers pendant deux ans. Voyant que le bénéfice était minime et que le fond n’était pas consistant, il a préféré se tourner vers IMCEC pour pouvoir bénéficier d’un crédit et acheter 3 à 4 bœufs, les emboucher et les revendre à des particuliers ou dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Saliou est célibataire et habite avec ses parents. Il donne sa participation pour la dépense quotidienne et veille aux conditions alimentaires.
Saliou veut développer son activité et avoir un grand troupeau de bœufs mais aussi améliorer son commerce et devenir grossiste un jour.
texts.en:
Saliou is a young man who has just started raising livestock.  He is thirty-eight years old, single and lives with his parents.  

For two years Saliou was a small trader, buying and selling various products.  Then he realised that he could only earn a small amount with this type of business, so he began working with the field partner, UIMCEC.  He has requested this loan in order to buy three or four cattle, fatten them up and then sell them to individual customers or at the weekly market.

Saliou contributes to the running of his parents' household, and helps to maintain an adequate standard of food for them. 

In the future, Saliou would like to develop his business and have a large herd of cattle.  He would also like to diversify one day, and become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy 3 or 4 beef cattle for fattening up for resale.

loans.name: Maulana

texts.en:
Maulana runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. Maulana lives in Lebak, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Maulana is single.

Maulana began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He felt really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months, he has around $20 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). Recently, he took a loan from Kiva to buy a printer to support his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: To purchase a printer

loans.name: Lama

texts.en: Lama is a 22-year-old Lebanese single woman. She works in her own business selling clothes. Her business was launched in 2011. Her shop is located in a busy area and she sells different types and styles of clothes designed for women. As we can see, Lama is still very young and as she states, she definitely needs to get financial support as soon as possible. That’s why she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She declares that with the funds, she will increase her store’s inventory and diversify her merchandise selection to attract the maximum number of customers and earn a higher income to be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Chenda is from the community of Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham. She is 29 years old, married, and has two young children in the 1 – 5 age range. Chenda is engaged in farming rice and retailing mixed grocery products, which earns her a daily income of KHR 30,000 per day. She has been doing farming for years and retailing for two years.

Chenda has the challenge of limited income. She hopes the loan will help her to purchase gasoline and seeds for farming work in order to have her plantation grow, which will increase her productivity and output and, therefore, increase her income. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and seeds for farming work.

loans.name: Porphirius

texts.en: Porphirius is a businessman in Katanga- Kirembe- Ruhinda in the Mitooma District. He is a goat trader, a business he started in 2004 with the hope of getting a clear source of income. He is a father of seven children between 19 and 7 years old and he hopes to use the profits from the business to give his children a better quality education. He has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy more goats to sell so he can make enough profits, grow his business and become financially stable. His clients are mainly goat traders in his area of operation and they support him so he never lacks a market for his goats. He is challenged by the stiff competition in the area he operates since there are many goat trades. However, he believes that it will not be a challenge any more if the loan is given since he will use the money to buy better looking goats and will have enough stock and be in a position to out compete his competitors. He is generally a hard working man and he hopes to work even harder so the loan money can be paid back with some profits remaining to use to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Penda's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de femmes qui habitent le même quartier; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce. Astou l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle est debout à gauche sur la photo et a levé la main droite. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits alimentaire et capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 03 ans. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter du pain de singe, 01 sac de sucre à 23000F l'un , des  fleurs d'oseilles séchés, du tamarin, du gingembre pour la transformation en jus, en crème glacé. Avec ses bénéfices elle va renforcé son épargné au niveau du Banc Villageois, acheter des habits et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is made up of women who live in the same area and whose primary activity is retail. Astou, the featured borrower, is the group leader. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is standing on the left of the photo and raising her right hand. She sells food products and benefits from a good experience of over 3 years. She plans to use her loan to buy baobab fruit, one bag of sugar (for 23 000 francs), dried sorrel flowers, tamarind and ginger with which to make juice and ice cream. She will use her profits to strengthen her savings in the "banc villageois," to buy clothes and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de femmes qui habitent le même quartier; elles ont comme principale activité le commerce. Anta l'emprunteur en vedette est la responsable du groupe, elle est âgée de 57 ans, veuve et mère de six enfants. Elle est debout à gauche sur la photo et a levé la main droite. Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de diverses marchandises et capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 8 ans. Avec son prêt elle compte acheter des sacs, des bijoux, des greffages. Avec ses bénéfices elle épargne au niveau du Banc Villageois, gère sa famille, assure la scolarité et la santé de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is made up of women who live in the same district and whose main activity is retail. Anta, the featured borrower, is the group leader. She is 57 years old, widowed and the mother of 6 children. She is standing on the left of the picture and raising her right hand. She sells various products and benefits from a good experience of over 8 years. She plans to use her loan to buy bags, jewellery and hair weaves. She uses her profits to build her savings at the "banc villageois," to take care of her family and ensure that her children are healthy and get an education.

loans.use: to buy bags, jewellery and hair weaves.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr: le groupe a été crée le 14/05/2010 et est composé de 02 femmes issues du même quartier. Leurs activités sont: l’élevage le commerce. Fatou l'emprunteur vedette est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans, mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 05 filles avec 02 autres petits fils (une fille et un garçon. Elle fait de l'élevage de la volaille. Elle s'approvisionne a Dakar et revend dans son quartier. Elle a de la clientèle et donne en générale sa marchandise à crédit dans les hôpitaux aux personnels. Elle compte acheter 300 poussins à 600f l'unité de l'aliment, 15 sacs a 15500F, vaccin 10000F. Avec les bénéfices une partie sert à subvenir aux besoins de la maison et le reste aux besoins personnels.
texts.en: This group was created on the 14th of May, 2010, and is made up of two women who live in the same district. They are livestock breeders and retailers. Fatou, the featured borrower, is the group leader. She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 8 children, 5 of whom are girls. She also takes care of two of her grandchildren, a girl and a boy. She breeds poultry. She gets her supplies in Dakar and resells in her district. She mainly sells her merchandise on credit to hospital personnel. She plans to buy 300 chicks (600 francs each), 15 bags of feed (for 15 000 francs) and vaccines (for 10 000 francs). Part of her profits are used to take care of the household needs and the rest is used to take care of her personal needs.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Maty's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe a été crée le 14 Mai 2010 et regroupe des membres qui habitent le même quartier. Néné l'emprunteuse en vedette est divorcée est mère d'une fille, elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle s'active dans le commerce de tissus, d'habits et divers produits. Elle mène cette activité depuis plusieurs années. Elle compte acheter avec son prêt (50000) en grande quantité au marché des habits et tissus et revendre au détail dans son quartier. Les bénéfices vont être utiliser pour le paiement du loyer et la scolarisation de sa fille.
texts.en: This group was created on May 14th, 2010, and groups together members who live in the same area. Néné, the featured borrower, is divorced and the mother of a girl. She is 51 years old. She sells fabrics, clothing and various other products. She has been in business for several years. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of clothing and fabrics at the market to resell to retail customers in her district. The profits will be used to pay the rent and to cover her daughter's education expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing and fabrics.

loans.name: Mawounaesso

texts.fr:
Agée de 47 ans, la veuve Mawounaesso est mère de 7 enfants. Elle habite le quartier Agoè où elle a débuté en 1996 ses deux petits commerces de boisson locale TCHOUKOUTOU fabriquée à base du mil et de bois de chauffe. Sur conseil des médecins suite à une maladie elle cesse la vente de la boisson locale. 

Mawounaesso est une femme battante, raison pour laquelle elle lance son commerce de vente de charbon de bois en 2012 et l’associe à la vente des bois de chauffe afin de servir la population qui n’arrive pas à utiliser les foyers à gaz dans leur ménage.     

Elle s’approvisionne à Sotouboua dans la région centrale du Togo. 
Elle sollicite ce crédit, pour acheter 3 tas de bois de chauffe et 2 sacs de charbon de bois, ce qui lui permettrait de renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Mawounaesso is 47 years old, widowed and the mother of 7 children. She lives in the Agoè district where she started her 2 businesses selling the local drink "tchoukoutou", made using millet and firewood, in 1996. Following an illness and on the advice of the doctors, she stopped selling the local drink. She is a fighter and started her business selling charcoal in 2012. She also started selling firewood so that she could serve the members of the population who are unable to use gas burners in their households. She gets her supplies in Sotouboua, in the central region of Togo. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy 3 cords of firewood and 2 bags of charcoal, which will allow her to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of charcoal and 3 cords of firewood.

loans.name: Eyivi

texts.fr:
Mère de 4 enfants, Eyivi âgée de 41 ans est une veuve habitant le quartier d’Agoè. Depuis 2005 elle a débuté son petit commerce d’alimentation générale qu’elle étale sa boutique à domicile.
Apres avoir suivi la formation sur comment maximiser son gain chez ASSILASSIME, elle sollicite un crédit pour s’approvisionner en sucre et huile au grand marché de Lomé suite à la demande accrue de sa clientèle.
texts.en: The mother of 4 children, Evivi is 41 years old, a widow and lives in the district of Agoè. She started her business selling grocery products from her home in 2005. Having followed a training on how to maximize her profits at Assilassime, she is requesting a loan to get more supplies of sugar and oil at the Lomé Grand Market, due to increased demand from her customers.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar and some vegetable oil.

loans.name: Kolema

texts.fr:
La veuve Kolema est âgée 59 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Kolema est une femme dynamique qui cherche à mieux faire ; Elle habite Agoè un quartier de Lomé. Entre 2000 et 2003, elle était commerçante de boisson locale appelée communément TCHOUKOUTOU, ce qu’elle a abandonné après avoir été obligé de changer de lieu d’activité. 
Elle se lance alors dans la vente des produits d’alimentation générale. En 2012, après avoir suivi la formation d’ASSILASSIME sur comment découvrir son profil d’entrepreneur et qu’elle a mise en application, elle utilise la totalité des fonds destinée à l’alimentation générale pour financer la vente des habits. 
Satisfaite et motivée, elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son activité par l’achat de 45 serviettes 
39 draps et des jouets afin d'avoir plus de bénéfice.
texts.en: Kolema is a widow, 59 years old and the mother of 5 children. Kolema is a dynamic woman who is seeking to do better. She lives in Agoè, a district of Lomé. She sold the local drink, called "tchoukoutou", between 2002 and 2003, but was forced to give this up when she had to change the location where she did business. She then started selling basic food products. In 2012, having followed the Assilassime training in how to develop entrepreneurial skills, she put her training into action and used all of the funds she had for her food business to start a business selling clothes. Satisfied and motivated by the results, she is requesting this loan in order to strengthen her business by buying 45 towels, 39 bedsheets and some toys, so that she can earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy toys, 29 sheets and 45 towels.

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf is a twenty-two-year-old Lebanese single woman. She is living with her parents and two siblings. She is the only one supporting her parents financially by working at her house as a beautician for the past four years. She likes her occupation very much and serves her clients in a very friendly and personable way. Today, Afaf needs to renew her business tools. To do so, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She is an optimistic person and has great ambitions to improve and grow her business.

loans.use: to renew her business tools

loans.name: Belle Dame Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Belle Dame est composé uniquement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le  commerce de  vêtements, d’habits  et du dépôt de gaz. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Adiara (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 balles de pièces de tissus légers en gros au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail à  Djicoroni à une clientèle mixte. Madame Adiara espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
