Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The members of the Belle Dame group are exclusively monogamous. They have an average age of 32 and, on average, 2 children. They all live in Djicoroni and got to know each other thanks to neighbourly relationships. The group members sell clothing and gas. The group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso so that they could restock their inventories, and are on their 3rd group loan.

Adiara, the woman sitting in the middle of the picture, has a good reputation as a clothes seller. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 bales of pieces of light fabrics wholesale at the Grand Market.  She makes her sales in Djicoroni to a varied retail clientèle. Thanks to this loan, Adiara hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business. Her aim to buy a plot of land destined for habitation thanks to her relationship with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cassava and sweet potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Claribel

texts.es:
Rosa, vive en un mejor estilo de vida junto a su familia, ha podido cumplir con sus compromisos económicos, debido a la mejor rentabilidad que tiene en su negocio, pues el crédito anterior le ayudo a comprar la materia prima para la panadería con lo cual se ha mantenido trabajando.
En está ocasión solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de harina, levadura, sal, azúcar, manteca entre otros ingredientes para preparar el pan, con esta inversión espera cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, pues hoy cuenta con más clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is living a better lifestyle with her family and has been able to meet economic obligations thanks to the increased profit of her business.  Her previous loan helped her buy bakery ingredients for the bakery which kept her working.

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy flour, yeast, salt, sugar, shortening and other ingredients to make bread.  Through this investment she hopes to be able to meet customer demand, since she now has more customers.

loans.use: To buy flour, yeast, salt, sugar, shortening, etc.

loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a member of this group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo. The group leaders represent a total of fifty-seven individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Wycliffe has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 KES for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. 

Wycliffe is a reliable member of the community. He is married with eight children. Wycliffe is fifty-four years old and has been working as a farmer for the last forty-five years to support his family. In addition to this, Wycliffe is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, savings group, prayer group and the burial committee. He described his harvest last year as good. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and keep enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages. 

Wycliffe first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Wycliffe joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, who wants to help more farmers learn about One Acre Fund. Wycliffe plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future and buy a cow. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Wycliffe’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, more farm training and more farm group support, which enabled him to save money and feed the family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Wycliffe and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Las Tres Marias Group

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella forma parte del grupo “Las Tres Marías” y está constituido por 06 socias emprendedoras. María y su familia se dedican a la venta de comida como el ceviche y mariscos. Ella tiene proyectado tener su propio local e independizarse de su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pescado, papa,  cebolla y de esta manera preparar sus comidas para sus comensales. El grupo “Las Tres Marías” agradecen a los inversionistas Kiva por darles la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios. María se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste cafarena negro.
texts.en:
María, 34, is divorced and has two dependent children.  She is a member of the communal bank "Las Tres Marías" which is comprised of six women entrepreneurs.  María and her family sell food such as ceviche (a fish dish) and seafood.  She is planning to set up her own shop and become independent from the family.

She has requested a loan to buy fish, potatoes and onions to prepare food for her customers.  The members of the group are grateful to Kiva lenders for giving them the opportunity to grow their businesses.  María is seated, first from the left, in a black top.

loans.use: To buy fish, potatoes and onions to make her products.

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.en: Gulhumor was born in 1976 in a rural area. She is widowed with a son and a daughter. She is a careful mother of her children. Her daughter has grown up and is married. Her son works in Russia. Gulhumor has her own business. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than eighteen years. She feeds her cows and then sells milk and milk products to local people. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Las Mariposas De San Juan Group

texts.es: Grupo está formado por tres emprendedoras mujeres, una de ellas es Cristina tiene 33 años de edad, acompañada, madre de 4 hijos menores, su negocio es la venta de frutas las cuales las comercializa ambulante en los barrios de la capital, ella misma atiende su negocio y le paga a dos trabajadores también que venden en otros barrios de la capital, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de naranjas dulces, mandarina, zanahorias, plátano verde, plátano maduro, banano, cebolla, chiltoma, tomate, melón etc. Mayela tiene 28 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas y Luisa tiene 28 años y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three women entrepreneurs, one of whom is Cristina, 33.  She has a common-law husband and four minor children.  She works as a street vendor selling fruit in the neighborhoods of the capital city.  She attends to the business herself and has two employees who also sell in other neighborhoods of the city.  

She will use this loan to buy sweet oranges, tangerines, carrots, green bananas, ripe bananas, onions, peppers, tomatoes, melon, etc.  

Mayela, 28, has a fruit business and Luisa, 28, sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy sweet oranges, tangerines, carrots, green bananas, ripe bananas, onions, peppers, tomatoes, melon and other items.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive en casa de sus padres en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de chofer. Juan necesita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su herramienbta de trabajo (Vehiculo) y de esta madera mejorar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
El sueño de Juan es poder tener su casa propia y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his parents in a cement-floor, brick house in the city of La Paz.  He earns a living as a driver and needs a loan to provide maintenance for his work tool (his vehicle) so he can improve his income and quality of life.

Juan's goal is to have his own home and to see his children finish their education.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan, a sus 61 años de edad, es un padre soltero de una hija de 12 años, a la cual ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Hace algunos años inició su propio negocio de venta de frutas y jugos naturales, se ubica en una calle muy transitada por lo que sus ventas se mueven diariamente, generando ingresos para brindarle estudio y la alimentación de su hija, pues debe tenerla en un internado mientras él trabaja.
Con el crédito que solicita comprará surtido al por mayor (frutas, azúcar, desechables) y una carpa para el carro, pues la que posee está muy deteriorada, así podrá tener una mejor imagen y atraer nuevos clientes para deleitarlos con una comida saludable.
Juan manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y generar empleo, así tendrá la posibilidad de pasar más tiempo con su hija y disfrutar junto a ella una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan, 61, is a single father of a 12-year-old daughter who he has raised with much effort and sacrifice.  A few years ago he bought a fruit and natural juice business located on a busy street, so his sales volume fluctuates daily but provides him an income to educate and feed his daughter.  She attends boarding school while he works.

He plans to use the loan to buy wholesale supplies (fruit, sugar, disposable items) and an awning for his cart.  The one he has is worn out and he wants to project a better image to attract new customers and treat them to his healthy food.

Juan says his greatest goal is to expand his business and generate employement.  That will allow him to spend more time with his daughter and enjoy a better quality of life together.

loans.use: To buy wholesale supplies (fruit, sugar, disposable products) and an awning for his cart.

loans.name: Sabiiti

texts.en:
Sabiiti deals in the fish trade, through a business that he started in 1999 with the aim of earning a living. He is forty-six years of age and still strong enough to carry on with his business so that he can earn money to educate his five children, who are all in school. The fish business is his sole source of income. He hopes to use this loan of 1,500,000 UGX to buy fish nets so that he can catch better fish and in big quantities. This will improve his sales and hence the profits he earns from the business. 

Sabiiti operates the business from Kagera- kazinga in Katunguru of the Rubiriszi district. His clients are fish traders who buy the fish from him so that they can sell it in distant places. Competition is the major challenge he faces but he hopes to overcome it if he gets the loan from UGAFODE, since he will acquire new nets and catch more fish. He hopes to educate all his children using the profits so that they can have a competitive edge in the job market and, in the long run, be less of a dependence burden on his shoulders.

loans.use: To buy fish nets

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco y pertenece al banco comunal “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo carne, aceite, carbón y otras cosas mas. Agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Mateo lives in the beautiful city of Cuzco and he belongs to the “UNION, FUERZA Y AMISTAD” communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa. His main economic activity is selling  anticuchos as a street vendor. He has been working in this business for several years and it is going very well for him. At this time, he needs the loan to buy materials, for example, meat, oil, charcoal and more. He is grateful to the investors for the loan and committed to making his payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy materials such as meat, oil, charcoal and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Peace-Shallon Group

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs are members of a group called Peace-Shallon and are on their forth loan cycles. 

Elizabeth lives and works in the city of Accra-Teshie. Her main job is selling African wax-print fabrics and she has been doing this job for 18 years. She is 46 years old and married with children. Elizabeth is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who helps her family to get ahead. She needs the loan in order to purchase and supply different African wax-print fabrics. 

The other members have businesses selling secondhand clothing, soft drinks, sausage, gizzards, firewood, materials and school bags. The members are grateful to those who are part of this dream through the site and they are committed to making their repayments of the total loan request of GHS 3,500 on time.

loans.use: To purchase and supply different African wax-print fabrics.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente vive en compañia de sus hijos en la ciudad de la Paz. Se dedica a la compra y venta al por mayor de estevia, lejia y otros productos que  vende en La Paz  Oruro Santa Cruz y Cochabamba, solicita el crédito para poder pagar a los constructores a cargo de la refaccion de su vivienda.

El sueño de Vicente es mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vicente lives with his children in the city of La Paz. He buys and sells stevia, lye, and other products. He sells in La Paz, Oruro, Santa Cruz and Cochabamba. He is asking for the loan to pay the construction  workers who are repairing his home. 

Vicente's dream is to improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the construction workers who are repairing his home.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor vive en compañia de su esposa en la ciudad de la Paz. Es asalariado rentista pero también se dedica a vender material escolar, tiene un bazar en su propio domicilio, necesita credito para terminar con el pago de un terreno que ha comprado para que sus hijos en el futuro construyan una casa.

El sueño de Victor es que sus hijos tengan casa propia
texts.en:
Victor lives with his wife in the city of La Paz. He works as a rentier but also sells school materials - he has a shop in his own home. Victor needs this loan in order to finish paying for land that he has bought for his children. His children will build a house on this land.

Victor's dream is for his children to have their own house.

loans.use: to buy land to one day leave to his children

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angelica vive en compañia de sus hijos en la ciudad de la Paz. Es propietaria de una carpinteria, se dedica a conseguir contrato de obras para poner roperos empotrados y alacenas. Angelica quiere el credito para compra de madera que posteriormente se convertirá en roperos y alacenas.

El sueño de Angelica es dar estudios profesionales sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angelica lives with her children in the city of La Paz. She owns a carpentry workshop and makes a living looking for contracts to install built-in closets and cupboards. Angelic wants this loan in order to buy more wood, which she will use to make closets and cupboards.

Angelica's dream to give her children an education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es: Justo vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y pertenece al banco comunal “UNION FUERZA Y AMISTAD” de la Asociación Arariwa, él se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de granos secos como por ejemplo trigo, habas y entre otros y en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como granos secos como por ejemplo maíz, cebada, trigo, habas y otras.
texts.en: Justo lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, in the south of Peru. He is part of the "Unión Fuerza y Amistad" communal bank at the "Arariwa" organsation. Justo has a business buying and selling dry grains such as wheat, broad beans and more. In his spare time he works as a taxi driver. On this occasion Justo needs a loan in order to buy merchandise such as dry grains like corn, barley, wheat, broad beans and more.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as dry grains like corn, barley, wheat, beans and more.

loans.name: Freancisco

texts.es: Don francisco, de oficio guarda de seguridad, tiene la edad de 53 años, es  padre de familia, tiene a cargo  dos hijos por quienes vela por su bienestar principalmente la salud, su esposa siempre trabajando en un empacadora. Don Francisco requiere el crédito para  comprar materiales y continuar mejorando su vivienda con el apoyo de financiamiento, en esta ocasión desea terminar de construir el área de cocina y realizar dos cuartos, de esta manera brindar a su familia mejores condiciones vida.
texts.en: Francisco is 53 years old and works as a security guard. He is a father to two children and looks after their well-being and health. Francisco's wife works at a packing factory. Francisco needs this loan in order to buy materials and to continue making improvements to his home with financial support. On this occasion Francisco wants to finish building the kitchen and two bedrooms. He can then offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks and small stones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases different type of cosmetic items for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking seasoning and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Noroy

texts.en:
Noroy is 39 years old.  She is a hardworking woman from the rural area.  She is married and has 2 children.  One of them is an adult.  Her husband Abdukahor is a master at repairing houses.  

Noroy has been busy with animal husbandry.  She feeds cows.  Noroy has additional income from growing agricultural products such as potatoes and wheat.  She is the main source of income for her family.  Noroy’s son does have a job in Tajikistan.  He is going to go to Russia to find a job.  She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy an airline ticket for her son.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an airline ticket for her son to go to Russia to look for a job.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy vive sola en un departamento en la ciudad de la Paz. Es dependiente rentista y consultora, necesita crédito para cancelar el costo de un curso de actualización. El sueño de Nancy es no dejar de estudiar.
texts.en: Nancy lives alone in an apartment in La Paz. She is an independent consultant and needs a loan to pay for a course to update her knowledge. Her dream is to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for a course to update her knowledge.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medical drugs to sell

loans.name: Asana

texts.en:
Asana is a rural housewife. She is 26 years old. She is illiterate and can sign her name only.  Her family consists of her husband and three school-going sons.  Her husband, Jogananda, aged 50 years, is also uneducated.  He is a farmer by profession.  Their sons are in grade 9, grade 4 and grade 2.  They live in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, straw and mud) in East Magurmari in the district Jalpaiguri.  Both of them are very ambitious and want to give a good life to their children with good education.

Asana’s husband is engaged in agricultural business.  They have their own land where her husband grows different vegetables and crops in different seasons and supplies those items in the wholesale market. Now she plans to take a loan to invest in green chilli growing by buying necessary supplies like seeds, fertilizers etc. Asana decided to grow chillies because chillies are a year-round crop and are used in most Indian dishes.  So she hopes, it will be a profitable business.

In the future, she hopes to extend her business and purchase an auto-rickshaw with the profit generated to use it as another means of income.

She is very much grateful to a Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of chiilies.

loans.name: Aklima

texts.en:
Aklima is 28 years old, married and raising two daughters with her husband.  She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband Rafikul, aged 35 years, is also uneducated.  They live in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house. One of their daughters is in grade 5 and the other is under school-going age.

Aklima's husband is associated with agricultural activities and his income is very low. Aklima also tries hard to give financial support to her family. She has an animal husbandry business. But their income is hardly enough to run their family well.

Aklima has decided to start a new business.  She has applied for a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner) to start a business of supplying milk and milk products in the locality. She wants to purchase a dairy cow with the loan.  She will sell milk and milk products like curd, butter, paneer (handmade cheese) etc.  These products have a good demand in the present market. This will generate enough income to support her family.

With her drive and perseverance, Aklima would like to keep working hard to make her dreams into reality such as to give better education to her daughters and financial support to her family to lead a decent lifestyle, and to acquire more dairy cows to make a herd to get more profit from her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Shantibala

texts.en:
Shantibala is a rural housewife of 55 years. She is married to Sudhir, aged 62 years, who is a farmer by profession.  They have two children; one son and one daughter.  Their daughter is married and the son is engaged in the agribusiness with his father.  Shantibala and her husband both are uneducated and can sign their names only.  They live in their own kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made), in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Shantibala's husband is an experienced farmer. He is engaged in cultivating potatoes, chilli, beans etc.  All the family is engaged in the cultivation, because this agribusiness is the only source of income for the family.  They sell their agricultural products in the local market.  But the income is so low that they cannot meet the family's needs based on this income.

In order to continue farming activities and also to cultivate wheat in their land, Shantibala has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS. Shantibala will purchase wheat seeds, fertilizers and pesticides with the loan and will start cultivation of wheat. She has chosen this product as it has got a good demand in the present market. They hope that it will be a lucrative business and will generate a good profit.  With these earnings, she will be able to provide a better lifestyle to her family.

She aspires to purchase a plot of land in future with the profit of her business.

Shantibala and her family are thankful to the lenders (Kiva and BJS) for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: To purchase seeds of wheat and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Laili

texts.en:
Laili is 39 years old, married and raising two children (one son and one daughter) together with her husband. Her husband, Sahabuddin, aged 45 years, is engaged in agricultural activities.  Both are uneducated and can only sign their names. Their daughter is in grade 11 and the son works as a mason. They live in the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own house.

Laili’s husband grows seasonal vegetables in their ancestral land. He sells the resulting harvest in the local market. His income does not provide sufficient financial sustenance to the family. 

To provide an additional source of income, Laili is involved in animal husbandry, having started 10 years ago with a purchase of one cow. Now she has decided to expand her business by purchasing one more cow. She has taken a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow and grow her milk supply business. She hopes it will generate additional profit with which she can cover the household expenses. She plans to invest the income for further increasing domestic livestock quantities to make a herd of cattle.

She is very much thankful to her lenders (Kiva and BJS).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, iron, blocks, wood, wiring, and metal sheets.

loans.name: Futuro Para El Bien Group

texts.es:
Marcia tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos producto de su compromiso, actualmente dos de sus hijos aun dependen de ella. Ella se siente muy contenta porque gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su esposo pudo darles educación a sus hijos. Desde que pertenece al grupo Futuro Para El Bien ha aprendido muchas cosas, desde lo que es el ahorro hasta invertir para mejorar su negocio, este es un grupo maduro con mucha experiencia y compromiso. El crédito lo utilizará en comprar una mayor cantidad de pollo para vender; ya que poco a poco sus ventas se han ido incrementando y siente que necesita incrementar su oferta. Agradece a cada una de las personas que ayudan a su banquito comunal porque entiende que es una ayuda desinteresada y con buena voluntad.
En la foto se encuentra en el medio y viste una blusa color blanco.
texts.en:
Marcia is 44 years old, married, and has 5 children from her marriage. Presently, two of her children still depend on her. She feels very content because thanks to her effort and that of her husband she could give her children an education. Since she belongs to the group Futuro Para El Bien (Future For Good), she has learned many things, from what is savings to investing to improve her business. This is a mature group with a lot of experience and commitment. 

She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of chicken to sell because little by little her sales have been increasing, and she feels that she needs to boost her offer. She appreciates each and every person who helps her communal bank because she understands that it is generous assistance with good will. In the photo she is in the center and dressed in a white blouse.

loans.use: to buy more chicken for her business.
